story_txt:
Thank you for the successful campaign! Now that we no longer can take orders via Indiegogo, we have opened our web shop: http://shop.eteplate.com/ 
Nudge your portions with ETE
 
 
It’s all too easy to load up our plates and eat more than what we need.
In fact it’s been shown that we can eat 30% more when offered a large portion compared to a smaller portion despite feeling similarly full*.We created ETE because we want to help nudge people into eating portions of each food group that are neither too large, nor too little, but just right. 
 

 
Look who's talking about ETE!

 


 
“A plate that shows, in a simple graphic, how to eat a balanced meal.” FastCo 
"While portion control plates have been made before, the new design is arguably better looking." FastCo
“This amazingly designed plate can stop you from overeating” Lifehack
“It’s got a surprisingly simple design that almost makes you want to hit your head and ask yourself why you didn’t think of it first.”  Lifehack
"Though the first batch of English ETE plates are already sold out, our fingers are crossed that this awesome idea will be hitting our tables again soon." Brit+Co
 
How ETE works
 
Designed based on US and EU nutritional guidelines, ETE can be used for a meal made up of protein, vegetables and starch.
Fancy steak and chips for dinner? Sure thing. ETE’s colored lines guide you into serving just the right amount, along with your recommended portion of veggies for your meal. 
 How about a tofu and vegetable stir fry? Great choice. Place your stir fry between the blue lines, your rice/noodles between the yellow, and some extra salad between the orange lines.
 

There’s always an empty spot for you to shuffle your food around! (although you may keep it neat: it has been shown that a neatly presented meal tastes better*). 

 

Sustainability

Earlier this year, we sold 150 hand silk screen ceramic ETE plates. We loved them, but we knew we could do better. We wanted to use a material with less impact on our environment, which is why our new ETE plates are made of 95% bamboo fiber. 
Why bamboo?
Bamboo is the fastest growing woody plant in the world (growing up to 4 feet per day!) and it releases 35% more oxygen than an equivalent stand of trees. In addition, harvesting bamboo is a much better alternative to destroying native forests as tree plantations have to be chopped down to be harvested, but bamboo just keeps growing and can be re-harvested within five years.
Not easy to break - In case you drop it on the floor, it won’t shatter or chip.
Dishwasher safe – Easy to clean.
Biodegradable – At the end of it’s life, ETE is naturally compostable, resulting in less environmental damage due to landfill waste (but don’t worry, as long as you don’t bury your plate in soil, you’ll be able to use it as long as you want!) 
 
Social Good
 
At the end of our campaign, we’ll be donating one plate for every ten sold to a high school or academic institution chosen by our supporters, as we want to help foster healthy habits from an early age. 
When we reach our first 100 sales, the first 10 donated (donETE'd!) plates will go to the Yulius Academy from Rotterdam, the Netherlands. After these first 10 are given away, the other ETE plate donations will still need a loving home. If you'd like some free ETE plates for your favourite school or institution, please fill in our form to indicate your interest!  


Shipping Rate 

We know our supporters are across the world, so please check the cost to deliver ETE to your country below and add the appropriate amount to your pledge to ensure that your order gets delivered.
We realise that this can be quite fiddly, so do email us if you have any questions info@eteplate.com.At the bottom of this page we have a FAQ where we discuss how to add your shipping to your order!

We’ve chosen Shipwire’s distribution services to ensure that your ETE plates arrive safe and sound at your doorstep. We’ll be using two of their distribution warehouses - one in the US (for North America customers)  and one in the UK (for EU customers) - to help make our international deliveries a smoother process and that you get your rewards on time.   
Perks  
 
 

Please check above how much you should add for shipping.   
Timeline

The idea behind ETE plate goes back to 2008. Then after many iterations and tests, we created a small series in 2014 which sold out quickly. Less than one year later, we have everything in place for large scale manufacturing, from quality control to international distribution. We're determined to meet our deadlines, so that you can enjoy your first ETE meal in October. 

 


Risks & Challenges
Manufacturing takes tremendous effort. We've spent months hustling our way through several factories and iterating dozens of designs and samples (we've seen a lot  of plates!). At last, we've found the perfect manufacturer for producing environmentally friendly ETE plates at a high quality. 
The biggest risk, as with many crowdfunding campaigns, is delay. We're confident that we can get ETE plates to you on time. We have experience in scaling up production, shipping, and distribution (Chenting's family has been working in manufacturing for 15 years), and we've factored in some extra weeks in the timeline in case things take longer than expected.
In all, we care a lot about our supporters, and we promise we'll keep you updated on our progress.



Financial Overview

We want to be transparent to you and show you how we will use the funds raised through Indiegogo.
With the $12,500 Indiegogo funds, $7,500 will go towards production (we will cover the remaining production costs ourselves) and $5,000 is needed to deliver the ETE plates to you. 
Below you can see an overview of all costs related to selling 500 plates. 
 

As you can see, we need much more than the $12,500 we're asking for, and we are willing to invest the remainder ourselves.  Before we invest though, and have 3000 plates on our doorstep, we would like to test the market readiness for the ETE plates.

It's been exceptionally heartwarming to see how our first batch of ETE plates were used in Yulius' Thin Bizzy Project to help Yulius provide customised care and education to overweight adolescents with ADHD on healthy eating. story:
Poetry Lives Here is a special supplementary publication of Contemporary Verse 2 dedicated to supporting Canada’s younger poets ages 15-25. The publication will be put together and edited by writers who are themselves young poets and who have experience in editing and literary publication.

“But poetry and young people,” you might be saying, “those two things don’t go together!”

  Poetry isn’t just about beatniks and bongo drums, or flowers and love poems, it’s about making old ideas, feelings and words appear new again. It’s about self-expression, communication and therapy. While writing is often seen as something that requires years of experience and failure, this way of thinking makes us forget about the importance of speaking out with a new idea and listening to the younger voices that are recreating the old.

“Okay, that sounds good. But what the heck is a CV2? Why do they need my money?”

  CV2 stands for Contemporary Verse 2, which is a Canadian journal that has been publishing poetry for forty years. The staff members at CV2 know what it takes to make a good poetry magazine but they need some extra money in order to help Poetry Lives Here live… here. Any small amount you can provide will go towards funding the printing, production and editorial costs of Poetry Lives Here, which will help support and promote the younger readers and writers of the world.

“Why do young poets need their own publication? Can’t they just submit to CV2 like everyone else?”

  Actually they can. But the truth is, even on a good day, most established literary magazines in Canada are only able to publish 2% to 5% of all the submissions they receive. That doesn’t leave a lot of room for all of the serious, talented young poets out there who might need some extra help in order to make the cut. Poetry Lives Here is our attempt to give them that extra chance to be heard.

“I’m not a young poet. Why should I care?”

  Poetry Lives Here is not just about younger writers, it is also about encouraging a new generation of readers and creating a community of people who care about language, empathy and expression. Although writing can be a solitary act, the function of poetry is to bring us closer together in our understanding of one another. Your support for our campaign will be the first step in helping us create this community of poetic communication.


Got questions about the campaign/perks? Contact our coordinator John at:

PoetryLivesHere@contemporaryverse2.ca

story:
Short Summary

I'm a Steampunk / Fantasy writer (Published under the pseudonym Bia Helvetti) currently working on a new Steampunk LARP (Live Action Role Play) book which will allow seasoned LARPers and New Hands to work the wonderful world of Steampunk adventuring into their everyday lives. 

The book will be illustrated with Victorian styled photographs of Steampunks dressed as the characters from the book. All money raised in this campaign will be used to pay for the venue, costumes, make-up, props and photographs involved in this shoot. 

My aim is to create not just a book but a beautiful piece of art which will showcase the wonderful world of Steampunk and inspire would-be adventurers to dive in and explore this world for themselves. LARPing can be an expensive and sadly sporadic pastime but, with the help of the hooks in this book, readers of all ages will be able to use the skills, resources and time available to them to create fantastic adventures which they can play out with family and friends where, when and how it suits them best. 

By donating to this project you will be helping to create this beautiful, unique resource and to open up the wonderful world of Steampunk Adventuring to many more would-be Extraordinaries. 


What We Need & What You Get

All the money raised from this campaign will be put towards the purchase and hire of the costumes, props, venue and photography in order to produce stunning Victorian-style photographs to illustrate the book. 
I'm 100% passionate about Steampunk and the fabulously talented makers and creators who work within its community so I would like, where possible, to source costumes and props which have been made by members of the Steampunk community, both as a way of promoting the work of these excellent artists and also for the benefit of readers new to Steampunk who can then feel fully immersed in the culture as they begin their journey into Adventuring. 
Therefore, the more funds I raise, the more I can support these talented folks and their magnificent masterpieces and, also, the more spectacularly splendid the illustrations for the book will be. I have set £600 as my target because I know this amount will cover the basics of costumes, venue and photography. Any funds raised over this amount will be put towards purchasing more elaborate props and costumes which would really enhance the illustrations. If I don't meet the target of £600 I will still go ahead with the shoot using whatever funds I have raised and perhaps borrowing the extra to cover the costs. This is a project I am 100% committed to and I am determined to see that it is a success, no matter what that entails. 
If you chose to support this project by making a donation (great or small, every little helps!) you will receive, at the very least, a personal thankyou shout out on twitter. Everyday supporters will also be listed on the Extraordinaries website with a link to their own site or projects. Extraordinary supporters can also choose to receive a specially designed Thankyou Card featuring unique artwork from the book as well as an exclusive Extraordinaries Steampunk Tea Ring - these awesome little gadgets allow you to conveniently tote around your personal favourite brew and are a splendid talking point as part of your Steampunk attire. (Never be imposed upon by the offer of inferior tea again!)
For those of you who are Splendidly Spiffin enough to give a little more, I will personally make for you one of my famous, and much sought after, 'cuddly Colin The Octopus' - Colin is a main character in my Steampunk series Ashton's Kingdom. He escaped from the sunken city of Hull with his partner-in-crime, Eightcups Max and you can read all about his misadventures in the Steampunk section of my blog: www.childoftheisland.com. Colin is made from brown vinyl and Steampunk-print cotton and comes with his own set of removable 'gill-goggle- which enable him to breath on land - he's the perfect little companion for any Steampunkateer! 
Finally, if you decide to be Utterly Ineffable in your generosity, you will receive all of the above PLUS a signed copy of the mightily magnificent book you have helped to create!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel you'd really love to support this project but can't afford to give money that is absolutely fine - there are so many other ways you can help! Please publicise this campaign on all your social media, feel free to blog about it, tell friends and family, spread the word in any way you feel inclined, all these efforts are immeasurably valuable and hugely appreciated! 

Many Massive Thankyous for taking the time to read and support this campaign, and may all your own adventures be Extraordinary :)

story:
My Story:

Greetings!

My name is Novuyo Masakhane and I am the author of House of Jewels.

House of Jewels is a love story between two souls.    It is the telling of my relationship with my Aunt Canis` spirit and the impact her restless soul has had on my life. It is my need to know what happened in the fall of 1955.   As a child I heard bits and pieces of my aunt's story that always began with murder.  Her death appeared in several news papers across the country and in many cases it became front page news.
 
The novel is a fictional story based in truth, written in two time lines.  China and Alonzo are trying to work out their love affair with the challenge of living in different cities and balancing their emerging careers.  We travel back in time to the 1940s with Byrd as she aspires to become a famous dancer only to be met with a life she's not prepared for.

This novel documents history of a rich and endearing people both past and present, not just how they got by, but how they thrived.  It's an inquiry into African American organized crime in the 1940's and 1950's.  This is a novel about both my family's history and an essential part of America's rich and diverse cultural history. 

I'm in the last stretch of this work.  I have been writing through all of my research and discoveries for seven years.... and now I need to finish and move into the next phase which is  publishing.  But to do so, I need your help.


What We Need & What You Get

Writing is most often a solitary act, and now with Indiegogo it becomes a collaborative effort between me and you.

Your collective contributions will, 

1: allow me to work and complete this book.  
2: take a 10 day trip to Cleveland, Ohio: to do research that is crucial for completing and revising. A walk through my Aunt's life and death in Cleveland.
3:  pay for the first and second edit of the full manuscript with a professional editor.
4: Purchase Photo and video equipment: I will document my trip to Cleveland,  through  photographs and video. 
 
Two excerpts of 'House of Jewels' have been published and I have performed public readings both on the west coast and here in Texas.

On the right of this page you will see the list of perks you will receive with your pledge!  All donations will help us reach our total. While large donations are a blessing, I believe that ultimately, many small donations will play a key role in making the difference towards achieving our goal!!!

Thank you so much for your support, for visiting my page.  Every click, every share helps the project, please share with friends.

story:
Freedom From Within: Christian Self-help For New Perspectives In Overcoming Negative Thoughts is a step-by-step 3-part book by a man who hit bottom and discovered how to come out on top. Publisher Fresh Ink Group agrees to subsidize worldwide print and e-book distribution on major platforms at a very affordable cover price, but author needs help with set-up costs. This project offers a chance to help others learn how to overcome problems and live positive, productive lives in the light of Christian faith and personal responsibility. It also presents a wonderful opportunity for donors to share their own Inspiring Thoughts in a book treasured around the world. Below you will read examples of the many ways donors can share their messages, including dedicating to family members, memorializing, promoting ministries and websites, telling one’s own story, thanking others, and encouraging a favorite Christian act.

 

 


The Book

 

Freedom From Within: Christian Self-Help For New Perspectives In Overcoming Negative Thoughts is built upon the lessons discovered in the struggles of a man defeating addiction, suicidal thoughts, and a lengthy prison term—a former liar and thief and cheat who lost everything and everybody, then discovered with hard work how to change his thinking and achieve his goals.

 

The book is divided into three sections: “The Challenge of Thought: Overcoming a Negative Outlook”; “The Beginner’s Mind: How We View The World Around Us”; and “Finding Out The Truth: Who We Really Are As Christians”. Each section is divided into chapters that explain important concepts, offer examples, suggest steps for achieving goals, and cite supporting scriptures as well as the stories and advice of others who have traveled similar roads. 21 Daily Affirmations are included for those who might benefit from declaring the new perspectives for achieving the potential wonder and joy we all deserve.

 

“The Challenge of Thought: Overcoming a Negative Outlook” includes chapters on Making the Decision; Tearing Down the Barriers; Lest We Judge; View; Seeing Ourselves as God Sees Us; Confession, The Faith-Builder; Hope to the End; Attitude; Unfailing Love; Don’t Get Discouraged; Reality Check; Thinking Errors; Anger Will Distort Your Thoughts; Ready to Soar; Who’s on the Throne; and 21 Daily Affirmations.

 

“The Beginner’s Mind: How we View The World Around Us” includes chapters on Your Mind, The Enemy; In the Day of Battle; My Brain Is Screaming: The Victim Mentality; We Can Make a Difference; Who Is Your Lion?; You Are Who You Hang With; Are You Holding Back?; Who Are You When You’re Alone?; Come to My Relief; Chief Cornerstone; Judging Unfairly; Remembering Days Gone By; All My Days Have Been Ordained Of God; Search Me, God; Is the Poison on Their Lips or Ours?; Set a Guard Over My Mouth; He Can Never Be Praised Enough; The Lord Is Good to Everyone; Don’t Put Your Confidence In People; He Heals the Broken-hearted; God Is Not Impressed; Proud Versus Humble; Is My God Money and Things?; Thou Doest Know; and Conclusion.

 

“Finding Out The Truth: Who We Really Are As Christians” includes chapters on The Gospel; Spirit, Soul, and Body; Who We Are Before Christ; Spirit Man; Mind of Christ; Perspective; Temptation; Temptation Part II; and Acceptance.

 

Freedom From Within helps everybody—from those suffering great challenges to everyday folks who aspire to live ever-happier lives. It focuses on the thinking errors that trap us all in ways from subtle to obvious, and gently guides us with the tools to take control and set positive examples for everyone as we walk with God.

 

 

The Perks

 

Everybody involved with the Freedom From Within project is excited about the chance for donors to share original Inspiring Thoughts that will appear in print and e-book formats worldwide for many years to come, including major retailers such as Amazon.com and BarnesAndNoble.com. Donors who choose one, two, or three or more Inspiring Thoughts are given three full lines for each Thought. Inspiring Thoughts will appear at the bottoms of text pages or between chapters for sharing anything not deemed offensive or vulgar. Each will begin with the donor’s name or alternate designation, then follow with any of a wide variety of interesting, inspiring, heartfelt, thoughtful, dedicating, memorializing, or even commercial messages. Consider a few possible examples, each approximately 33 words long:

 

Mary Wentworth: I dedicate my contribution for this wonderful project to my beloved grandson, William J. Wentworth. I am proud of you, Billy, for inspiring us with your love and the joy you bring.

 

Kyle Stewart, Livonia, Michigan: I dedicate this book in memory of my adoring wife, Gladys. My wonderful memories of you encourage me to help share this book and your love with the world.

 

Alice & Clyde Crabtree: Matthew 16:25 inspires me most: “For whoever wishes to save his life shall lose it; but whoever loses his life for my sake shall find it.” Bless you all!

 

Waverly, Tennessee Bible Club: You don’t know a man until you walk in his shoes, but what if he has no shoes? We must all work together to feed and clothe the needy. Please, start today!

 

Tom Tessin, TTessin5@yahoo.com: I dedicate this to my loved ones, Andy Tessin, Becky Tessin, Will Collins, Hallee Tyler, Frankie Tyler, Li’l Booboo Tyler, and Pastor Wilson at Bethany Calvary Church in Topeka, Kansas.

 

Barbara Kinwell, Minister: I thank Mr. Paris for his wonderful words of inspiration. Please share your stories with me at www.XxxxYyyyyy.com and learn more about our mission connecting people who care.

 

Susan Tremont, Windsor, Canada: A book like this reminds us to share our love, just as you, Harold Tremont, have shared your love with me for fifty glorious years. Happy Anniversary, Soldier Boy!

Imagine the pride when each grandchild finds his and her own dedication in the pages of a gift book.

 

If this project is blessed with exceeding its minimum crowdfund goal, additional funds will be used for enhanced marketing to spread the word to a wider audience, to keep the cover price very low and affordable, and to aid preparations for continuing the series. This is a project we can all be proud of.

 

 

The Author: A.J. Paris

 

“I was a drug addict who was so lost and hurt that I tried to kill myself eight different times. I viewed myself as a nothing, a nobody, totally unworthy. All I wanted to do was die. I was taking several different medications for depression while starting a new prison term of seven to thirty years.

 

“Since I have begun to apply these principles, along with confessing these affirmations daily, I have managed not only to have a desire to grow. but I have reached all of my goals. I am no longer on any depression medications.

 

“Since I wrote this material, I have discovered a renewed sense of hope. This does not mean that I don’t have challenging days, because I do. However, I now look at them as building my testimony. I now look at what I can learn from my difficult days. I no longer feel God is punishing me for something I did wrong. Sometimes I simply suffer because of bad decisions.

 

“What I did, and the things I do, are not the same. I will never repeat the same mistakes. Those who refuse to learn are doomed to repeat themselves over and over.

 

“Many have read drafts of my book, and all have embraced these ideas and found themselves surprised and amazed by how they benefitted. I believe in learning and growing, and in helping others find the path to happiness. I am grateful for anyone who takes the leap of faith to help this project. We are all in this together, making our world a better place for all who share it.”

 

 

The Publisher

 

A dedicated member of the Coalition of Independent Authors and Publishers, the Fresh Ink Group (FIG) specializes in working with unique voices with important stories and ideas. Established in 1993, FIG is proud of its inspiring books, such as Been There, Noted That: Essays In Celebration Of Life: Observations, Inspiration, Remembrance, & Noteworthies To Share

by Stephen Geez. FIG offers free memberships to readers who want to receive free stories and essays, plus updates on projects such as Freedom From Within. We support A.J. Paris’s goals, and hope you will, too, with donations and by spreading the word about this worthy project to all who share your values. The Fresh Ink Group encourages everyone to discover how great it feels to be a part of helping people find happiness for all.

Freedom From Within: Christian Self-help For New Perspectives In Overcoming Negative Thoughts is a step-by-step 3-part book by a man who hit bottom and discovered how to come out on top. Publisher Fresh Ink Group agrees to subsidize worldwide print and e-book distribution on major platforms at a very affordable cover price, but author needs help with set-up costs. This project offers a chance to help others learn how to overcome problems and live positive, productive lives in the light of Christian faith and personal responsibility. It also presents a wonderful opportunity for donors to share their own Inspiring Thoughts in a book treasured around the world. Below you will read examples of the many ways donors can share their messages, including dedicating to family members, memorializing, promoting ministries and websites, telling one’s own story, thanking others, and encouraging a favorite Christian act.
 
 

The Book
 
Freedom From Within: Christian Self-Help For New Perspectives In Overcoming Negative Thoughts is built upon the lessons discovered in the struggles of a man defeating addiction, suicidal thoughts, and a lengthy prison term—a former liar and thief and cheat who lost everything and everybody, then discovered with hard work how to change his thinking and achieve his goals.
 
The book is divided into three sections: “The Challenge of Thought: Overcoming a Negative Outlook”; “The Beginner’s Mind: How We View The World Around Us”; and “Finding Out The Truth: Who We Really Are As Christians”. Each section is divided into chapters that explain important concepts, offer examples, suggest steps for achieving goals, and cite supporting scriptures as well as the stories and advice of others who have traveled similar roads. 21 Daily Affirmations are included for those who might benefit from declaring the new perspectives for achieving the potential wonder and joy we all deserve.
 
“The Challenge of Thought: Overcoming a Negative Outlook” includes chapters on Making the Decision; Tearing Down the Barriers; Lest We Judge; View; Seeing Ourselves as God Sees Us; Confession, The Faith-Builder; Hope to the End; Attitude; Unfailing Love; Don’t Get Discouraged; Reality Check; Thinking Errors; Anger Will Distort Your Thoughts; Ready to Soar; Who’s on the Throne; and 21 Daily Affirmations.
 
“The Beginner’s Mind: How we View The World Around Us” includes chapters on Your Mind, The Enemy; In the Day of Battle; My Brain Is Screaming: The Victim Mentality; We Can Make a Difference; Who Is Your Lion?; You Are Who You Hang With; Are You Holding Back?; Who Are You When You’re Alone?; Come to My Relief; Chief Cornerstone; Judging Unfairly; Remembering Days Gone By; All My Days Have Been Ordained Of God; Search Me, God; Is the Poison on Their Lips or Ours?; Set a Guard Over My Mouth; He Can Never Be Praised Enough; The Lord Is Good to Everyone; Don’t Put Your Confidence In People; He Heals the Broken-hearted; God Is Not Impressed; Proud Versus Humble; Is My God Money and Things?; Thou Doest Know; and Conclusion.
 
“Finding Out The Truth: Who We Really Are As Christians” includes chapters on The Gospel; Spirit, Soul, and Body; Who We Are Before Christ; Spirit Man; Mind of Christ; Perspective; Temptation; Temptation Part II; and Acceptance.
 
Freedom From Within helps everybody—from those suffering great challenges to everyday folks who aspire to live ever-happier lives. It focuses on the thinking errors that trap us all in ways from subtle to obvious, and gently guides us with the tools to take control and set positive examples for everyone as we walk with God.
 
 
The Perks 
 
Everybody involved with the Freedom From Within project is excited about the chance for donors to share original Inspiring Thoughts that will appear in print and e-book formats worldwide for many years to come, including major retailers such as Amazon.com and BarnesAndNoble.com. Donors who choose one, two, or three or more Inspiring Thoughts are given three full lines for each Thought. Inspiring Thoughts will appear at the bottoms of text pages or between chapters for sharing anything not deemed offensive or vulgar. Each will begin with the donor’s name or alternate designation, then follow with any of a wide variety of interesting, inspiring, heartfelt, thoughtful, dedicating, memorializing, or even commercial messages. Consider a few possible examples, each approximately 33 words long:
 
Mary Wentworth: I dedicate my contribution for this wonderful project to my beloved grandson, William J. Wentworth. I am proud of you, Billy, for inspiring us with your love and the joy you bring.
 
Kyle Stewart, Livonia, Michigan: I dedicate this book in memory of my adoring wife, Gladys. My wonderful memories of you encourage me to help share this book and your love with the world.
 
Alice & Clyde Crabtree: Matthew 16:25 inspires me most: “For whoever wishes to save his life shall lose it; but whoever loses his life for my sake shall find it.” Bless you all!

story:
Short Summary

The betrayal of Family is a story I have been writing for the past 14 months. The premises of the story is very unusual yet equally as unique. It encompasses an extremley dark & sinister theme and will certainly not be for the faint hearted reader. 

It follows Joshua, a young boy kidnapped in the middle of the night. He awakes in a foreign place and is soon to find out that his parents and younger sister have been brutally murdered. His journey to the truth charts his path over the next 20 years.

The book keeps you guessing at every turn, the main plot works in sync with many further sub plots and as the characters evolve we learn more of the sickening truth Joshua so depserately yearns for. 

The book is comprised of two Acts, essentially two endings. 

Act 1 draws an end to the story you begin reading immediately from Chapter 1 and is a valient ending in it's own right. 

Act 2 is the overall story I wanted to tell, compiling every element throughout the book and bringing them together in an explosive ending and of course, the biggest twist of them all. 

This book lies dear to my heart, not because of all the back breaking effort that has been poured into collating the tale, but because I sincerely believe the story is "one of a kind" and would be very successful in the writing industry and enjoyed by millions globally given the oppourtunity. 

Your investment is paramount to the future success. It will die a quiet death if I cannot secure the funding to take "The betrayal of Family" to the next level and beyond and I feel this would be a devasting blow to creativity everywhere. . . . 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need your help!!

I need to raise £2,600 to add to the £2,400 of my own savings. This will then allow me to make the book a reality. Any contribution (no matter how small) will make a massive difference. 

This amount covers everything from Professional editing to publishing, global marketing to electronic device compatibility, 100 copies in both hard & paper back to professional book reviews around the world. 

But as always in this life, I do not expect something for nothing. 

I want you to be rewarded for your generosity, so in return you will get some fantastic perks. These will include having your very own character named after you in the book, whose mannerisms, expressions and actions will be dictated by you, giving you your very own part of history. Personalised signed copies of the book. Dinner with the author in a Michelin stared restaurant in central London, where we can discuss anything you may like, be it my book or the latest Twilight (if you really insist) 

If we do not reach the entire goal, all proceeds will go to the final amount required to make the above happen. I will just keep working 6 days a week and saving every dime to ensure our goal is reached asap. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We don't require just money, although it is a high priority. 

There are a million ways people can help. I have absolutely no idea about the literary world, anyone with any advice, tips or contacts would be sincerely appreciated. 

You may have a friend who is a publisher? You may be able to offer your indepth knowledge on writing? There really is a number of things which could be a huge impact on the finished product and of course your efforts will equally be rewarded.

story:
Short Summary


My career as writer has primarily focused on creative nonfiction works. I’ve written and edited more than 35 books on technology, project management, and business. My heart, however, has always been in fiction. I’ve been working on this book as a hobby for years and it’s time to let the world see it. Help fund my project and you’ll be among the first to read my novel.

Imagine inheriting a massive fortune and then losing it all to gamblers and con men. That’s what happens to AJ, the protagonist in my story. My book, Dogs Playing Poker, is about collusion, cheaters, murders, and people that just aren’t very nice. Fair warning: this is a violent book. There are guns, brass knuckles, fist fights, and one scene involving a finger and some garden shears. Oh yeah, there’s also a romantic-kissy-love story.

Where the Funds Will Go:

Here’s where the funds will go for this project:

  • $750 Story editor review
  • $750 Final copy edit
  • $500 eBook cover
  • $500 eBook layout and manipulation
  • $500 Marketing and advertising

The manuscript has been written (and re-written) and just needs the final polishing before going live.

What You'll Get:

Depending on your level of investment, there are lots of good things for you:

  • Advance copy of the ebook
  • Your name in the acknowledgements
  • Your name in my blog
  • Copies of the book for your poker buddies
  • Reading at your book club or dinner

The Impact

My book isn't going to change the world, but I think it's a nice distraction from a world that can wear us down. It's an entertaining read, I believe, and the story will keep you guessing as to what's going to happen next. There's a sample from the book below...

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to see this book a reality:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about Dogs Playing Poker.
  • Invite your friends to check out the campaign
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

Dogs Playing Poker, Sample:

Barking dogs woke me.

I don’t mean little yappy dogs, but big, Nazi, bite-your-balls-off, German Shepherds, Pit Bulls, and mean, starving sons-of-bitches.

Fortunately these demon-dogs were locked in cages stacked two high to my left. I was in Carl’s old hospital, not my favorite place. The lime-green walls were caked with rust, mold, and what I guessed were long streaks of blood. My eyes followed the streaks around the room to a man crammed into a dog cage.

The man was wearing a blue suit, no shirt, no shoes. “He wouldn’t get service at 7-11,” I remember thinking. His hand had been cut off and a dog was lapping at the stump. With the morphine they’d shot into me this all seemed perfectly normal. Yeah, just perfect.

Over my head was a surgeon’s lamp. On the wall to my right, opposite of the barking dogs, there was a long table of torches, hammers, pliers, and a chainsaw. I knew what those were for. I’d seen Carl and Percy use those on what they called “clients.” Even through the drugs I knew that I was their new client.

I tried to sit up but my head was pounding. It was then I realized that I was in a straightjacket. My left arm ached and I could see that blood had soaked through the canvas. On my chest was someone’s foot.

Minus the leg.

Minus the body.

Just a foot.

My eyes darted to the man in the cage. Nope. Lucky bastard had both feet. My eyes drifted back to the foot on my chest. I could see the jagged edges of bone, hair, and yellowed toenails that needed a trim. I looked down and I couldn’t see my feet. My legs from just above the knees down to my feet were secured in some kind of a steel box.

I thought, “Did I need to trim my toenails? Is this my foot?”

Then I remembered the dream: A white rabbit with a chain saw. Carl tap dancing feet on my chest. And stacks of pancakes?

Then I remembered something not from the dream: “AJ,” Carl said, “AJ, where’s Zoe?”

“I don’t know-ie,” I said.

Miss Emma, morphine, worked my mind; they’d definitely given me too much. I remember the pancakes, the tap dances, the man with one hand, and Carl and Percy arguing.

Carl and Percy were gone. Why? It wasn’t their style to leave a client unattended. Had I said something about the money?

I couldn’t remember what I did or didn’t say, but I remembered Carl jabbing something into my left arm. A sewing needle? Yes, I’d seen him do this trick before. A needle? Doesn’t sound too bad, does it?

Let’s play.

Look at your left arm, nice and meaty, right? Good. Now imagine you have something Carl wants to know and you don’t want to tell Carl.

Big mistake.

story:
The Land Drenched in Tears is a moving history of the tumultuous years of modern China under Mao’s rule, witnessed, experienced, and told through the personal lens of an ethnic minority woman, who endured nearly 20 years imprisonment and surveillance regime as a result of her political activism in Xinjiang, or East Turkistan, located in the far west of China.

Writing her autobiography as an extraordinary melange of diary and memoir, which oscillates between first-hand narrative and flashback, the author, Söyüngül Chanisheff, traces her unfortunate youth from her university years, when she founded the East Turkistan People’s Party as a result of her anger and frustration with communist China’s devastating mishandling of the socio-economic life of the people of her native land, through her subsequent imprisonment in China’s notorious labour camps as well as under the surveillance regime, to her emigration to Australia.

Chanisheff’s autobiography is a rare, detailed, and authentic account of one of the most poignant and most fascinating periods of modern China. It is a microcosmic reflection of the communist regime’s tragic realities presented through the suffering and hope of a young woman who tied her fate to that of her beloved homeland. By boldly exploring hidden territories of modern Chinese history, it not only invites the reader to contemplate the universal topics, such as the relationship between citizen and state as well as between ethnic minority and majority, but also encourages similar stories to be told from our troubled contemporary world. This book is highly recommended for anyone who seeks to gain a deeper understanding of the many issues contemporary China faces.

*The Land Drenched in Tears was translated from Uyghur by London-based Uyghur translator and singer Rahima Mahmut. Having received English PEN Translates grant in May 2017, it will be published by Hertfordshire Press in 2018.

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Elizabeth (Lyz for short) and I'm a twenty-six year old, native, Coloradan. My eyes have seen many corners of the world - including a handful of its atrocities. Not only have my eyes seen such things, my body has experienced many of them along the way. Now, I'm willing to share about it all so that other people can know about it, without having to live it themselves.

I believe in a God who redeems everything -- because I've seen Him do that!
This is what my book is about, and I humbly admit that I need your help.

In contributing funds towards the publication of this book, you will be:

  • Helping friends and strangers realize that God actually sees them and cares about them at all times, giving purpose to their lives as they learn to leave pain behind and seek healing.
  • Aiding in people worldwide finding hope in their own similar experiences to what God has already healed me from.
  • Spreading the Good News of who Jesus Christ is and what He did in dying on the Cross!

     

What You Get & What We Need

Why help at this stage of the project? Because we dreamed up super fun perks!
(*see side panel)

 

To be transparent with you, here is the budget we have in order to achieve everything we plan to do:

Deposit    $750
Still needed for book    $2,600
Thank You notes (est. 500) (includes postage)    $150
Art supplies (shipping, distribution, canvas, paint, etc.) (est. 30 pieces)    $75
Paperback Book Fulfillment (est. 200 books) (includes shipping and distribution)    $900
Paying graphics/film people    $400
Processing fees to Indiegogo  ~ $300
Total    $5,175

*I believe that since God told me to write this book, He will provide total funding through this site and other in-person contributions.*
 

The Impact

We were each dreamed up in Heaven and created to do incredible things. Hard and challenging things, yet incredible just the same. This book is the next step to my "things". A calling on my life is vulnerability. I have been hurt numerous ways throughout my life... and I have broken all those bonds of hurt, slavery, and unforgiveness, wrote about the process, and I NEED to share the story now!! There is provision for the ones living check to check, hardly making rent. There is healing for the emotionally and sexually abused. There is hope for the depressed and suicidal. Only thanks to the Lord am I here now to tell the world about it!

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest "risk" I face by releasing this book is sharing everything behind who I am with the entire world. This is transparency and vulnerability to the core. Strangers are going to know everything about me and I will know absolutely nothing about them. This is what I'm learning to be okay with: man does not validate me, Christ does. Being God's beloved daughter is the only thing that defines me. Resting in this truth first and then finding support in my friends is how I'll overcome this challenge. God is faithful.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please commit to pray for this project!
  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign -- share the URL all across your social media outlets, please! One way to do this is to use the Indiegogo share tools towards the top right of this page.


THANK YOU for all of your support - prayer, financial, sharing this link.
With love,
Elizabeth.

story:
My Story

A Mixing Pot of Poems For Thought is a book of rhyming poetry about the process of finding oneself through love, heartbreak, and simple experiences that make us all human.

My name is Lauren Stikeleather and I am the author of A Mixing Pot of Poems For Thought. I wrote this book because I grew up loving rhyme and have developed a passion for rhyming poetry over the years . This is a skill I have honed for a long time and want to share with the world. However, I have found that the majority of the adult world doesn’t believe rhyming can be a mature genre of reading, and I want to prove that it can be. Additionally, I wrote this book to convey the many lessons I have learned over the years from my life experiences, which I feel that I express uniquely due to the nature of my writing.

My hope is that, by reading this book, you will discover that we all have a lot more in common than we think. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with certain unspoken truths in our society and discover the wonders of rhythm and rhyme in poetry.

In this book, you’ll join me in using language to render distinct aspects of love and growth through poems like:

“One and the Same,” which talks about how we are all so similar in desiring love, but also in our fear of it. I like this piece because it’s about the process of learning that we are independent in our journey, but never alone. At some point, we all will inevitably collide with someone who is a kindred spirit, solely because we know ourselves and what we want. This poem emphasizes the best kinds of growth and discovery.

“Done” is the ultimate “strike back” poem. It’s about no longer tolerating negative treatment from anyone, romantic or otherwise. So much of what this poem contains are things I’ve heard people close to me say at one point or another—it’s a poem of utter frustration, but also growth. This piece’s rhythm helps build the message as it flows, and the ending is pointed: I’m done. This is one of the most relatable poems in the whole book.

“Smartest Person In The Room” is a poem that’s quite timely, especially for younger generations. It’s about defining intelligence in a less conventional form: being people-smart. I think this poem demonstrates an alternate perspective on humanity and empathy and highlights the very high value of being able to read a room of people and navigate it correctly. It’s a synthesis of things I’ve learned and observed from people in my life doing things both right and wrong, and it’s a perspective I believe to be vital to have.


You will love this book if...

You like to relate to the work that you read. This book is meant for anyone, but the first few sections focus on the experiences of young adult women in the modern world. I personally love reading things that make me feel like I’m not alone in what I’m feeling, so if you’re that kind of person, this book is 100% for you. You’ll also love it if you love rhyme and rhythm, and consistency in tone. Also, if you like work that is direct yet still requires some deep thinking, you will really enjoy this book. I personally struggle to interpret certain kinds of poetry, so I’ve written mine in a straightforward manner that still contains deeper meaning — a happy medium of sorts.

A Mixing Pot of Poems For Thought speaks to young adults who want to grapple with developing societal norms and optimism in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that A Mixing Pot of Poems For Thought inspires reflection and dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

How can I change my perspective from half empty to half full?

What are the parts of people I’m not seeing by just looking at them?

Why are we so narrow-minded in the way we perceive emotion?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers.

 

The Book Structure

A Mixing Pot of Poems For Thought is written in 2 Parts:

Part I: The Ingredients contains the introduction and Chapters 1-3: 1) Discovering Sweet, 2) Tasting the Salt, 3) Adding the Spice. This part will discuss how love grows and develops in many ways and is everything but straightforward. It’s a process that takes time and involves getting to know yourself before getting involved romantically with someone else. Although relationships can end in heartbreak, which can hurt, over time, this leads to empowerment and the discovery of new kinds of strength.

Part II: The Cooking contains Chapters 4 and 5: 4) Stirring in Savory and 5) Creating New Recipes. This part will show how we are all tied together by how we experience the world, and how much of our happiness is contingent on our ability to understand both ourselves and other people simultaneously. Additionally, it touches on how life is full of so many small, good things, and that there is so much living to do every day.

What I Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 170 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 205 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 275 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

Pre-Sale Rewards
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A digital copy of my book
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • The opportunity to join my beta-reader community
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • Your name will appear in a special, Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

About The Author

Lauren Stikeleather is a recent graduate of Boston University and will be starting work for the TJX Companies Inc. in Framingham, MA this fall. She graduated summa cum laude with a degree in Communications and has been excited to put her creativity to work in the real world, both with this book and in her other professional endeavors. She has always had a passion for words and rhymes, and has been determined to become a poetry author since her early days of writing.

Lauren wrote this book because poetry is her favorite outlet for expression, and she believes that rhyming is the most beautiful puzzle she has ever had to solve. She loves taking a new perspective on commonplace topics and stirring things up with rhythm and unconventional word choices — it keeps her on her feet and gives her an immense feeling of accomplishment when she finishes a poem.

Lauren is a Boston-area native who loves to tell stories and who loves getting a good laugh out of people. She is the oldest of three sisters and is known in her family for her love of green tea, dessert, and the beach.

For more information you can connect with Lauren by email at lrstikes@gmail.com, connect with her on LinkedIn, and follow her on Instagram at both her personal account @lrstikes and on her poetry account @mixingpotofpoems.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #mixingpotofpoems and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Lauren Stikeleather

story:
Leadership Journey

I have lived in San Diego for sixteen years and am committed to being a leader in the community. My last nine years in the nonprofit sector have trained me to understand that change does not happen by one person alone and that success is defined by working with other leaders in the community from all industries. I am honored to  have been selected into the competitive leadership IMPACT program at LEAD San Diego.

About LEAD

For over 30 years, LEAD San Diego has provided participants an opportunity to meet and network with key San Diego leaders in business, civic, government, military and nonprofit sectors. Participants graduate from the program with a greater understanding of the issues that affect the region; a stronger sense of personal leadership; and will have learned the "big picture" of San Diego's past, present and future. This 9 month program offers me an opportunity to continue the work I have been doing in the community and to broaden the impact I have. If you would like to learn more about the program, you can visit their website at www.leadsandiego.org.


How Can You Help?

My employer, United Way of San Diego, has graciously offered to support a portion of my tuition and I am asking if you would help me raise the remaining $2,000. You can make a contribution to this page.

The Impact
LEAD IMPACT participants graduate from the program with a greater understanding of the issues that affect the region; a stronger sense of personal leadership and will have learned the "big picture" of San Diego's past, present and future.
  • 97% of IMPACT graduates said they are likely to get more involved in civic and community organizations after LEAD.
  • 97% of IMPACT graduates claim they have a stronger understanding of regional themes and contemporary community issues.
  • 99% of IMPACT graduates shared that they developed an exemplary network of colleagues and collaborators by participating in the program
Other ways to help:
  • Spread the word!
  • Share this site with others who might be interested

Want to learn more?

Feel free to call me at (619) 929-1363 or email me at adina.veen@yahoo.com

story:
It's time to celebrate!!!

10 years ago the journey began when I answered a Craigslist ad to write two articles and conducted my first interview. It gave me goose bumps - I was instantly hooked. From that moment on my path wandered through the ups and downs of writing, becoming an editor, co-owning a magazine and then signing with Influence Publishing to write  my first book. A ten year journey to reach this moment, 18 months birthing the manuscript and now it's almost here!  My first book - Life Outside the Box.

Everyone likes to hear the inside skinny on how others live - hence the many Reality TV shows (although let's face it - most have nothing to do with reality.)  After completing more than 100 interviews - I have learned one important fact. There is no normal. We all live unique lives and define success in our very own way.

How exciting to now have a chance to share all those behind the scene stories from ten of my favourite interviews - material that just wasn't right for a short magazine article.  Included are Ruthie Davis (luxury shoe designer), Katherine Soucie (textile artist and eco fashion designer), Geir Ness (Laila perfume and skin care), Patricia Fieldwalker (luxury lingerie designer), Pamela Masik (artist), Shane Koyczan (spoken word poet), Lisa-Marie Mazzucco (photographer), Carolyn MacGillivray (founder of Beauty Night), William Orlowski (Canadian tap icon) and Julie Salisbury (publisher).  The ten stories shared here have joy, sorrow, challenge, rebirth and more.  These are Real People leading Real Lives and listening to each of them has changed my life.

As I didn't choose to go the normal publishing route, this campaign is about creating celebratory launches that honours all the amazing people who have mentored, supported and cheered me on through this journey. There are books to print, professionals to hire, locations to be scheduled and more than anything - events to create that will leave the doors open as wide as possible.  I want everyone who wants to be there included.

NOTE - While the first launch is planned in Vancouver - I am looking at launches in other locations. 

    Other Ways You Can Help -

    Help is always welcome by spreading the word about this book whether by letting people know about this campaign, or by sharing links to the online stores that have already set up pre-sales. It is by working together to raise each other that we all succeed - UJAMAA!

    United States - 

    Barnes and Noble - http://bit.ly/1tOgXf0

    Amazon - http://amzn.to/1lhShuT

    Canada -

    Chapters Indigo - Available here shortly

    Amazon - http://amzn.to/1paogs8

    Quote -

    "Everyone has a story to tell - it's just a matter of asking the right questions." - Marilyn R. Wilson

Campaign Update:

Thank you all who have already joined my journey!  As you can see, we've exceeded the original campaign goal. All pre-orders will receive a paperback copy in December. 

My publisher has challenged me to reach a "stretch goal" of $6,000.  If I reach that point, the book will be printed in hardcover in April.

Anything beyond $6,000 will be donated to The Charlie Foundation for Ketogenic Therapies, without whom this book would not exist.   

 

Story of My Book

My Unremarkable Brain: Adventures in Fitness, Health and Epilepsy tells the stories of people with chronic conditions who are thriving and living their best lives thanks to real food and a healthy lifestyle.

My name is David Robinson and I am the author of My Unremarkable Brain. When I was diagnosed with epilepsy, I wanted to find the best way to live and thrive with my condition.  This book is the result of that journey.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover your own path to optimal health. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for food and health. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you live your best life.

You'll learn about how I discovered the link between lifestyle and health by talking to people like:

  • Jim Abrahams, the Hollywood producer whose discovery of the ketogenic diet in an obscure medical textbook led to an end to his son's seizures, and a revolution in epilepsy patient care
  • Krishna Kaliannan, an entrepreneur who was able to turn his diagnosis into a successful food company with millions of dollars in annual revenue
  • Dr, Eric Kossoff, a leading voice of the ketogenic diet in the epilepsy community

You will love this book if, like me, you love food, you want to be healthy, or you’re just sick of “sick care” and ready for a revolution in health care.

My Unremarkable Brain is a non-fiction book that speaks to any of the 60% of Americans who are living with chronic disease, and anyone who’s interested in cutting through the hype and finding a path to better health and their best lives.

The Book - My Unremarkable Brain


The book is written in 3 Parts.

Part 1, “Fat on the Body,” is the story of how, in middle age, I became a “fathlete,” a serial dieter, and how I finally found a better way to eat and live. It also gives readers insights into the scam-ridden world of the weight-loss industry, and timeless wisdom for eating well.

Part 2, “Fat on the Brain,” is about how I discovered the Ketogenic diet, a now-popular “fad diet” that has been helping people with epilepsy for 100 years, yet is still largely unknown, even to many neurologists. It gives an overview of the science and history behind the Ketogenic diet and tells the stories of those who bucked the system and used food to live fuller, more confident lives.

Part 3, “Fat on the Mind,” analyzes the lessons that I’ve learned along the way, and addresses some of the myths about diet and health that pervade our culture. It gives readers information and inspiration that they can use to find their own path to optimal health, wellness, and happiness.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication (you know, all that English-y stuff)
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter
  • Once these costs are covered, any funds raised will go to The Charlie Foundation for Ketogenic Therapies

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book ($5,000), I will publish.

When I pre-sell 155 copies of my book ($6,000), I will also publish a hardcover edition. 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now. When I publish, you will receive the following:

  • A personally signed copy of my book 
  • Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • A booklet of some of my favorite, Keto-friendly recipes
  • Membership in a thoughtful, positive community of readers who help and support one another in their health journeys
  • The opportunity to give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover and title
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
  • A gift package featuring my favorite organic olive oil from Testa’s Pantry in Schenectady, NY
  • A chance to win one of five gift boxes of my favorite “brain foods"

 

About the Author

David Robinson is an educator, writer, masters-level competitive rower, and lover of Buffalo wings. When he was diagnosed with epilepsy as an adult, he became curious about the connection between physical health and brain health. He began to read voraciously in an attempt to understand his disorder and to find a way to live a life he loves. Passionate about teaching others, he wrote this book to help educate and inspire others about the connection between food, lifestyle, and health. 

For more information, you can contact David at drobinsonwrites@gmail.com, or at @drobinsonwrites on Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #MyUnremarkableBrain and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

​Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!


Thanks again,
Big Dave

story:
Short Summary


My name is Linda Saether and I am the author of The Angel of the Penny Rose. My inspiration for this book was one sentence I recalled from a historical tour of old St.Augustine, Florida, a long time ago. It was related to the treatment of widows without means, who were told to remarry within sixty days, or be sent back to England on the next ship to arrive. Need I say that seafaring in those days was challenging, at best? But, as I said in the video, this is only the beginning.

The story starts in the 1760s when Anna meets Edmund Ashton in her father’s apothecary. He is a doctor headed to St. Augustine, East Florida to take on a post at the infirmary, and Anna is intrigued by the thought of everything he will learn in this new world. As a girl, she can’t become an apothecary, but she is probably the best one in London, for her father taught her well. Before Edmund sets out for the Americas, Anna becomes his bride, and they leave England full of hopes and dreams for a life of adventure and discovery, but before they set foot in their new home of St. Augustine, their journey teaches them unexpected lessons that will lead to tragedy, sending Anna into a world of deceit and treachery that she has no choice but to face, but does she have the courage to reach for her hearts true desire?

 

What We Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. Their team has been outstanding in making all this possible, and helping me make my book the best it can be. It would be fantastic to repay some of their efforts with a truly great pre-launch, which will occur as book sales rise and supporters join us!  

Money raised will go towards the following:
- The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
- The final cover design of my book. 
- The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
- The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
- The launch & promotion efforts for my book when it is ultimately publish this fall, 2021.


Publication will take place in stages, so when we pre-sell 120 copies of my book, we will publish a paperback and ebook. When we pre-sell 150 copies of my book, we will also publish an audiobook! When we pre-sell 200 copies of my book, we will publish a hardcover!

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when it is published.

Your name could appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me feedback before the last edit.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover. It takes more than a pretty picture!

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

Risks & Challenges

A challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the buyers, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies within the US into each pre-order tier.  

I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure the pre-order rewards come to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale buyers up-to-date as to when my book will publish, and we will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 Should we for any reason not meet our goals during this campaign, we will continue marketing and fine-tuning the book until publication day to make sure you will be among the first to receive the book, and in the meantime our journey will continue.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't buy the book now, or join my team, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #theangelofthepennyrose and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends or more, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

And that's all there is to it!

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support.

 

ABOUT THE AUTHOR
Linda Saether is a Norwegian/American novelist, blogger, screenwriter and playwright, who has also written historical articles based on her own journey to unearth treasures hidden in the Vatican archives for hundreds of years. As the daughter of sea-faring parents, one of her favorite memories was being on board the Christian Radich, a full rigged ship built in Norway, which inspired an episode in her new book The Angel of the Penny Rose.

story:
Dreams of a African Boy

My name is Mawuna Koutonin. I'm the founder of Silicon  Africa. I was born in a family where neither my father or my mother could read or write. It happened that when I was 7 my parents go divorced, and I was left with my father who owned a small retail shop in the center of our village. My father wanted me to spend time with him, but like most traditional fathers, he never knew what to tell me when we sat together except when he would spot an opportunity to lecture me.

From 7, unlike the other children in my village, I’d spend most of my time reading behind my father's shop counter.  Sometimes, I’d suddenly emerge, and stretch my body to relax my muscles. Those sudden “emergencies” from behind the counter got me the most famous nickname in the village “The Hippopotamus”.

Yeah, at that age I’d absorb anything in print that I could find. There were barely enough books in my village for my voracious reading appetite. I was even able to finish the whole Bible (more than 1000 pages), which in fact was the easiest book to get because it was the only gift the German missionaries never forgot to bring with them in their numerous visits.

For me, school was the most boring thing that ever happened to me, but I have to admit that the only virtue I found in school was putting together people who are hungry to learn, and accidentally some good teachers who could point the children into the right direction.

Our stories written by others 

I remember that in school we were taught examples of the advantages of colonization for Africa. Because the books were written by Europeans they portrayed themselves as the saviour of the African, bringing them to civilization and enlightenment. However, I’d later learn the real story of Africa, which was not taught at all, and found out that colonization was mainly a looting system designed to steal and exploit the local people and their resources.

So, the question is Why aren’t Africans writing more books for themselves?

Currently only 2% of the content written on Africa and about Africa is produced by Africans. 98% is done by non-Africans, which means Africans see themselves mainly trough the eyes of outsiders. This is the reason why it's important that we empower more content creation by our people with more diversity.

With less than 2% of the narratives on Africa written by Africans for Africans, everywhere I turn, I see a huge demand for local content. From local movie production to local artists focusing their work on ordinary African people. 

A first step, some little effort with fruit

I started Silicon Africa 4 years ago with the firm intention to bring new perspectives to the African narrative, but also to empower a new generation of Africans with a higher level of awareness about the world in which we live.

I’ve put up my money, and dedicated countless hours to write articles. Any single article you read on Silicon Africa takes 3 to 5 hours to be completed after the story has been researched. I personally write from 2 to 3 articles a week. No one is paid for writing for Silicon Africa, all the work is done

benevolently.

With that dedication, Silicon Africa became the most influential blog in Africa during the last 12 months, and every day we reach several thousands of African entrepreneurs, activists and Africans in the diaspora. And some our articles have been translated into Lingala, Swahili, Chinese, Japanese, French, and Arabic.

The day is coming where Africans will not feel the need to listen to the BBC, CNN, RFI and all of the other foreign media, but will be happy to have good local content, where the joy of reading and learning will return to every African family.

Helps us continue

Our goal now is to continue this work but bigger, better and stronger, with the purpose to cover more countries in Africa and subjects. But, in order to do so, we need your help. I’m asking you to make a donation to Silicon Africa to help us continue.

“It does not require a majority to prevail, but rather an irate, tireless minority keen to set brush fires in people’s minds..” - Samuel Adams

“Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter. - Martin Luther King

If you believe in what we are doing, and you want to help us continue, use the form below to make a donation.

Our Goals 

Isn't SiliconAfrica like any other blog? 

No. We are not in the business to please advertisers in order to make money but to change lives in Africa, to empower our people to become self-reliant, to challenge the state quo. 

Here are messages from our readers: 

"I have never seen anything like Silicon Africa. It's unapologetically honest writing and investigative journalism is refreshing. I am a journalist for the Maroon Tiger at Morehouse College here in Atlanta, Georgia. I would love to start contributing as soon as I can.” - Nebiyu Fitta 

"I came across your website and am really delighted and inspired by the work you are doing. Your work is sacred and we must not rest until we have collectively created the real Africa. this is our sacred duty untrusted to us by our ancestors and the creator." - Tito Alai

"I have just listened to your interview on `The People`s Voice` and am so pleased to discover the content of SiliconAfrica. I have been writing a book about the underdevelopment of Africa and have found there is an even greater cover-up in the African media, even greater than the cover-up/silence in European media. So to find your site is fantastic. " - Pippa Lawton 

"I used to think i was the only one in the world who viewed Africans as consumers and not the masters of their destinies. As an Entrepreneur myself, I see so many gaps for wealth creation and development with employment opportunities for African youths. SiliconAfrica, keep it up. I must say that i was very impressed upon reading this article regarding profitable start-up ideas in Africa that you published in 2012. Your insight definitely empowers me as a young born and raised African." -Michael Onukwuli 

"I am impressed by the information I receive from SiliconAfrica.com, a much needed platform for information today. I have worked in the tech space in Nairobi, but want to go into social entrepreneurship, especially in the area of Agriculture and Agroprocessing. I would be glad to join you in any endeavors for training entrepreneurs as a trainer." - Lacine Camara

"Oh, my god!!! If only the African leaders had your way of thinking or a whiff of such thought; the whole continent of Africa would be a better place." - Graham Ingokho Muhanga

"Thank you so much for sharing your insights on siliconafrica.com and i can tell you that i am not only inspired but also challenged. I am originally from Uganda but living in the United States. Having graduated from public health and working in corporate America for a while, i realize that there Uganda and Africa need my skills" - Victoria Mutebi

"I've read a couple of your articles on innovation in Africa and find them extremely interesting. I am working on a project in government to support Innovation across all sectors in Lagos and what I've being trying to target is something along the lines of what you have been writing about" - Moji Rhodes, Deputy Chief of Staff, Governor’s Office, Lagos House 

"I run a diplomatic community print magazine in Zimbabwe. We distribute bi-monthly to all Ambassadors in Zimbabwe, Zambia and South African including NGOs, Government, Professionals and Universities. I came across your work and research papers online and I am touched at your initiatives. I was particularly impressed and yet shocked by your discoveries on the Francophone Countries Tax issue. It is a sad reality that Africa needs to Think about and get out of. I am therefore kindly requesting for your permission to republish the article for our March print issue.  - Marvin Madyara

"I read a text of you at  www.dewereldmorgen.be (belgium) , I’m very surprised and glad that someone write the truth. The world need persons who write the truth about colonialism and exploitation." Januario Silva

"I recently came across this website SiliconAfrica.com , and read some of your articles. I am also a young African from The Gambia, soon about to finish my graduate studies in Aeronautics Engineering from Taiwan, all my dream is to go back to my country and invest my knowledge there. I wish we have many people like you. I just want to tell you, to keep up the work and i will be a keen follower of your articles." -Kebba Jaiteh

"Put your money where your mouth is African people, information is expensive not cheap. I believe in this brother, if we can all think like this brother , the African Renaissance will happen in no time . Everybody dig into your pockets and let's keep this platform going... We are at war in this age of information African people. Nobody will change Africa but Africans." -Koffi De Lome

"This site is one I consult on a regular basis and I think it is a very effective tool of education of our people. It seems to me that it is a very successful tool in our fight to emancipate Africa from all foreign impediments." Imhotep Lesage

"I am so short of words to explain to you how grateful I am to you for putting this together. The points are so On point Mawuna, I have been thinking of putting together a training manual to help the youth in Nigeria change their mindset, teach them about who they are/should be as Africans etc etc etc. Articles like yours is really going to help me channel my thoughts. Don't stop talking plssssss." - Sandra Onarii Opusunju

"Thanks once more Mawuna for this stimulation and empowerment. You need to go on air with this brother, more people should become aware. We need strong African Presses that will serve solely to debunk the lies of Western press, and also go further to bring forward rich and inspiring information such as this to all of Africa. You can ask for funds and I will give without thinking! I salute you all my fellow Africans. Thanks again Mawuna" - Thomas Ngonde

"Since I started browsing the web whenever I read a good article I try to share with my friends, talk about the article, discuss about in the occasions but never tried to write to the author (I am lazy!). This time I must write.

After reading two of your articles, I just couldn't do my ordinary tasks rather busy on thinking and sharing with friends.
