story_txt:
Dreams of a African Boy 
My name is Mawuna Koutonin. I'm the founder of Silicon  Africa. I was born in a family where neither my father or my mother could read or write. It happened that when I was 7 my parents go divorced, and I was left with my father who owned a small retail shop in the center of our village. My father wanted me to spend time with him, but like most traditional fathers, he never knew what to tell me when we sat together except when he would spot an opportunity to lecture me.
From 7, unlike the other children in my village, I’d spend most of my time reading behind my father's shop counter.  Sometimes, I’d suddenly emerge, and stretch my body to relax my muscles. Those sudden “emergencies” from behind the counter got me the most famous nickname in the village “The Hippopotamus”.
Yeah, at that age I’d absorb anything in print that I could find. There were barely enough books in my village for my voracious reading appetite. I was even able to finish the whole Bible (more than 1000 pages), which in fact was the easiest book to get because it was the only gift the German missionaries never forgot to bring with them in their numerous visits.
For me, school was the most boring thing that ever happened to me, but I have to admit that the only virtue I found in school was putting together people who are hungry to learn, and accidentally some good teachers who could point the children into the right direction.
   Our stories written by others  
I remember that in school we were taught examples of the advantages of colonization for Africa. Because the books were written by Europeans they portrayed themselves as the saviour of the African, bringing them to civilization and enlightenment. However, I’d later learn the real story of Africa, which was not taught at all, and found out that colonization was mainly a looting system designed to steal and exploit the local people and their resources.
So, the question is Why aren’t Africans writing more books for themselves?
Currently only 2% of the content written on Africa and about Africa is produced by Africans. 98% is done by non-Africans, which means Africans see themselves mainly trough the eyes of outsiders. This is the reason why it's important that we empower more content creation by our people with more diversity.
With less than 2% of the narratives on Africa written by Africans for Africans, everywhere I turn, I see a huge demand for local content. From local movie production to local artists focusing their work on ordinary African people. 
  A first step, some little effort with fruit  
I started Silicon Africa 4 years ago with the firm intention to bring new perspectives to the African narrative, but also to empower a new generation of Africans with a higher level of awareness about the world in which we live.
I’ve put up my money, and dedicated countless hours to write articles. Any single article you read on Silicon Africa takes 3 to 5 hours to be completed after the story has been researched. I personally write from 2 to 3 articles a week. No one is paid for writing for Silicon Africa, all the work is done
benevolently.
With that dedication, Silicon Africa became the most influential blog in Africa during the last 12 months, and every day we reach several thousands of African entrepreneurs, activists and Africans in the diaspora. And some our articles have been translated into Lingala, Swahili, Chinese, Japanese, French, and Arabic.
The day is coming where Africans will not feel the need to listen to the BBC, CNN, RFI and all of the other foreign media, but will be happy to have good local content, where the joy of reading and learning will return to every African family.
  Helps us continue 
Our goal now is to continue this work but bigger, better and stronger, with the purpose to cover more countries in Africa and subjects. But, in order to do so, we need your help. I’m asking you to make a donation to Silicon Africa to help us continue.“It does not require a majority to prevail, but rather an irate, tireless minority keen to set brush fires in people’s minds..” - Samuel Adams“Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter. - Martin Luther KingIf you believe in what we are doing, and you want to help us continue, use the form below to make a donation.Our Goals Isn't SiliconAfrica like any other blog? No. We are not in the business to please advertisers in order to make money but to change lives in Africa, to empower our people to become self-reliant, to challenge the state quo. Here are messages from our readers: 
"I have never seen anything like Silicon Africa. It's unapologetically honest writing and investigative journalism is refreshing. I am a journalist for the Maroon Tiger at Morehouse College here in Atlanta, Georgia. I would love to start contributing as soon as I can.” - Nebiyu Fitta 


"I came across your website and am really delighted and inspired by the work you are doing. Your work is sacred and we must not rest until we have collectively created the real Africa. this is our sacred duty untrusted to us by our ancestors and the creator." - Tito Alai
"I have just listened to your interview on `The People`s Voice` and am so pleased to discover the content of SiliconAfrica. I have been writing a book about the underdevelopment of Africa and have found there is an even greater cover-up in the African media, even greater than the cover-up/silence in European media. So to find your site is fantastic. " - Pippa Lawton 
"I used to think i was the only one in the world who viewed Africans as consumers and not the masters of their destinies. As an Entrepreneur myself, I see so many gaps for wealth creation and development with employment opportunities for African youths. SiliconAfrica, keep it up. I must say that i was very impressed upon reading this article regarding profitable start-up ideas in Africa that you published in 2012. Your insight definitely empowers me as a young born and raised African." -Michael Onukwuli 
"I am impressed by the information I receive from SiliconAfrica.com, a much needed platform for information today. I have worked in the tech space in Nairobi, but want to go into social entrepreneurship, especially in the area of Agriculture and Agroprocessing. I would be glad to join you in any endeavors for training entrepreneurs as a trainer." - Lacine Camara
"Oh, my god!!! If only the African leaders had your way of thinking or a whiff of such thought; the whole continent of Africa would be a better place." - Graham Ingokho Muhanga
"Thank you so much for sharing your insights on siliconafrica.com and i can tell you that i am not only inspired but also challenged. I am originally from Uganda but living in the United States. Having graduated from public health and working in corporate America for a while, i realize that there Uganda and Africa need my skills" - Victoria Mutebi
"I've read a couple of your articles on innovation in Africa and find them extremely interesting. I am working on a project in government to support Innovation across all sectors in Lagos and what I've being trying to target is something along the lines of what you have been writing about" - Moji Rhodes, Deputy Chief of Staff, Governor’s Office, Lagos House 
"I run a diplomatic community print magazine in Zimbabwe. We distribute bi-monthly to all Ambassadors in Zimbabwe, Zambia and South African including NGOs, Government, Professionals and Universities. I came across your work and research papers online and I am touched at your initiatives. I was particularly impressed and yet shocked by your discoveries on the Francophone Countries Tax issue. It is a sad reality that Africa needs to Think about and get out of. I am therefore kindly requesting for your permission to republish the article for our March print issue.  - Marvin Madyara
"I read a text of you at  www.dewereldmorgen.be (belgium) , I’m very surprised and glad that someone write the truth. The world need persons who write the truth about colonialism and exploitation." Januario Silva
"I recently came across this website SiliconAfrica.com , and read some of your articles. I wish we have many people like you. I just want to tell you, to keep up the work and i will be a keen follower of your articles." -Kebba Jaiteh
"Put your money where your mouth is African people, information is expensive not cheap. I believe in this brother, if we can all think like this brother , the African Renaissance will happen in no time . Everybody dig into your pockets and let's keep this platform going... We are at war in this age of information African people. Nobody will change Africa but Africans." -Koffi De Lome
"This site is one I consult on a regular basis and I think it is a very effective tool of education of our people. It seems to me that it is a very successful tool in our fight to emancipate Africa from all foreign impediments." Imhotep Lesage
"I am so short of words to explain to you how grateful I am to you for putting this together. The points are so On point Mawuna, I have been thinking of putting together a training manual to help the youth in Nigeria change their mindset, teach them about who they are/should be as Africans etc etc etc. Articles like yours is really going to help me channel my thoughts. Don't stop talking plssssss." - Sandra Onarii Opusunju
"Thanks once more Mawuna for this stimulation and empowerment. You need to go on air with this brother, more people should become aware. story:
In The Wild Cats of Piran, writer, actor, and filmmaker Scott Alexander Young traces the (nine) lives of a tight-knit group of feral felines in a charming town on Slovenia's Adriatic coast near Italy. Conjuring up the best of classic stories about creatures we love, and with nine full-page stunning color illustrations, this planned trilogy takes us through centuries in the life of the Mediterranean and Adriatic Seas. As they journey over the centuries from Naples, Italy, to Piran, readers will meet a pirate named Edward England (and his parrot, Desmond), the ghost of composer-violinist Giuseppe Tartini, a cat that yearns for his former life on the Hungarian plains, a nice young (human) couple who help out the cats in their battle against the rats, and much more. Woven seamlessly into the story are humorous observations about twenty-first century teenagers' technology-driven lives and about people's--and dogs'--complex relationships with their feline friends. 

Age-appropriate for just about anyone from nine to one-hundred and nine who is enchanted by charming Old World settings and who, yes, doesn't hate cats, The Wild Cats of Piran--from the just-published Chronicle One to the planned second and third volume of the trilogy--represents truly magical reading. Each volume will also be beautiful to look at and to hold.

But that's just part of the story.

Publishing it is quite another matter. Taking on the task is Young Europe Books--a new imprint of New Europe Books, a small, independent publisher located in a small town in the Berkshire hills of Massachusetts. 

The first volume of the trilogy--The Wild Cats of Piran: Chronicle One--just went on sale across North America in October. But it needs vital publicity support to be noticed! That means funds to get word out there through social media, print ads, media mailings, and other promotions. Minus that, readers won't know about it, especially during the holiday season, and it may end up being returned by the bookstores to the warehouse next year--every small press's nightmare. 

The next volume could appear a year from now--BUT funds are needed to compensate the author and the illustrator alike! 

Granted, we are distributed by Penguin Random House Publisher Services--they trust in the quality of our books and do a lot to sell it to the bookstores--but being 100% independent budget-wise (we scrape by month-to-month out of our small office in rural Massachusetts), it is beyond our means to adequately publicize our books so they are actually impact the world. Who gets the bill for if books that Penguin Random House initially "sells through" to the big wholesalers and to Barnes & Noble and Amazon then get sent back to the warehouse months later? We do. Of course. With all due respect to their fine sales representatives, Penguin Random House meanwhile gets to keep its commission on sales. Of course.

In short, we can use your support to bring this volume and the second--and, we hope, the third--in the Wild Cats trilogy truly to life. Publisher Paul Olchvary thanks you, as do author and cat connoisseur Scott Alexander Young and the Swiss/Italian illustrator Moreno Chistè, whose brilliant color drawings grace the pages of The Wild Cats of Piran: Chronicle One.

A final note: 

New Europe Books appreciates its community near and far. Hence we aim to donate up to 10 cartons (24 books/carton) of Wild Cats and other books to schools far and wide--thus providing cultural experiences from a region that, lately, has unfortunately gotten all too much bad press (read: Cold War and, more recently, Ukraine). Some of your contribution will go toward this, while also helping us to publicize Wild Cats to those outside of the community through Facebook, Twitter and other avenues. 

By supporting this particular series, your donation will also help to ensure a stable future for New Europe as we continue to give back and spread the unheard words of "the other half" of Europe.

One last final note (really, this time): This is our first such fundraising campaign, so if we've failed to make it purr-fect in any respect, that's why. So please overlook the clunkiness. Please do donate. Thank you.

ABOUT THE AUTHOR

Scott Alexander Young is a TV scriptwriter, writer, and actor from New Zealand who lives in Budapest, Hungary. He is the creator and writer of Max’s Midnight Movies, an AXN Original Production of a twenty-six-part TV series about cult cinema classics. Meanwhile, in the guise of character actor, Young has shown up in movies and TV series such as Dracula, Fleming, and Houdini. As reflected in Chronicle One of his Wild Cats trilogy, his written work is often inspired by Eastern and Central Europe as a wellspring of myth and legend, fairy tales, and horror stories. In his side career as a travel writer, Young has been everywhere from Alaska to Buenos Aires, Hawaii to Florence. And, of course, Piran.

ABOUT THE ILLUSTRATOR

From his studio in Trento, northern Italy, the abundantly talented Swiss/Italian artist Moreno Chistè has produced thousands of lively and colorful illustrations for companies such as Disney, Warner Bros, and Mattel. His work ranges from comics to advertising artwork, storyboards, merchandising, and entire collections of greeting cards for the major European card companies.


Risks and challenges

Well, the book has been printed and is set for distribution. That's the good news! We're over that hurdle. The first volume itself IS going ahead; that's why we're not seeking funds for printing.

But, in publishing, that is far from a recipe for success! So many books linger on bookstores shelves for many months only to be returned to the publisher's warehouse, the book hardly making a ripple, and the books ultimately "remaindered" or, worse, pulped. Because reviewers have hardly paid them notice amid the hundreds of other books piled up on their desks, and the publisher has no money or credit for publicity and ads--and we don't.

We can't let this happen to Wild Cats--it's too promising a book and series!

How will we spend the funds? Well, this, in short, is how the budget looks:

(1) Half the initial goal is slated for publicity and marketing--to get word out there about the first volume. This includes Facebook and other social media outreach and ads, a well-targeted print ad or two, mail copies of the book to a good number of online reviewers we haven't been able to do a mailing to so far, and outreach to libraries and schools (including book donations). What is left over will go toward covering the very modest hourly wage of our currently 10 hour/month (that's right--a month; such is our budget) bright young assistant, the incomparable Christopher Hantman, over the next couple of months as he works to help publicize Wild Cats.

(2) The other half:

- Half of it will help cover the first portion of the advance Scott will get under contract for writing of the Chronicle 2! As for the rest, which Scott will get in 2015 before publication, we are hopeful of covering that from sales of Chronicle One.

- The other half will cover the fee artist Moreno Chiste so justly deserves for his fabulous work on Chronicle 2--which he is ready and eager to do! He has already done the cover--it's gorgeous. He's done this on spec. We need to pay him for that, above all; and then we need to work on compensating him for the remaining, nine full-page chapter illustrations that--likewise under contract--he will do for us in the next few months.

What about a book tour? Well, Scott has now offered to cover most of the cost of such a two- or three-week tour himself--flying to the States from his current home in Budapest, covering his travel and accommodation in various cities. He'll try to scrape the money together. We'll chip in only if sales of Chronicle One come through. We hope very much that such a tour can happen in 2015; good buzz for Chronicle One will make it more likely that libraries, schools, and other venues will welcome Scott Alexander Young with open arms!

If we are fortunate enough to exceed our initial goal, we will be able to ...

- Better publicize Chronicle 1. 
- Cover more of Scott's advance for Chronicle 2. 
- Cover more of Moreno's work on Chronicle 2.

Thank you!

Because reviewers have hardly paid them notice amid the hundreds of other books piled up on their desks, and the publisher has no money or credit for publicity and ads--and we don't.We can't let this happen to Wild Cats--it's too promising a book and series!How will we spend the funds? Well, this, in short, is how the budget looks:(1) Half the initial goal is slated for publicity and marketing--to get word out there about the first volume. This includes Facebook and other social media outreach and ads, a well-targeted print ad or two, mail copies of the book to a good number of online reviewers we haven't been able to do a mailing to so far, and outreach to libraries and schools (including book donations). What is left over will go toward covering the very modest hourly wage of our currently 10 hour/month (that's right--a month; such is our budget) bright young assistant, the incomparable Christopher Hantman, over the next couple of months as he works to help publicize Wild Cats.(2) The other half:- Half of it will help cover the first portion of the advance Scott will get under contract for writing of the Chronicle 2! As for the rest, which Scott will get in 2015 before publication, we are hopeful of covering that from sales of Chronicle One.- The other half will cover the fee artist Moreno Chiste so justly deserves for his fabulous work on Chronicle 2--which he is ready and eager to do! He has already done the cover--it's gorgeous. He's done this on spec. We need to pay him for that, above all; and then we need to work on compensating him for the remaining, nine full-page chapter illustrations that--likewise under contract--he will do for us in the next few months.What about a book tour? Well, Scott has now offered to cover most of the cost of such a two- or three-week tour himself--flying to the States from his current home in Budapest, covering his travel and accommodation in various cities. He'll try to scrape the money together. We'll chip in only if sales of Chronicle One come through. We hope very much that such a tour can happen in 2015; good buzz for Chronicle One will make it more likely that libraries, schools, and other venues will welcome Scott Alexander Young with open arms!If we are fortunate enough to exceed our initial goal, we will be able to ...- Better publicize Chronicle 1. - Cover more of Scott's advance for Chronicle 2. - Cover more of Moreno's work on Chronicle 2.Thank you!

story:
Click here to see the book cover

What’s the book about?

WHO are you deep inside? WHAT is your purpose? Have you been looking for answers?

Two years ago, I was at the lowest in my life – reduced to a man who had only 12 dollars in his wallet, was not sure of where my health was going, and had lost a significant relationship.

It was enough for me to question my direction in life and I had no answer to that.

Until someone asked me, “Do you truly know who you are?” That question stuck to me till today and I started to dig deep within me to answer it. I started to make decisions in life based on my inner self, realizing how important it was to understand yourself truly and knowing your purpose in life.

Over the course of time, I have been (and still am) on the road to my self-discovery. This book talks about my journey.

The story is placed in a fictional setting and yet based on real events that has happened in my life as well as other people’s.

The reason why this is fictional is because in general, a person’s mind work best when reading a story. A story leads us to input our emotions and consciousness into it. That is why we can cry or laugh when reading a story.

And it is during the state of reading a story that we start to ask questions and get engaged more into the plot. From there, we develop our own theories and solutions to issues.

This is why Finding Home Inside is not only a story about me and the people I have met, it is also a story about you.

And the story that you yourself will create after that.

Learn more about the book. Click for a sample chapter

If you like what you see here, please support 

The first phase of the book has already completed. It involves the cover design as you have seen as well as the editing of the contents. To proceed on with the printing of the second phase, this is where the Crowdfunding campaign comes in. 

If you like what you have read and you want to support my work, you can do so by contributing to the campaign. 

I've always believe that things happen for a reason.There's a reason why you have found this page and why you are reading this. 

If you feel, that for some reason, having this book in your life is going to help you, then it's time to make a decision. 

Thank you for reading this.

I can be reached at terence [at] findinghomeinside.com

Threefold and Fivefold Options

If you buy 3 or 5 books at one time, I want to throw in a little something extra for you to thank you for your support. Please take a look at the perks for more information. 

Friends and Families

If you feel a friend or a family member is seeking for answers to life, please refer this page to him or her. Or you could buy them the book via the Threefold or Fivefold option. Social media advertising can only do so much. The best is often word-of-mouth or a gift from a good friend. 

Where will the funds go to? 

Apart from admin and delivery fees, the majority of the funds will go towards the following: 

  • Layout of the book for printing 
  • Printing of the books
  • Growing the Finding Home Inside community  

International Delivery

All books will be printed in Singapore and depending on the country you stay in, delivery can take up to 12 days. All deliveries will be done by airmail and registered. I want to make sure you get your book and that it won't be lost in the mail. 

You may also notice that prices vary according to countries. This is because of delivery costs. I have spent much time trying to work this out but this is the best arrangement I could come out with so far. 

Please select the perk according to the country you stay in (or where you want it delivered to). This is important because I want to make sure the book(s) get to you without complications. 

Local Delivery (Singapore)

Local deliveries are much simpler. You should receive the books in about 3-5 working days.  

Personalized Replies on a certain area in your life

If you have selected the Threefold or Fivefold option, you will get a personalized reply from me on a certain area in your life of which you wish to seek answers about. If you have selected this option, please send an email to me with your transaction reference and tell me the issue which you are facing. Include details such as:

  • Time (how long ago did it happened?)
  • People (who was involved?)
  • Incident (what happened?)
  • Emotions (How do you and/or related parties feel about this?)
  • What do you want at the end of it? 
Be as detailed or opened as you can so that my response can be truly helpful.
I can be reached at terence [at] findinghomeinside.com 
Personalized Tour of Killiney Road
If you have selected the Fivefold option, let me take you on a tour to Killiney Road - the place where the novel was set in. Located near the city area, Killiney Road actually has a lot of history and stories not many know. I know this because it is also my childhood place. 
The tour will take place a couple of months after the launch of the book and will take half a day. Please send me an email when you have signed up for this perk.  
This perk is only opened to local residents so far. But if you are living overseas and strongly wish to be part of it, please drop me an email as well. 
I can be reached at terence [at] findinghomeinside.com 
Questions?
This is my first time doing a Crowdfunding campaign and I have to say there sure is a lot to learn. There could be some details I've missed out so please let me know via my email or in the comments sections and I will get back to you.

story:
Dear Friends and Family,

Here is the scoop: I applied to and was accepted by the Ashbery Home School, a selective writing intensive held at the home of poet John Ashbery (Ashbery has won nearly every American award for Poetry, including the Pulitzer Prize. The Poetry Foundation calls him "one of the greatest twentieth-century American poets."). 

The Ashbery Home School would afford me the opportunity not only to present my work to Ashbery himself, but to study with many other preeminent poets at work today, including Timothy Donnelly, Adam Fitzgerald, Douglas Kearney, Dorothea Lasky, and Harryette Mullen.  In addition, as a program that brings other mediums such as dance, cinema, and the visual arts into dialogue with poetry, I would have the chance to expand the scope and context of my work. In short, I really believe attending this workshop would help me hone my craft, connect to people who have intimately influenced my work, and give me the chance to get my work "out there" in a significant way.

The only drawback at this point is that the program costs $1175, and I only have ten days to send in the tuition before my spot is given away. As a college student who is already living on loans, this is a lot of money for me, and certainly not an amount I have any hope of raising on my own in ten days. That's why I am asking you for help. I understand there are a lot of needs and wants floating around out there in the world, but if you've read this far, I'm hoping it's because you are sympathetic to my cause. And, truly, anything helps. Anything at all. 

Thank you so much for reading this, and know how much I appreciate the fact that you have taken time out of your day to consider my circumstances.

Your Aspiring Poet,

Devon Walker

story:
About From Under the Mountain

The novel follows Guerline, a young woman who ascends to the throne of the empire after her entire family dies in one fell swoop. Now Empress, Guerline must address the suspicion growing in her court toward the four witch clans that protect the empire’s borders. Among the seditionists is Guerline’s best friend and lover, Evadine.

Guerline’s political balancing act is upset when the palace is attacked by powerful magic, bringing all Evadine’s fears to bear—but magic saves them too. In the wake of the attack, with an even greater threat looming, Guerline must decide who to trust, and summon all her strength to meet the challenge.

From Under the Mountain is my first novel and my first love. It’s a high fantasy for the modern world, drawing on the foundations laid by great female fantasy writers of the past twenty years to tell the story of one young woman. Guerline’s journey to establish her place, protect what she loves, and do right by her people will resonate with readers across the board.

From Under the Mountain will be published in January 2016 by REUTS Publications: http://www.reuts.com

About the Event

“Characters on the Catwalk: a High Fantasy Fashion show celebrating From Under the Mountain” will be a fun, visually interactive event to thrill fans and give new readers a glimpse into the novel. Featuring original designs by Portland costumer Brandilyn Scott and original music by composer Zac Anger, the show will introduce viewers to the major players in Mountain and set the stage upon which the story unfolds.

The event will be held in Portland, Oregon, and will be free to attend and open to the public.

I’m very excited to present this show, and I’ve budgeted to make the basics happen no matter what. But with your help, we can make this an affair worthy of an empress. Your contributions will allow:

Higher quality fabrics and accessories for the costumes

  The featured characters include human and witch royalty! These great personages need better quality cloth than your average peasant.

Wages for the talent  

  Everyone is so excited to be part of this project, that’s almost all they need—but we all know it’s better to be paid! With your help, I’ll be able to pay all our talent fair wages.

Production costs

  With my theater background, I know that producing an event is no mean feat, and no small cost. Your donations will help me with venue, décor, and other costs associated with putting on this show.

Photography and videography

  For posterity. With photos and video of the show, we’ll be able to share the fun with everyone outside of Portland, and provide the talent with portfolio materials!

About the Rewards

I'm very excited to start handing out rewards, and I hope you're excited about them too.

SWAG: The swag pack includes a download of the official From Under the Mountain soundtrack (preview here), a temporary typographic tattoo with the phrase "All things fall, for all things must under the mountain go", and a "Her Imperial Majesty" bookmark with a cameo image of Guerline. 

Other perks include short stories that hint at what's to come, and prints of a watercolor portrait of Guerline by yours truly. 

BOOKS: Lower support levels will receive ebook bundles of my The Web novellas, and at higher levels, supporters will receive a free signed paperback of The First Web, which includes the first two novellas of the set. And, of course, there will be ARC ebooks and paperbacks of From Under the Mountain galore. (The advance ebooks and paperbacks of From Under the Mountain will be sent out when they're ready (November-ish and January, respectively).)

BEHIND THE SCENES ACCESS: Our major supporters will get to peek behind the curtain, pick the production team's brains, and follow our progress as we prepare for the show and the launch. Very major supporters will even get a chance to join the next chapter of the story.

story:
Good Day My Friend, 

My name is Nijaah, and I would be most gratified to be known as a Humanitarian and Social Entrepreneur. Giving back to others, donating my time, and providing my serviceshave always been something that matters to me. My Career began as a Professional Cook working for restaurants in NYC, my final one being, "Windows On the World". After 9/11, my life changed and I made a decision to become a social reformer to help youth better appreciate others of all cultural backgrounds. I currently assist those with special needs.

I have owned and operated a nonprofit youth program since 1997 and have organized several successful events and programs which made significant positive impact on the lives of our youth in Queens, NY. I plan to make a more notable effect on not only youth but all males of various cultural backgrounds with this vision all over the world.
 

YOUNG MEN STRONG, LLC was developed because of how distraught the world is with the injustice surrounding the death of Trayvon Martin, Sean Bell, Oscar Grant, Jordan Davis, and the many unknown brothers who were murdered or treated unfairly. We love Steve Harvey, Chris Rock, and all other men of color who are celebrities; however, we are deliberate in recognizing the male “celebrities” right in our own communities who are doing fantastic things and deserve to get recognized. The burning desire to enlighten our males of color and society as a whole prompted me to create an organization that finds tangible ways to address many of the social issues that affect males of color. 

“THOUGHTS” magazine was created as a platform to bridge our common struggles, build respect, level the playing field, and unify males of color of across all cultural backgrounds. I wanted to create an opportunity to reform and restructure an antiquated mindset.

As you sit there reading this and consider participating in ways to help us raise capital and spread “THOUGHTS” magazine, you are helping to create a paradigm shift of the way young males of color today view and respect themselves and each other. Our goal is to educate our Men and Society to provide a balanced set of resources and a opportunities which will result in showing the clear value and beauty that hides within each and every male of color.
 
 

What We Need & What You Get

The Young Men Strong, LLC administration is growing and in order to publish the Commemorative Issue of “THOUGHTS” magazine Summer of 2013, we are raising $15,000. We want to cover at least (2) issues for 2013. Our first issue will be approximately 40 pages, perfect bound, and magazine quality making the funding goal complete.
 
Our perks are one of a kind. You mean a lot to me and I wanted to make each perk something special that I would appreciate myself. I take personal pride in each perk and look forward to you getting excited and helping to make a difference while gaining some unique “thank you’s”. You get an opportunity to get a personal shout out on our website, your name in our issue of “THOUGHTS”, get thank you notes hand written by myself, ability to sponsor a YMS youth, get an original YMS T-Shirt, Tickets to the 1st YMS “THOUGHTS” Launch Party, Professional Photos with members of YMS Team, Personalized Autograph of “THOUGHTS” magazine by me;Founder, a DVD of the 1st, once in a lifetime, YMS “THOUGHTS’ Launch Party, an opportunity to highlight an extraordinary male of color of YOUR choice in "THOUGHTS", Dinner with me; Founder of Young Men Strong, LLC & “THOUGHTS” magazine, and your business advertised in our future issue of “THOUGHTS” magazine for FREE!!!!! as well FREE Subscriptions, to the possibility of part ownership of the company*. *Contribution does not guarantee membership.
 

IF, Young Men Strong, LLC doesn’t reach our goal of $15,000. I will update all of you with how the funds that were raised were utilized. All funds will be used to get “THOUGHTS” published in 2013 and towards the Launch Party.

 

The Impact

YES, YMS “THOUGHTS” magazine is valuable to you because it affects you somehow. You are either a male of color or know someone who is. If you are a male of color you are YOUNG MEN STRONG and may have an opportunity to share your story, if you know of a young man of color you can help him to strengthen his self-esteem by reading, learning, and communicating with other young men just like him doing exceptionally well and making a difference in society despite the odds, inspiring him to do the same. If you are a woman, you get to better understand the whys and how’s of males of color, if you are a part of society, then it helps you to be aware, open and more understand regarding the value of Celebrating Our Men Everyday.

You are valuable to YOUNG MEN STRONG, LLC. If you are or know of a male of color (African American, Latino American, Native American, African, Pacific Islander, Caribbean American, Virgin Islands, Asian American, Middle Eastern-Indian American, Bi-Cultural, Multi-Cultural, etc)., then this organization is for YOU! You matter to me and your story is worth it. Be apart of this change. Join the YMS Team!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes it’s difficult to help financially, even though you want too, so here is how you can help make a HUGE difference for us instead: Please make some noise about this campaign by spreading the word. Please USE the Indiegogo share tools!

If you spread the word, let me know, I’ll send you a special gift too!

 

YOUNG MEN STRONG......ROCK ON!

Thank you for taking the time to READ! 

N.~

You can send MO/checks to:

YMS: 672 DOGWOOD AVENUE, SUITE 128, FRANKLIN SQUARE, NY 11010

You get an opportunity to get a personal shout out on our website, your name in our issue of “THOUGHTS”, get thank you notes hand written by myself, ability to sponsor a YMS youth, get an original YMS T-Shirt, Tickets to the 1st YMS “THOUGHTS” Launch Party, Professional Photos with members of YMS Team, Personalized Autograph of “THOUGHTS” magazine by me;Founder, a DVD of the 1st, once in a lifetime, YMS “THOUGHTS’ Launch Party, an opportunity to highlight an extraordinary male of color of YOUR choice in "THOUGHTS", Dinner with me; Founder of Young Men Strong, LLC & “THOUGHTS” magazine, and your business advertised in our future issue of “THOUGHTS” magazine for FREE!!!!! as well FREE Subscriptions, to the possibility of part ownership of the company*. *Contribution does not guarantee membership.
 
IF, Young Men Strong, LLC doesn’t reach our goal of $15,000. I will update all of you with how the funds that were raised were utilized. All funds will be used to get “THOUGHTS” published in 2013 and towards the Launch Party.
 

The Impact


YES, YMS “THOUGHTS” magazine is valuable to you because it affects you somehow. You are either a male of color or know someone who is. If you are a male of color you are YOUNG MEN STRONG and may have an opportunity to share your story, if you know of a young man of color you can help him to strengthen his self-esteem by reading, learning, and communicating with other young men just like him doing exceptionally well and making a difference in society despite the odds, inspiring him to do the same. If you are a woman, you get to better understand the whys and how’s of males of color, if you are a part of society, then it helps you to be aware, open and more understand regarding the value of Celebrating Our Men Everyday.

You are valuable to YOUNG MEN STRONG, LLC. If you are or know of a male of color (African American, Latino American, Native American, African, Pacific Islander, Caribbean American, Virgin Islands, Asian American, Middle Eastern-Indian American, Bi-Cultural, Multi-Cultural, etc)., then this organization is for YOU! You matter to me and your story is worth it. Be apart of this change. Join the YMS Team!
 




Other Ways You Can Help


Sometimes it’s difficult to help financially, even though you want too, so here is how you can help make a HUGE difference for us instead: Please make some noise about this campaign by spreading the word. Please USE the Indiegogo share tools!
If you spread the word, let me know, I’ll send you a special gift too!
 
YOUNG MEN STRONG......ROCK ON!
Thank you for taking the time to READ! 
N.~
You can send MO/checks to:
YMS: 672 DOGWOOD AVENUE, SUITE 128, FRANKLIN SQUARE, NY 11010

story:
THIS CAMPAIGN: The Connection Point Dialogues

Founded in 2002, Peace X Peace serves 20,000 women in 125 countries. Our programs promote gender equity and peacebuilding through leadership development, mentorship, public policy, and intercultural dialogue. We give strength and unity to women’s voices and dynamic trainings to engage them as peacemakers within their countries. Peace X Peace collaborates with the United Nations, fosters international peacebuilding, increases trust and reduces stereotypes across cultural and religious boundaries worldwide.

We serve as a first tier publisher for women around the world whose voices would not be heard otherwise. And, we have a history of bringing women around the world together in dialogue to overcome stereotypes and bridge cultural misunderstandings. In 2006 we hosted the Women’s Global Roundtable that brought together 20 women from three African countries, four countries in the Middle EAst and three Asian countries in private facilitated conversations; we created a handbook of best practices for cross cultural dialogues based on this experience. In 2007 we hosted in-person dialogue among an equal number of Israeli and Palestinian women, again private and facilitated to discuss their vision of peace for their region.

The Embassy of the United Arab Emirates partnered with Peace X Peace by providing seed funding for the launch of The Connection Point initiative in January 2011, which works to break down stereotypes and misunderstandings between Arab, Muslim, and Western women. The Connection Point initiative works to develop women’s leadership skills as international emissaries of peace and cultural exchange.

This Campaign has been developed specifically to address a growing global need for person to person dialogue. The Connection Point Dialogues is a program that utilizes videoconferencing to facilitate vital cross-cultural discussions between women from Arab, Muslim, and Western communities around the world. The demand for the Connection Point Dialogues from women around the world has been exceptional. Currently, we have a waiting list of 100 women who would like to join our spring 2013 online dialogues.

Our Goal

Our Indiegogo campaign goal is to raise $15,000 in order to acquire technology and staffing to develop this program and assure women’s leadership and participation as part of a global community of peacebuilders. The program is in its pilot stage, and currently serves about 20 women. However, based on word of mouth referrals, we have a waiting list of over 100 women who are eager to join our dialogues. In order for us to handle this larger capacity, we need to upgrade our software and expand our team so that we can meet the demands of our members!

Other Ways You Can Help

Sign up to participate in the Peace X Peace Connection Point Dialogues.

Become a facilitator for the Peace X Peace Connection Point Dialogues.

Write an article for the Connection Point Blog.

Volunteer with Peace X Peace.

Subscribe to receive our weekly e-newsletter, featuring perspectives on women and peace from around the world.

Help us get the word out about our campaign!

story:
Short Summary

As many of you may know (or not know), I have been diagnosed with chronic renal failure.  I have a disease called igA nephropathy, which is associated with inflammation in the kidneys.  When first diagnosed in 2011 our family quickly accepted the diagnosis; yet we were unprepared for the struggles we would soon face.  With igA your kidney function fluctuates rapidly and without reason.  After being pumped with thousands of medications, transfusions, and even six months of cytoxan infusions, we still have not recovered. However, my body appeared to cooperate for a brief period until the past year.  Within this past year my symptoms have increased and become more aggressive.  I occasionally black out, have chest scares, and swollen appendages (edema).  I also have thrown up violently everyday for an entire year.  We have exhausted all our options and began accepting this lifestyle.  We also have an entire team of specialists in every field working on my case.  Our next step is dialysis and transplant.  However, as we wait for the solution I would like to lead a somewhat normal life.  I am a biology major and thorougly enjoy my classes at FAU.  It has become difficult to maintain any sense of independence throughout this ordeal.  The doctors briefly mentioned the assistance of a certified service dog, and before we knew it an idea was born.  This particular dog would be trained to assist in medical situations by alerting others and providing stability.  He will be able to sense changes in blood levels and anxiety.  The dog will also be able to retrieve medication and appropriate tools that I cannot physically gain access too.  The best part is that I will not have to worry anymore about having a violent episode in public because I will always have someone with me who knows what to do, without an ounce of panic.  I know that I can beat this disease, but I cannot do it without the help of others (even canines).

 What We Need & What You Get

The cost of this entire process will come out to $5300.  However, I plan on breaking the goals down into smaller protions, as to not become overwhelmed or discouraged.  It appears to be a significant amount, but this dog will not be a pet.  He will be a certified service dog and provide the role of a caretaker.  It is importnat to understand that his services are unique and often come with a price.  There are many nonprofit agencies that provide free service dog, but many are associated with wait lists that can take up to years.  Unfortnately we need these services now, in an attempt to lead a somewhat normal life.

The Impact

This particular act will potentially change my life.  I will be able to continue my education and travel alone without worrying about my 'black outs'.  I also will be able to give my family and friends a break from their roles as caretaker.  As many of you may know, this role can be exhausting and often overwhelming.  I will be able to accomplish a sense of normalcy again.  This will also benefit myself and a dog who would not have a home.  This process will allow  rescue to become adopted, trained, and lead a successful life.  He will have a forever home and be able to work hard, sharing his skills with others.  I promise that all of the donations are specifically for this cause and will not be used for any other purpose.  I also want others to know that these funds will only cover the beginning of a long road ahead.  Our family will cover the extra costs that are essential to maintain/ utilize this special service.  We are simply asking for the opportunity to begin this unique journey.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help.

You can help by spreading the word and sharing this story with others.  I would be grateful for anything, even positive energy and vibes sent our way.  Even simple words of encouragement would be amazing.  Thank you all for your love and support.

story:
Story of My Book

The world has a lot of problems (definitely more than 99), but luckily, biotechnology offers the most significant opportunities to help solve them. There is hope!

And the best way to create the better future you wish to see (and add to that hope) is to be a part of shaping it. This is exactly what Gene-trepreneur is about: expanding your knowledge base and joining a community coming together to tackle some of the world's toughest sustainability problems, deliver incredibly beneficial impacts, and add to the hope!

Positive change is sprouting up all around us from rapid technological advancements that are cultivating powerful outcomes in our food system, human health, and species / environmental conservation. Those who take the reigns and become a part of the amazing changes happening now and to come are simultaneously building themselves and the world around them into something we all want to be a part of. I invite you to join the movement and learn along with me how we can deliver the impact we wish to see in the world.

My name is Brett Cotten, and I am the author of Gene-trepreneur: How Synthetic Biology & Sustainability Founders are Saving the World + How to Join the Cause to Deliver Your Impact.

I wrote this book to enhance public understanding and scientific literacy in regards to the immense positive effects that synthetic biology and sustainability startups, and the founders behind them, are having on the greatest challenges the world currently faces (factory farming, species extinction, human health, ocean pollution, climate change, etc.). My book displays the interconnectedness between all these issues and shows how everyone can become a Gene-trepreneur amongst the infinite ways there are to become one (and in your own, unique way too).

My hope is that through reading this book, you will discover the common threads in sustainability that weave our world together and how you have the power to enact direct change by utilizing the skills and resources at your disposal to achieve your greatest impact (this is called effective altruism). In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement I have for the bio-based future. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you not only build out your knowledge base (a.k.a. expanding your roots), but also to create an actionable path moving forward that will help you build something of value (a.k.a. growing tall).

To be more specific regarding some of the amazing founder stories, novel industries, and new opportunities you'll learn about in this book, we will:

  1. Follow the journey of one amazing Gene-trepreneur, Ryan Bethencourt, who took his innovative pet food company Wild Earth to Shark Tank and scored a $550,000 investment from Mark Cuban!
  2. Discover how plant-based, as well as cell-based protein startups (a.k.a. clean meat = real meat without animals) are taking on incumbent factory farming companies and culturing big change for animals, human health, and the planet (it's really like David vs. Goliath)!
  3. And go through the 7 most important entrepreneurial / life lessons I've learned throughout my research, personal experiences, and interactions with top business leaders for turning new knowledge into your direct impact.
You will be enthralled by this book if you are fascinated by the future (not only wanting to see change but to actively help participate in making science fiction into reality), love genuinely exciting science like the MythBusters love explosions, and have a deep desire to live in a more sustainable and ethical world.

Gene-trepreneur is a non-fiction book that speaks both to those with technical backgrounds (like STEM students / industry professionals) who are looking to make a shift with their transferable skillsets from highly-replicated lab research into new fields where they can produce more meaningful outcomes (like in cell-based proteins for example), as well as those who may not know much about biotech / sustainability yet but really do care about animals, human health, and the environment. This isn't a textbook, and you don't have to be technical to make a difference in biotech / sustainability – there are a million ways to become a Gene-trepreneur through marketing, branding, finance, graphic design, writing, film-making, art, etc.

I invite you all to join an inclusive and growing community of people who want to make the world a better place, and lucky for you we need all hands on deck because there's simply no time to waste.

 

The Book – Gene-trepreneur: How Synthetic Biology & Sustainability Founders are Saving the World + How to Join the Cause to Deliver Your Impact


The book is written in 5 Parts....

Part 1 contains the Preface + Introduction to get you right into the swing of things. We will discuss the Anthropocene, the world's growing plastic problem, one Stanford-based scientist's solution, and a fun personal story.
  • Preface
  • Introduction: The Anthropocene & Riding the EAC to Sydney
    • Mango Materials & Finding Nemo
    • Grad Gown Gifts & Black Hole Closets
    • A Note to the Reader
Part 2 contains Chapters 1–4. We dig into food & materials innovation with medical-grade technology. This sections entails exciting advances in cell-based and plant-based meats / dairy, crop technology, biofabrication, and what it directly means for you and the planet.
  • Chapter 1: Clean Seafood & Fish Death Stars
    • MicroSynbiotiX & Rogue Salmon
    • Ocean Farm Tech. & Kampachi Farms
    • Finless Foods & Silicon Valley
    • Additional Endeavors To Note
  • Chapter 2: Terrestrial Meats & Noble Goats
    • Impossible Foods, Meat Chefs, & Bovine Technology
    • New Age Meats & Jessie the Pig
    • Perfect Day Foods & Gaylord Focker
    • Wild Earth, Man’s Best Friend, & a Visit to Shark Tank
    • Additional Endeavors To Note
  • Chapter 3: Crop Tech & Coffee
    • Joyn Bio & Pivot Bio
    • Indigo Agriculture & AgBiome
    • Coffee Beans & Beetle Kryptonite
    • Additional Endeavors To Note
  • Chapter 4: Microbe-Managing & Spider-Man
    • ‘The Organism Company’ & Ice Age Roses
    • Bolt Threads & Ecovative Design
    • Additional Endeavors To Note
Part 3 contains Chapters 5–6. Delving into genetic species conservation, you will learn about new fertility technology being developed to help humans and save endangered animal species, 3-D printing horns to mitigate rhino poaching, tackling invasive species, gene drives, facilitated adaptation, and de-extinction (but real de-extinction, not the Hollywood version like in Jurassic Park)!
  • Chapter 5: Biodiversity Part I: Genetic Tools & Middle-earth
    • Corwin & Rhino Tinder
    • Animal Poaching Part I: Pembient & Michelangelo
    • Animal Poaching Part II: Invasive Species & Lions of the Sea
    • Gene Drives & New Zealand Kiwis
    • Additional Endeavors to Note
  • Chapter 6: Biodiversity Part II: De-extinction & NOT Jurassic Park
    • Woolly Mammoths & Mammoth Mozzies
    • The Lazarus Project, Brooding Frogs, & Big Birds
    • Revive & Restore + LAL not LOL
    • Additional Endeavors to Note
Part 4 contains Chapter 7. This chapter dives more into an amazing new health field, the microbiome, that will revolutionize human health for everything from how we may be able to more effectively treat cancers to how we can take advantage of the microbes in our guts to improve mental health. The bacteria that live inside us directly affect our well-being. This is where we'll explore some of the ways how it happens and what it means for improving future human health.
  • Chapter 7: The Microbiome: A Rainforest in Our Guts
    • Finding the Good Ones, Jamie Lee Curtis, & Light Therapy
    • Lessening the Bad & The ‘Thrifty Gene’
    • Understanding Mechanisms & Marijuana Babies
    • Ancient Microbiomes & ‘Pup-sicles’
    • Additional Endeavors to Note
Part 5 is the end-cap Conclusion, which serves as the glue for the entire book to weave together our big picture and path forward. Here, you will be able to put your newfound knowledge into action with 7 valuable lessons learned from my personal experiences and not only Gene-trepreneurs, but also other successful leaders across multiple industries about how you can build yourself while building the world around you to deliver your positive impact.
  • Conclusion: Culturing Change & Building More Gene-trepreneurs
    • Seven Marvelous Lessons & A Few More References
    • Building Your Next Steps
    • Your Starfish Problem, Becoming a Gene-trepreneur, and a New Hope

TL;DR: Main topics you will learn about are food and materials innovation, species conservation, human healthcare, and 7 of the most important entrepreneurial / life lessons I can ever hope to pass along to you so that you can join the bio-based future and deliver the impact you wish to see in the world.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editors I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in October, 2019
  • The Cover Design of my book – the mock-ups you see currently are a placeholder
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, eBook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for my book – to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book – when I ultimately publish this fall, 2019


When I pre-sell 100 copies, I will publish the eBook and paperbacks.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also be able to publish an audiobook.

When I pre-sell 200 copies, I will be able publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access not only to my book's Preface and Introduction, but also to my entire manuscript with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • With the book's cover, the opportunity to help provide feedback / be involved in selecting the cover design
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing and publishing my book (including PR / marketing tips)
  • And more... (like personally editing / providing feedback on a piece of your writing up to 1,500 words or taking a crack at helping you with something graphic-design-related like a logo or cover design for one of your own personal projects – happy to help!)
 

About the Author

Brett Cotten is a young professional on a mission to culture sustainability through biotech and business – primarily via storytelling, technology transfer, and applying the entrepreneurial mindset. He has worked in the Dublin, Ireland startup scene at a telemedicine startup right across from the Guinness Storehouse (great people-watching btw), graduated from The Pennsylvania State University (studied biochemistry, molecular biology, and tech-based entrepreneurship), and will be continuing his education at the University of Cambridge in the United Kingdom this fall (studying Bioscience Enterprise – the business of biotech).

Retrospectively, his love of animals, the environment, and science was inevitable as he grew up on Bill Nye the Science Guy, The Crocodile Hunter, MythBusters, and perhaps too many ultra-nerdy sci-fi shows. What excites him most now are the current opportunities and future possibilities to use science to help animals (humans included) and the planet. This is why he wrote the book: to inspire others not only to learn about sustainability through the lens of impactful biotech entrepreneurship, but also to motivate + share how everyone can directly help create that very same impact for themselves and those around them!

Although Brett is an avid animal-lover, he recently discovered that saving hibernating spiders from being burned with the firewood (and subsequently placing them safely under the deck to sleep through the rest of winter) is a bad idea when they all wake up and find their way into the house . . . whoops! But he got bit by this funny-looking one and the craziest things started happening – he could suddenly clim... Anyway, if you'd like more information you can connect with Brett via email (brett.a.cotten@gmail.com) and on LinkedIn (www.linkedin.com/in/brett-a-cotten).

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute and THAT'S OKAY! That doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. You can use the hashtag, #Genetrepreneur (sorry, I know, hard to spell) and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page. I will share the link with you if needed.

If you could please share my book campaign with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it, it would mean the world to me. I wrote this book to create impact, and you'd be a part of creating that and the resulting momentum. You can do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Truly, THANK YOU SO MUCH for all of your love and support! I really appreciate it and know we can help cultivate real, positive change. 

Thanks again, and updates coming soon!
Brett Cotten =]

This isn't a textbook, and you don't have to be technical to make a difference in biotech / sustainability – there are a million ways to become a Gene-trepreneur through marketing, branding, finance, graphic design, writing, film-making, art, etc.I invite you all to join an inclusive and growing community of people who want to make the world a better place, and lucky for you we need all hands on deck because there's simply no time to waste. The Book – Gene-trepreneur: How Synthetic Biology & Sustainability Founders are Saving the World + How to Join the Cause to Deliver Your Impact

The book is written in 5 Parts....Part 1 contains the Preface + Introduction to get you right into the swing of things. We will discuss the Anthropocene, the world's growing plastic problem, one Stanford-based scientist's solution, and a fun personal story.
Preface

Introduction: The Anthropocene & Riding the EAC to Sydney
Mango Materials & Finding Nemo

Grad Gown Gifts & Black Hole Closets
A Note to the Reader


 Part 2 contains Chapters 1–4. We dig into food & materials innovation with medical-grade technology. This sections entails exciting advances in cell-based and plant-based meats / dairy, crop technology, biofabrication, and what it directly means for you and the planet.

Chapter 1: Clean Seafood & Fish Death Stars
MicroSynbiotiX & Rogue Salmon
Ocean Farm Tech. & Kampachi Farms
Finless Foods & Silicon Valley

Additional Endeavors To Note



Chapter 2: Terrestrial Meats & Noble Goats
Impossible Foods, Meat Chefs, & Bovine Technology
New Age Meats & Jessie the Pig
Perfect Day Foods & Gaylord Focker
Wild Earth, Man’s Best Friend, & a Visit to Shark Tank

Additional Endeavors To Note



Chapter 3: Crop Tech & Coffee
Joyn Bio & Pivot Bio
Indigo Agriculture & AgBiome
Coffee Beans & Beetle Kryptonite
Additional Endeavors To Note



Chapter 4: Microbe-Managing & Spider-Man
‘The Organism Company’ & Ice Age Roses
Bolt Threads & Ecovative Design
Additional Endeavors To Note


 Part 3 contains Chapters 5–6. Delving into genetic species conservation, you will learn about new fertility technology being developed to help humans and save endangered animal species, 3-D printing horns to mitigate rhino poaching, tackling invasive species, gene drives, facilitated adaptation, and de-extinction (but real de-extinction, not the Hollywood version like in Jurassic Park)!

Chapter 5: Biodiversity Part I: Genetic Tools & Middle-earth
Corwin & Rhino Tinder
Animal Poaching Part I: Pembient & Michelangelo
Animal Poaching Part II: Invasive Species & Lions of the Sea
Gene Drives & New Zealand Kiwis
Additional Endeavors to Note



Chapter 6: Biodiversity Part II: De-extinction & NOT Jurassic Park
Woolly Mammoths & Mammoth Mozzies
The Lazarus Project, Brooding Frogs, & Big Birds
Revive & Restore + LAL not LOL
Additional Endeavors to Note


 Part 4 contains Chapter 7. This chapter dives more into an amazing new health field, the microbiome, that will revolutionize human health for everything from how we may be able to more effectively treat cancers to how we can take advantage of the microbes in our guts to improve mental health. The bacteria that live inside us directly affect our well-being. This is where we'll explore some of the ways how it happens and what it means for improving future human health.
Chapter 7: The Microbiome: A Rainforest in Our Guts
Finding the Good Ones, Jamie Lee Curtis, & Light Therapy
Lessening the Bad & The ‘Thrifty Gene’
Understanding Mechanisms & Marijuana Babies
Ancient Microbiomes & ‘Pup-sicles’
Additional Endeavors to Note

 Part 5 is the end-cap Conclusion, which serves as the glue for the entire book to weave together our big picture and path forward. Here, you will be able to put your newfound knowledge into action with 7 valuable lessons learned from my personal experiences and not only Gene-trepreneurs, but also other successful leaders across multiple industries about how you can build yourself while building the world around you to deliver your positive impact.
Conclusion: Culturing Change & Building More Gene-trepreneurs
Seven Marvelous Lessons & A Few More References
Building Your Next Steps
Your Starfish Problem, Becoming a Gene-trepreneur, and a New Hope


TL;DR: Main topics you will learn about are food and materials innovation, species conservation, human healthcare, and 7 of the most important entrepreneurial / life lessons I can ever hope to pass along to you so that you can join the bio-based future and deliver the impact you wish to see in the world. What I Need & What You'll Get This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following: 
The Editors I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in October, 2019
The Cover Design of my book – the mock-ups you see currently are a placeholder

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, eBook Formats)
The Copyediting for my book – to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book – when I ultimately publish this fall, 2019

When I pre-sell 100 copies, I will publish the eBook and paperbacks.
When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also be able to publish an audiobook.
When I pre-sell 200 copies, I will be able publish a hardcover edition.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy when I publish
A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access not only to my book's Preface and Introduction, but also to my entire manuscript with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
With the book's cover, the opportunity to help provide feedback / be involved in selecting the cover design
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing and publishing my book (including PR / marketing tips)
And more... (like personally editing / providing feedback on a piece of your writing up to 1,500 words or taking a crack at helping you with something graphic-design-related like a logo or cover design for one of your own personal projects – happy to help!)
 About the AuthorBrett Cotten is a young professional on a mission to culture sustainability through biotech and business – primarily via storytelling, technology transfer, and applying the entrepreneurial mindset. He has worked in the Dublin, Ireland startup scene at a telemedicine startup right across from the Guinness Storehouse (great people-watching btw), graduated from The Pennsylvania State University (studied biochemistry, molecular biology, and tech-based entrepreneurship), and will be continuing his education at the University of Cambridge in the United Kingdom this fall (studying Bioscience Enterprise – the business of biotech).Retrospectively, his love of animals, the environment, and science was inevitable as he grew up on Bill Nye the Science Guy, The Crocodile Hunter, MythBusters, and perhaps too many ultra-nerdy sci-fi shows. What excites him most now are the current opportunities and future possibilities to use science to help animals (humans included) and the planet. This is why he wrote the book: to inspire others not only to learn about sustainability through the lens of impactful biotech entrepreneurship, but also to motivate + share how everyone can directly help create that very same impact for themselves and those around them!Although Brett is an avid animal-lover, he recently discovered that saving hibernating spiders from being burned with the firewood (and subsequently placing them safely under the deck to sleep through the rest of winter) is a bad idea when they all wake up and find their way into the house . . . whoops! But he got bit by this funny-looking one and the craziest things started happening – he could suddenly clim... Anyway, if you'd like more information you can connect with Brett via email (brett.a.cotten@gmail.com) and on LinkedIn (www.linkedin.com/in/brett-a-cotten). Risks & Challenges The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute and THAT'S OKAY! That doesn't mean they can't help:
Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. You can use the hashtag, #Genetrepreneur (sorry, I know, hard to spell) and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page. I will share the link with you if needed.
If you could please share my book campaign with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it, it would mean the world to me. I wrote this book to create impact, and you'd be a part of creating that and the resulting momentum. You can do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.
Truly, THANK YOU SO MUCH for all of your love and support! I really appreciate it and know we can help cultivate real, positive change. Thanks again, and updates coming soon!Brett Cotten =]

story:
The campaign concluded successfully! Thanks to all our awesome backers!

 

Second stretch goal unlocked! Getting us to 500% will fund an audio book version of the original Combat Frame XSeed!

We're on a roll! You guys got us to 200% funded, ensuring our second series of Combat Frame XSeed trading cards! Look for new trading card perks and our new stretch goal soon!

 

You guys did it! Our first stretch goal, Series Two Combat Frame XSeed trading cards, is now unlocked. They will be made available as perks when we reach $2,000. Stay tuned for the poll to pick which mechs will appear on the cards!

You spoke. We listened. Our next run of trading cards will feature the four 1-Series XSeed combat frames! Thanks to everyone who voted. Now let's get to 200% and fund those cards!

 

They made him necessary. He’ll make them pay.

Earth groans under the yoke of the Systems Overterrestrial Coalition. Socs enjoy privileged status while grounders languish as second-class citizens.

Student Thomas Arthur Dormio leads the Brussels Service Academy’s history club, a front for a dissident grounder cell. The Human Liberation Organization conducts a campaign of blackmail, sabotage, and terrorism to free Earth from the Socs.

En route to make contact with the HLO, Second Lieutenant Theodore Red arrives in orbit over Western Europe. But before he starts the next phase of the resistance on Earth, Red has a man to kill.

Will the HLO avenge themselves on the Coalition? Or will personal grudges and conflicting purposes tear them apart? Find out in the pages of Combat Frame XSeed: Coalition Year 40!

Brian Niemeier is a best selling science fiction author and a John W. Campbell Award for Best New Writer finalist. His second book, Souldancer, won the first ever Dragon Award for Best Horror Novel., and its sequel, The Secret Kings, became a 2017 Dragon Award finalist for Best Science Fiction Novel.

Brian's passion for mecha anime and Western science fiction revitalized military sci-fi in the hit martial thriller Combat Frame XSeed. But that was just the beginning! Now, he invites you to help continue the renewal of science fiction!

What readers said about Combat Frame XSeed:

Strongly recommended for fans of adventure, science fiction, and far future thrillers, Combat Frame XSeed captures the spirit of the real robot genre without resorting to the thin reskinnings that plague many Western copies of Eastern genres. Better yet, its knights and thrillers approach breathes new life into military science fiction adventure.

-Castalia House Blog

It’s a triumph of mecha action. Taking cues from Gundam, Macross and other famous anime mecha shows, Brian Niemeier weaves a fast paced and violent plot filled with fleshed out characters and awesome ideas that never fail to entertain the reader. It is a masterclass in tight plotting and mecha action. All the pieces come together from chapter climax to book climax in a never ending, glorious climb.

-Superversive SF

Super fun. Brian delivered what he promised.

-Jon Del Arroz, author of For Steam and Country

Disclosure: All quoted reviewers backed the original Indiegogo campaign. The CH blogger received an advance copy in return for beta reading services.

The Plan

We blew the lid off the original Combat Frame XSeed campaign! Thanks to your support, Book 1 of my action-packed military sci fi thriller has been completed and shipped to backers!

You, the readers, spoke, and I listened. I know you can't wait to continue the white-knuckle ride begun in Combat Frame XSeed. For a taste of what's to come, you're invited to read the first two chapters for free at the links below.

Chapter 1

Chapter 2

Excited to read the whole book? Thought so. I'm giving my backers the chance to get Combat Frame XSeed: Coalition Year 40 before the official launch!

As I mentioned last time, indie authors have broad creative freedom to bring you the fun, exciting stories you deserve. But there's a catch. Indies don't have publishers to pay for art, editing, and formatting. We also don't get advances to keep the heat on while we write the next book.

I've proven that I deliver on promises to backers. You know you'll get a fun, quality product when we meet our goal. The best part is that main production on CFXS: CY40 has already been funded, so eBook and trade paperback fulfillment are guaranteed! I'm seeking funds to cover those surprise publishing expenses that always crop up, to pay for the production of Book 3, and to cover perk fulfillment costs.

As before, due to the sixty-day delay between a new book's launch and Amazon's first royalty payment, funds left over will take the place of an advance to help with my personal, business, and household expenses. That way I can devote my full attention to writing and bring you mecha action on schedule!

If we don't meet our goal, all money pledged is refunded, so you can be confident in backing this project with zero risk!

We've already made significant inroads toward saving science fiction. Let's keep up the momentum!

Back Combat Frame XSeed: Coalition Year 40 now! Help spread the word to fellow sci-fi readers. Indiegogo has share tools to make boosting the signal easy.

Thanks for your support!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, I'm Richard, Editor-in-Chief for Plasma Frequency.  Together with my editors we publish a bi-monthly magazine of speculative fiction.  What is speculative fiction? It is a large range of genres including Science Fiction, Fantasy, and Horror.  Besides fiction, we also publish art and book reviews.

In our second year we have two major goals. The first is to continue our success from year one.  The second is to increase our pay rates to our artists and authors.  That is where you come in.

About Us:

Plasma Frequency publishes bi-monthly.  Our art has been awarded in reader's polls.  Our stories recognized by readers as being the best they read in 2012.  We are in our second year publishing and have big plans.

For more about us visit: www.plasmafrequencymag.com

 

What We Need & What You Get

The speculative fiction market is divided into several paying categories: Non-paying, Token, Semi-Pro, and Pro.  Currently we pay our authors 1 cent per word, the very bottom of Semi-Pro rates.  We'd like to increase our pay rates to that standard semi-pro rate of 3-4 cents per word.

To do that, we need more money.  Currently almost all of the cost to run this magazine comes from donations (mostly my own). But we are hoping you might be willing to help us increase our pay rates and help us provide a better magazine all around.

Our goal is to raise $7,500 to fund the second year.  Of that money, $1,000 will go into each issue for the purpose of paying authors and artists. The remaining $1,500 goes to yearly operational costs such as Submittable, Web Hosting, printing costs, and other fees.

For your donations we have a variety of gifts.  Those range from being thanked in our magazine on up to copies of our magazine, anthology, and more.  But most importantly you get the satisfaction of contributing to a great magazine that supports the art of writing fiction.

The Impact

Paying short fiction markets are limited.  The Science Fiction and Fantasy market place has vast amounts of talent that never get published simply because there isn't enough space for every talented author.  In year one we published new authors, established authors, and up-and-comers. We've given a chance for talented authors to get paid for the fiction they write.

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course we'd appreciate it if you donated.  But we'd also love for you to share our magazine with the masses.  Share this campaign on your social media outlets.  Check out our past issues, and subscribe to new issues.  All of these will support us.
