story:
It’s been a tough few years for small business owners. But they’re a pretty resilient bunch, and they’ve learned plenty of lessons: not just about how to survive, but also about how to position themselves to thrive. We’ve spent the last year and a half compiling the most valuable lessons into a new book: Lessons from the Great Recession - Real Solutions for Every Small Business Riding the Economic Rollercoaster.

We believe this book will be of immense value to small business people and new entrepreneurs all over America. And, since small businesses are the engine of the American economy, if we can help them thrive, we’re helping everyone. You can help make that happen!

Why We Can Do This

Why us? What do we know about small businesses? Fair question. Our co authors are James Barrood and Brian Moran. James leads the nationally recognized Rothman Institute of Entrepreneurship at FDU. In this role, he doesn’t just help entrepreneurs and innovators succeed, he also leads one of the region’s most robust networks of businesspeople and business experts. Brian is Executive Director, Sales Development at The Wall Street Journal, where he is a leading advocate for small businesses. Previously, he was the Associate Publisher at Inc. Magazine, and a Publisher at Entrepreneur Media.

Together, they’ve rounded up an extraordinary group of experts for this book: people who are completely locked in to the challenges real small businesses face, and have already made outstanding contributions.

How Our Book Will Help Small Business Owners and Entrepreneurs

Our book will include invaluable new techniques and insights for:

· Business planning, by Tim Berry, founder of Palo Alto Software and a foremost expert on writing effective business plans

· Reducing costs and negotiating debts, by Jerry Silberman, Founder and CEO of Corporate Turnaround and co-author of The Small Business Survival Book

· Financing small businesses, by Joe Knight and Karen Berman, Founders of the Business Literacy Institute and authors of Financial Intelligence for Entrepreneurs

· Using outside contractors, consultants, and virtual assistants, by nationally-known small business finance expert Barbara Weltman

· Innovating more profitably, by Steve Wunker, top innovation consultant and author of Capturing New Markets: How Smart Companies Create Opportunities, and James Barrood

· Using technology for competitive advantage, by Heather Clancy, an award-winning business journalist and contributor to SmartPlanet

· Leveraging social media, by Brian Moran, one of the nation’s top small business leaders

· Coping with regulations, by Karen Kerrigan, President of the Small Business & Entrepreneurship Council

· Mergers and acquisitions, by Andrew Sherman, partner at the Jones/Day law firm, and author of Grow Fast/Grow Right and 16 other books

· Plus an epilogue by Rieva Lesonsky, nationally known speaker and authority on entrepreneurship and CEO of GrowBiz Media.

· And more…

 It will also help small businesspeople learn from others’ tough experiences to avoid mistakes that could cost them their businesses.

What we’re asking for, and how we’ll use it

Where do we stand? We’re almost there. Our interviews are all complete and we’ve received excellent drafts from all our contributors.

It will cost $4,000 to finish editing and design, and then to publish this book in both print and eBook formats. By contributing, you’ll help us quickly make this book available to the people who can benefit from it most. The book will be published in mid May.

You can also help by spreading the word about this book to small business owners and entrepreneurs you know as well as to your extended networks via email, twitter, LinkedIn, etc.

Thanks!

story:
Depression Sucks!

That was the original title of this book. And if you have ever struggled with depression or have seen a loved one suffer with it then you know what I talking about. It’s unfair and no one deserves to feel this way.

From the time I was a teenager to just a few years ago, I suffered through depression. And for 25 years I searched for an effective way to end this vague but unrelenting mental and emotional pain. But year after year I slowly descended into darkness until I woke up one morning and I knew that I just couldn’t make it through another day. It had to end it one way or another. I was tired of my life.

And so I began the hardest work of my life. I had no health insurance, no money, and for reasons I explain in great detail in the program I won’t do medication. However, I did have determination. So I researched, studied and started working my way through my self-sabotage, anger and negative thought patterns.

What Happened To Me

I spent four years and $25,000 (money I didn’t have) to figure out what depression is and how to eliminate it. I made massive improvements, made massive mistakes, and hit massive walls, but I kept going, kept trying, because I knew I couldn’t live like this anymore.

And I did it! I ended my depression even though, really, nothing in my outside world had changed. I had changed myself on the inside. I had ended the overwhelm and had ended my emotional pain. I had ended my sorrow and despair. I had changed my life. And if I can do this…then anyone can!

Why do I believe that? You see I didn’t go back to school and get a fancy degree to learn how to end depression. I’m not a psychologist, a neuroscientist or a brain surgeon, and I don’t have a bunch of letters at the end of my name, I am, however, a living, walking, breathing representative of what’s possible. And if I can do this then so can anyone.

You, me and everyone else on this planet are all the same. Our bodies all work the same way, our cells all take in signals and information the same way, our brain cells all wire together and talk to each other the same way. We are the same, so that means if I can do this, then anyone else can too.

A New Kind of Depression Book

While there are many books about depression, including some wonderful ones, this one is different. It is a new kind of book because it’s integral and wholistic, as well as, being practical and transformative.

Depression 180 is a step-by-step, long-term program geared towards massive, lasting life transformation. After years of searching for a way out of my own pain I found I had this amazing toolbox full of scientifically proven methods for eliminating depression, methods and techniques that could save a people a lot of time and keep them from spending a lot of money on things that don’t actually work.

No one deserves to feel depression, anxiety, or be stuck in any other unwanted, unhealthy emotion. This program will guide the reader on how to eliminate depression and create happiness in their life. Medical and scientific research proves that depression can be eliminated without medication – something that doctors and the big pharmaceutical companies don’t want you to know.

Based On The Latest Scientific Research

In learning to end my own depression I found the best, scientifically proven methods for eliminating depression and I put them all into one program so that anyone could be guided through it.

I wrote Depression 180 because I wish I had such a complete and thorough guide to eliminating depression when I started out. I’m not a big fan of soaking your brain in pharmaceuticals. I don’t believe you can solve life’s problems with a pill. Solving problems and changing your life will take time, energy, and massive effort. But I’ll let you in on a little secret – it’s so damn worth it!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

What Is Already Completed

I’ve spent a year and a half researching and writing the book. The 426-page Depression 180 Guidebook is done. I have finished the audio recordings of the book, the cognitive behavior therapy audio exercises, the hypnotherapy sessions, and the pattern interrupt exercises. I also have the graphics done for the front cover of the guidebook. It’s almost there!

Why I Am Fundraising

Much to my delight, I have gotten extremely positive reviews from the people who have gone through the program so far, including the CEO of Hampton Road Publishing (home of Richard Bach, Jonathan Livingston Seagull, and Neale Donald Walsch, Conversations with God)…so I can't help but believe I am on the brink of something good and close to helping change some lives.

I just need some financial support to keep up with this positive momentum. I've already invested all of my personal savings (and then some) to get this far… so I decided to give Indiegogo a try. The funds raised will help me to afford editing and graphics for the program and to create a massive marketing campaign. Specifically:

• Pay for the time and labor to professionally edit and format the book

• Hire a graphics person to designed the full book cover, as well as, design the CD case covers and the CDs.  (I’m estimating that there will be 32 CDs in all.)

• Create a professional product photo

• Design and create a professional web site

• Pay for 10 promotional copies of the program

• Produce promotional videos

• Help complete the expert interviews.

As for the actual donation process, your money is handled by Indiegogo's merchant partner Paypal or you can use your credit card, so it is safe and secure.

Rewards

Some of the cool things to seek out as the donation levels rise:

• The full Depression 180 Program, with soft-cover guidebook, over 32 CDs, expert interview transcriptions, and excise workbook.

•  A PDF copy of my follow up to the Depression 180 Program, The Mind Mastery Blueprint - Stop Anxiety & Guilt, Turn Off Negative Thoughts and Create Deep Happiness & Success!

•  Signed first-edition, hardback copies of the book Pearls of Wisdom: 30 Inspirational Ideas To Live Your Best Life Now (a New York Times bestseller which features contributors Jack Canfield, Marci Shimoff, Janet Attwood, myself and others)

•  Plus everyone who donates at $50 level or above will have their name mentioned on the Acknowledgment/Thank You page in the front of the book (listed under either Patron Saint, Silver Angel, Golden Angel, Diamond Angel, or Angel Supreme).

•  Everyone who donates at the $100 level and up will have the opportunity to take part in a private 3-part teleseminar (with play-back recordings) about depression and how to eliminate it. Part 1: The 4 Real Causes of Depression; Part 2: Do Antidepressants Cause Depression, Violence & Suicide; Part 3: Scientifically Proven Methods For Ending Depression

•  And for the top level donation, I will travel anywhere in the United States or Canada to present a 1 day seminar for a group of your friends or an organization of your choosing. Workshop choices include: 1) Fierce Happiness: Creating Deep, Sustainable Joy In Your Life; 2) Depression 180: Turn It Around; 3) Life Mastery 101; 4) Why You’re Sabotaging Your Success: Eliminate Your Mind Blocks To Wealth, Health and Deep Happiness. Find out more information about these workshops at www.Depression180.com/events/

If I Exceed My Initial Funding Goal

It’s all about getting it out there.  This program is badly needed by so many people, so if I can raise funds beyond the first level, then this money will go into marketing and promoting the Depression 180 program so that it can reach the widest possible audience.

This will include hiring a marketing assistant to help schedule interviews and speaking engagements, creating other web sites and getting assistance in using social marketing tools.

I also have 3 other projects which need to be completed. First there is:

• Mind Mastery Blueprint - Stop Anxiety & Guilt, Turn Off Negative Thoughts and Create Deep Happiness & Success! The book is written but is patiently waiting to be edited, cover design done and the audios recorded.

As for the other two projects, both have been outlined but need to be written.

• The first is a program that will help you increase your child's self esteem

• The other one is about dealing with overwhelming emotions such as grief, guilt, feeling that you’ve “not good enough”, anxiety and panic attacks.

Help Me Spread The Word

If you are able to, please pledge to see that this project can become a reality.  If you’re unable to pledge or in addition to your financial support, any help in spreading the word about this funding drive would be greatly appreciated!

Here are three ways you can help let others know about this project:

• Email your friends asking them to check out this Indiegogo page: http://www.indiegogo.com/depression180

• Share this Indiegogo page on Facebook or Twitter:
http://www.indiegogo.com/depression180

• You can also “like” my Facebook pages at:
www.facebook.com/Depression180 and
www.facebook.com/CraigInRealLife

Questions?

If you’re not sure how this whole Indiegogo thing works, check out their FAQ page.

If you have any questions at all about the project, about where your money will go, or if you have ideas or suggestions of ways to market this project please get in touch.  You can email me at craig (at) depression180.com

Also, get updates at my facebook page www.facebook.com/CraigInRealLife

International backers (outside the U.S. or Canada) adding $20 to help me with the cost of shipping would be extremely appreciated.

Thank you for reading and thank you for your support!

Craig

story:
Help me finish my children's book series ("Maya's Little Friends"), and support a good cause...

Hi I'm Ranjan, aka Otto Mouton for the purposes of this project -- please view my profile for more about me.
 
Inspired by my little daughter's growing love of words (she is now five), along with my artistic collaborator Lotta Farber, I have been working on a series of five illustrated children's books that are very loosely based on folk-tales from India. Three of these five books are already out. Pictures from these three books, which are being offered as Perks for your support, are in the GALLERY section. These books have received good reviews in several publications, and some of these are included in the Gallery as well. The books have also been enjoyed by many children in schools in and around Nottingham where I've read them, so I hope they'll be a great way of saying "Thank You" for your support.

A key goal of mine was also to raise money for a primary school in India that I support (see www.puvidham.org), in the sense that 10% of the sale price of every book -- a considerable proportion of the 'profit' -- goes to them (with the rest going toward costs and the publication of further books). Likewise, 10% of the money raised here on Indiegogo will go to Puvidham as well. Since I also wanted to publish works by others if I was successful, I've started a small publishing venture called Robin's Garden Books to bring them out. In this context, I have already started to publish another series of books, written by Nottingham music teacher Sue Lake, called "Stories from Musicland" (and the first of her books is out already).

What I need

I need your help to finish the 'Maya's Little Friends' series. I have published three of the planned five books already (which are entitled 'Snake's Mistake', 'Crow's Woes', and 'Snail's Travails' and are being offered as Perks here, see opposite and below). However, I don't have the resources at present to proceed further and bring out the final two projected books in the series (which are entitled 'Mouse's Grouses' and 'Squirrel's Quarrels'). I am currently working on 'Mouse's Grouses', the fourth book in the series. I hope to bring it out in a few months' time if the money can be raised. And if I can get this fourth book out, I can very likely get a professional distributor for all of these books, which I believe will help me get the final book out in due course as well.

In the first instance, I need to put together $8,000 (£5,000) to get 'Mouse's Grouses' in print. Children's books do cost a lot to bring into print, which is why, having brought out four books already, I am really struggling to bring out book number five. But if I can successfully accomplish that, it would really help things take off. This is the breakdown of the costs involved:

$2,000/ £1200 Illustrator's Fees

$1,000/ £700 Typesetting and preparing camera-ready copy for printer

$5,000/ £3000 Printing costs for a small run (1000 copies) of the book.

I am hoping to raise at least $2,500/ £1,500 towards my needs through this campaign -- I'd love to raise it all, but even this amount would put me well on the road to completing the project. I believe I can offer some really attractive Perks in exchange for your generous support.

What You Get

The details of what I am offering are listed opposite, but these include:

  • E-books or printed (signed) copies of the three books in the series that are already out, so you will get something that already exists for your support, regardless of how long it takes for  "Mouse's Grouses" to come out
  • Editorial services and writing consultancy for your own project (I am a professional editor with over fifteen years' experience working for many prestigious publishers, and have been an Advanced Member of the Society for Editors and Publishers; see www.sfep.org.uk/)
Please see opposite for the details, and feel free to obtain more than one Perk!

How your contribution helps others

If you support me by choosing one or more books as your Perk, then I will consider this as a 'sale' for practical purposes and 10% of the 'sale price' (which is a large proportion of the profit) will go, as usual, to support Puvidham school in Tamil Nadu, India (www.puvidham.org). So 10% of the money raised here after fees have been deducted will go to Puvidham. Furthermore, if your support helps Robin Garden Books to take off, you will have indirectly helped to support Puvidham through further sales.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by letting others know about this campaign, especially friends with kids in the relevant age ranges who are looking for something fresh that goes beyond the well-worn themes that children's books brought out by the big children's book publishers seem to tread these days.
 

The books being offered as Perks

A bit about the three books have already been published in the 'Maya's Little Friends' series (again, please visit the GALLERY for sample pages and reviews). These are:

'Snake's Mistake', suitable for ages 6-7;

'Crow's Woes', suitable for ages 5-6;

'Snail's Travails', suitable for children 3-5.

(Please note that ages are offered as rough guides only, and one could easily imagine a child a bit younger -- or older -- enjoying them just as much.)

These books are all written entirely in verse, and feature beautiful, full-page, full-color illustrations by Lotta Farber. They are (very loosely) based on folk tales from India (from the JATAKA and PANCHATANTRA collections). My goal was to contribute towards expanding the genre beyond the well-worn themes we see from large publishers that are available in the market today. I have uploaded images of the cover page and a sample spread from each of these books for you to check out, and also copies of some reviews etc. in the Gallery. These will tell you all about what's in the books without my having to take up space here. Please click on the GALLERY tab to check these out!

The two books  that will follow ('Mouse's Grouses" and "Squirrel's Quarrels") are aimed at children in the 8-10 age range, and as such are to be written in a combination of prose and verse, and featuring line illustrations that won't necessarily all be full-page or color.

The forthcoming book ("Mouse's Grouses")

"Mouse's Grouses" will be the fourth book in the _Maya's Little Friends_ series. It is aimed at 8-10 year-olds, and is a tale of hardship, perseverance in dark places, and eventual triumph -- accompanied by innovative black-and-white drawings. It is told in a mixture of prose and rhyme (including songs), very much inspired by Lewis Carroll, and contains some simple mathematical themes and ideas suitable for children of this age to ponder. With your help, I hope to have it out by the end of this year.

story:
About Stay 

 

 In Dec. of 2010, I started writing a book of Travel Memoirs. The words flowed easily from many experiences travelling around the world with music and etc. But it was the events of Jan. 27th, 2012 that stopped the process of me writing this Memoir and I put the writing on the shelf for the foreseeable future. After I returned to LA from my brother's funeral I sat and stared at all the words of this memoir that I had written and knew that I could no longer resume this writing with the same direction that I had first set out to do. The events, miracles, and emotions of those 2 1/2 weeks that started quite unexpectedly had to be told. I felt that there could be no better way to honor my brother than with this story and it seemed as if he was coercing me to write it. Not for the purpose of dwelling on a tragedy. But to tell an unbelievable story of how events can change in life within hours. And how people whom love one individual can end up in one city that were thousands of miles from each other the day before. This was no longer going to be a book of memoirs. This was no longer going to be a book telling of amazing adventures around the world. This was turning out to be a book that had to tell the unbelievable journey of my experiences in these 2 1/2 weeks and my experience with tragedy throughout my life. Not to dwell on tragedy for the sake of sorrow. But for the sake of hope and for the sake of the fellow grieving individual through any tragedy. Stay will be a book honoring my brother Todd's Life and a book to honor my Father's life. And a book that shares that even through injustice and tragedy. There is an amazing capacity for humankind to forgive, love, and move on, even if the obstacles seem insurmountable. With your help and funding, I will be able to finish writing, publish, and distribute this personal experience of faith, hope, and resilience through immense tragedy and hurt.

 Stay will be a book dedicated to those who have lost anyone close to him or her in this life. A book dedicated to anyone who has wandered throughout this life grieving a loss so dear while the world speeds by. I believe that 2012 was a year that many of us grieved those whom we lost that were close to us. And now I firmly believe that 2013 will be the year that we tell their stories. The 2 1/2 weeks that most of this book will focus on surrounding my brother's tragic death forever changed me. I knew that when I returned to the same place after I returned to LA. I firmly believed that this 2 1/2 week tragic journey ,that resulted in a changing hope, had to be told. I hope and pray to inspire, bring hope, reflect, and show that we are all united in this world through the loss of our loved ones. That we as human beings are fragile and have the potential for so many great things through the most trying of times.

The inspiration for the title "Stay" came from a song that I began writing after I started the journey home from my brother's funeral. To me it's an honest and emotional song displaying how many of us feel after a loss. We simply wish our loved one could've stayed a little longer. The day after this tragedy happened I also found myself stuck in Phoenix, AZ and I penned a blog detailing the first frantic 24 hours. You can read that blog at this link http://wp.me/p1Rnak-5g . There you can understand a little bit more of what we went through and I am filling in the rest of the miraculous events that took place in this coming book project. Thank you for helping me tell this story.. Thank you so much for this opportunity.

 

Why your funding will help?

This Project will be funded wholly and totally by YOU! Most authors have publishers who help fund, market, and distribute an author's work to the public after the final manuscript is edited and finished. But I have chosen to stay a self published author because of my want to distribute and market this book in the way that I want too. Also since this is a very personal project. A portion of the proceeds from the sales of this book will go to my family and certain expenses incurred from last years funeral costs and etc. 

The amount of $15,000.00 is needed for the printing, distribution, marketing, and various costs that a typical publishing company would usually pay for and I, the author, would normally have to reimburse them. Through your contributions, you will make it completely possible for me to finish and disseminate this work as I see fit. I appreciate your help and look forward to sharing the finished product with you and the world. We are shooting for a late summer/fall release of the finished product. And I have already finished a great deal of the writing.. What remains is a lot of editing :) art, more writing, some travelling, and the printing. A lot of work to do yet.. but for now I want to say a big THANK YOU! This will not be possible without you and your contributions.

 

How Stay will be read and experienced


Because everyone can consume reading materials in many different ways in the 21st century. I want to make this book available to everyone in every format, both physical and digital, so it can be bought in any store and read on any device on the market and still consumed by anyone who reads physical books. So here are the formats that we want to make this book available in.

1. Soft Cover Book - Purchased in select bookstores, my website, and Amazon.com

2. Ebook format in every readable digital format

3. Downloadable formats for Nook, ipad, Amazon Kindle, and kobo

4 Ebook will be available on Amazon.com, Barnes and Noble, Apple ibookstore, Sony Reader Store, Kobo, Copia, Baker and Taylor, Gardners Books, eBookPie, eSentral

 In Dec. of 2010, I started writing a book of Travel Memoirs. The words flowed easily from many experiences travelling around the world with music and etc. But it was the events of Jan. 27th, 2012 that stopped the process of me writing this Memoir and I put the writing on the shelf for the foreseeable future. After I returned to LA from my brother's funeral I sat and stared at all the words of this memoir that I had written and knew that I could no longer resume this writing with the same direction that I had first set out to do. The events, miracles, and emotions of those 2 1/2 weeks that started quite unexpectedly had to be told. I felt that there could be no better way to honor my brother than with this story and it seemed as if he was coercing me to write it. Not for the purpose of dwelling on a tragedy. And how people whom love one individual can end up in one city that were thousands of miles from each other the day before. This was no longer going to be a book of memoirs. story:
What's Going On Here?

A Bit About Me: My name is Benjamin Woodyard and I am an artist from Ottawa, Ontario. I received my Bachelor of Fine Art at NSCAD University in Halifax, Nova Scotia, and now live and work in Ottawa. Part of the reason I have returned to my hometown is that my mother passed away shortly after I graduated. I had things going on in Halifax, but felt that it was time to leave and spend some time regrouping at home. 

The Book: Shortly after my Mom died someone told me I shouldn't make any big decisions until six months had passed. It seemed like good advice, so I stuck around and got a job and a studio in Ottawa and spent time with my grief. In that six-month period I did a lot of drawing and writing, which I have compiled into this book. It is not a telling of my experience of grief per se, but moreso a glimpse into my mental state while grieving in that period immediately after her death. The drawings range from fiction to non-fiction comics as well as illustration, and the writing is all based on lived experiences. 

This project is fully self-directed and self-published. It being my first time, there have been some hurdles to overcome, but I have already printed the first edition. However, I am unable to fund printing anymore copies, but would like to have enough stock to distribute to bookstores. The way that the printing works is the more copies I order, the cheaper it is per book, so I'm aiming to raise as much as I can. Common practice in book stores is they don't pay you up front for the book, but when it sells, so I need to have enough books to provide book stores with stock as well as fulfill individual orders. 

The DEAL$

If I can raise a minimum of $300, I can print 25 books, just enough to fulfill individual orders and have a few extra to stock bookstores. If I can raise $420, I can print 50 books, which will be enough to have a small back stock for both individual orders and book stores. My ~*Big Goal*~ is to raise $1,000 to print as many books as I can (about 120) which would set me up to establish a self-sustaining cycle of printing and selling books!

Here's what you get for donating:

1) Donate $5 and get a little original drawing mailed to you!

2) Donate $15 and get an 8 1/2" X 11" print of a drawing from the book! 

3) Donate $20 and get a copy of the book!

4) Donate $25 and  get a copy of the book with a personalized note to ANYONE, could be you or someone else, signed by the artist!

5) Donate $50 and get a unique handmade mug, also made by me in the six-month period following my mother's passing. 

6) Donate $75 and get a mug AND a signed book with a personalized note!

(see the Gallery tab ^^^ for pictures)

SO: even if I don't reach my goal, I'll still print as many books as I can with the funds that I raise AND you'll still get your perks for contributing!

The Impact

This is my first book and I'm very excited to share it with the world! I've already printed the first edition and sold out of copies very quickly and have been getting all kinds of great feedback so far. Numerous people have approached me after reading the book with their own grieving stories to tell, and one of the unifying points they all have is that grief seems to be something that as a culture we brush under the rug. For me making this book seemed natural, and though it may be nerve-racking at times putting myself out there with material that I made in a period where I felt very raw, I think it is good for people to come together in those times. My hope is that the book will not only be an enjoyable read, but also encourage others to feel more comfortable with their grief, and by extension other life-changing experiences, and feel empowered to share their own stories. 

Risks & Challenges

As an artist I tend to tackle large projects, and usually have two or three on the go at once. During university I was granted access to the facilities to really accommodate this working process and produced multiple large projects. Now that I am graduated and working on repaying student loans and making a living while maintaining an artistic practice I have returned to the basics, if you will, and have been spending more time drawing in my sketchbook and working on more affordable projects. This has not stunted my productivity, merely provided a challenge which I readily accept. 

I have been approaching book stores in the Ottawa area, as well as Montreal, and they so far have been receptive to selling the books, if only I had any to sell! It all comes down to one simple problem: stock stock stock. I need a hefty stock of books to be able to get this thing off the ground and into stores! The material is all there, the printers are ready and familiar with the project, now I just need the funds to print a lot of books.

Other Ways You Can Help

I get it if you can't afford to help out. Hey neither can I, that's why I'm here! But sharing this campaign is a great help in itself. Thanks for reading and please share!

story:
Just Good Enough for the Climate - the math of the planet and the color of carbon is a book about climate change, carbon markets and the inspiring stories of entrepreneurs, investors, scientists and policy makers at the forefront of the climate challenge. The book explores the simple math of the planet we face. I explore a wide range of exciting solutions and the principles of action we need to employ to make the progress we must.

Climate change is a defining issue of our time. Nearly every day we see the impact of our warming climate - record wildfires, rising seas, intense floods and heatwaves. To avoid the worst consequences of man-made climate change, we need to reduce our CO2 emissions by 50 billion tons per year and further remove 200-300 billion tons of CO2 already in the atmosphere.

My name is James Earl Anderson and I am the author of Just Good Enough for the Climate - the math of the planet and the color of carbon. I wrote this book because I was inspired by the stories of entrepreneurs, scientists and policy makers working at the forefront of the climate crisis. I wanted to tell their stories and add my voice by providing a practical business oriented view on climate change that could inspire action.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the importance of taking action on the climate crisis, how many ways people are already making a difference, and how much more can be done. With this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the environment, climate change mitigation efforts, business solutions, and the principles of action and innovation that can lead us forward. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you make sense of climate change - the challenges and potential solutions. I hope it will inspire action by all of us to do more.

In this book, you'll learn that the over arching math of the climate is not that complicated. I review a number of the innovations that can help us combat climate change, as well as the importance of ecosystem benefits, and how we can enhance them by changing our view of nature. You'll hear stories such as...

  • How the IPCC's dogged pursuit of the science is turning the tide.
  • How venture funded start ups are launching and scaling solutions to meet the climate challenge
  • How a diverse array of financial instruments are being used to fund and support climate change mitigation efforts
  • The amazing importance of ecosystem services and how rethinking our relationship with nature can enhance these essential benefits

You will love this book if you want to learn more about climate change, the stories of people innovating new solutions to the climate challenge and the principles of action that can get us there.

Just Good Enough for the Climate is a nonfiction book that speaks to the general public, business people and investors who want to look at climate change, our connection with the environment, and the principles of innovation in a new way.

The book is written in three parts.

Part 1 “We’re F**ked” Get Over It, contains the introduction + chapters 1-4, and provides an overview of the climate change challenge. It outlines the carbon cycle and the math of the planet in simple terms. It shows how a complex array of changes, not a simple one size fits all solution, can help us make progress.  It shows how we can overcome the climate challenge if we take action.

Part 2 Principles that Get Us There, contains chapters 5-8, and describes the principles of action that are essential to making progress. It provides an overview of how innovations are stacked on top of each other and not confined to technology, but can be applied everywhere. It also talks about climate finance and how a whole system of funding mechanisms needs to be more engaged to provide the resources necessary to overcome climate change.

Part 3 Existence Theorems, contains chapters 9-14, and talks about all the colors of carbon and vast array of solutions that are available to make real progress. We can improve how we manage our forests and farms. We can preserve the oceans. We can change our built world, how we generate energy and the circular economy to make rapid progress.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get...

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in Dec. 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Fall 2021.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.

  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

 

Finally, and most importantly... this campaign will offset all the CO2 emissions associated with the creation, production and distribution of the book.  It will be a net-negative CO2 undertaking (see FAQ's for details)

  • 1 ton of carbon sequestration credit will be purchased for every $200 donated to the campaign
  • Tree planting is included in every pre-order contribution perk.  The more you contribute, the more trees get planted
  • Special perks include more carbon offsets and more tree planting.  

Your contributions will not only help spread the word of the book but they will also help us take one little step towards solving the climate crisis. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can make a contribution, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit.)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #ColorOfCarbon and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Tag:

  • Instagram - jearla66 / @newdegreepress
  • Facebook - james.e.anderson.10 / @NewDegreePress
  • Twitter - @jearla66 / @NewDegreePress

THANK YOU!

 

About the Author

James Earl Anderson (Jim) is Vice President of Sales for Advanced Environmental Monitoring, a weather and environmental monitoring company that provides services to large enterprises and government agencies to improve operations, and to protect lives and assets. He is also the Chair of HMEI - the Hydrometeorology Industry Association, and a member of the Environmental Technologies Trade Advisory Committee (ETTAC) within the U.S. Department of Commerce.

Jim has been enthralled with the natural world for most of his life and interested in environmental policy for all of his adult life.

Outside of work he is a mediocre soccer coach, bee keeper, hiker, biker, skier, yogi and gardener. He's accident prone. And, most importantly, he is father of three amazing young woman, who still agree to spend nights in a tent with him under the stars.

For more information, you can connect with Jim at jearla66@gmail.com and LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, or Instagram. 
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

Use this form Intl Shipping to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

story:
About the People

In Spirit, Power and Truth (I SPAT) signifies that by embracing the Spirit, God grants us the Power to walk in Truth. I Spat Publishing is a company began by writer and entrepreneur, Stephanie R. Bridges. 

Stephanie R. Bridges is dedicated to the creation and promotion of quality Christian based media for saint and sinner alike, for we all were the latter. She lives in Columbus, OH, and has a B.S. Degree in Secondary English Education from The Ohio State University. Stephanie writes songs, poetry, children's books, etc., and is always open to collaborative efforts.

I SPAT Children's Book Series is a collaborative effort with illustrator, Taylor Hicks.

Taylor Hicks is an eclectic artist who dabbles in a little bit of everything. He grew up in Columbus, Ohio and Attended the Columbus College Of Art & Design where he majored in illustration. His main objective as an artist is to create work for people by making their dreams into something tangible and awesome. Taylor has been making art all of his life, and he has no plans of stopping anytime soon.

About the Project

I SPAT Children's Titles

The Book Series is a set of four books based on Stephanie's four children and their very unique personalities. Each of whom are trying to find their way in their world with God’s guidance. The books explore a child’s unique way of understanding his or her world and how they fit into it from a spiritual perspective. Poetic prose are used to express accomplishment, anger, jealousy and joy.

If I Were Part of the Animal Kingdom is a book about Khalil who loves animals but hates being told what to do. We escape with him on a journey into the animal kingdom where there are no rules. He finally decides that it isn't so bad being a boy, because he is a part of God's Kingdom, created in His image, with many capabilities and freedom sweet freedom to be whatever chooses.

My Favorite Color is Blue is about Asha who loves school and the color blue. Learning for this little girl is a fantasy awash in her favorite hue. She uses the color blue to explore the importance of book knowledge, the obstacles we had to overcome to gain it, and the wonder and wisdom of the Good Book, God provides as a guide for life. Asha excels in school and her future is bright as the blue sky.

Fight the Air Guy is a book about Jelani who fights for the attention that he feels he does not get at home. We watch as his alter ego takes on the air and is triumphant in every battle. He wants nothing more than to find his place in the family and in the world. Through his inner turmoil he realizes that he is more than capable of excelling in various arenas, and there are people all around him that celebrate his individuality. Most importantly, he knows he is the child of the All Powerful, but he still occasionally enjoys fighting the air.

Can't We All Just Get Along is about Nandi growing up in a household of older siblings that battle over everything - who gets the front seat, who's looking at who, and who called it first. She has her mind set on teaching her siblings how to balance fighting and having fun with each other by example and through song (she is still working on the song part). Nandi has wholeheartedly embraced that she is Her Brother's Keeper. God has called her to be a Queen that will hold tribes, families, nations together.

About the Impact

I want young people to see themselves in the characters and on the back cover, and say, "That's me." - an illustrator, animal lover, super hero, community organizer, educator, song writer, child of the Most High. By embracing who we are, we tell the next generation it is okay to dream! By embracing who they are, we tell the next generation it is okay to be. I am black, a single mother, a Christian, a native Ohioan, a writer and now just now my dream is beginning to overtake my reality. I want children to know that it is okay to scream from the rooftops I'm black and I'm proud, no matter who cries reverse racism. I want single parents to know it is okay to hold your head up, no matter who shakes theirs back at you. I want artists to know it is okay to create Christian work, no matter how much your market shrinks. I want Ohioans to know it is okay to shout O-H, and I'll shout back I-O, no matter where we are in the world! (although people might think you are cray, including me.) I want writers/artists/creators to know it is okay to be. There is a child that will read your work, see your art, hear your music and be forever changed or nah. But we are who we are. Our call is our cross. Lets bear it on our backs, wear it on our chests, and rock it like God has got us for an eternity! 

About the Money

I did everything that I could to contain, conform, confound my Spirit to be "acceptable". But God said continue. And then I thought perhaps, I could just do it all on my own, and I wouldn't have to bother anybody else. But as reclusive as I can be naturally, God is showing me that I cannot develop Spiritually without you. People; I need people. When I explained to my son Khalil what oxymoron meant at around the age of eight, he responded, "Oh, you mean like rich mom." The money will be used to pay for the illustrations and self publishing costs of all four books. The illustrations will come to around $6000 and publishing will come close to $8000. So, in order to complete all four books, it will come to $14,000 altogether. I have began personally investing in the project and applying for Grants, as well.

About That

I know everyone cannot contribute financially, but I would like to share my sincere gratitude for you viewing my campaign. Please help spread the Good News. Please more than anything else pray for me or someone else today. God Bless.

story:
¿Qué?

El museo de la lluvia es la apasionante y atribulada existencia de dos hermanos luchando por sobrevivir en un mundo, quizás, demasiado perfecto. Una oda a la imaginación recubierta de crujiente ambientación sci-fi cumpliendo de sobra con las expectativas de los amantes del género.

Grance, el planeta en el que la lluvia puede matarte o convertirte en una celebridad… y es que en este lugar nunca llueve agua. Así es el mundo en el que habitan dos jóvenes hermanos que han perdido absolutamente todo y que harán lo imposible por sobrevivir en las calles de Aitía, una importante ciudad en la que parece que todo es perfecto y nada puede salir mal.

Sin embargo, hasta una sociedad perfecta como Aitía tiene desechos y desperdicios, entre los que se incluyen algunos de sus habitantes, gente que no comparte los mismos valores y principios, por muy perfectos que sean, e inadaptados con mutaciones genéticas cuyos poderes pueden cambiar las vidas de las personas que les rodean.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Ibán S. Macanás.

Nacido en Murcia en 1985, me licencié en Ingeniería de Telecomunicaciones en Cartagena y desde entonces ejerzo como consultor informático. Una vida que, como en principio parece, poco o nada tiene que ver con la labor de dar forma a historias sobre blanco y negro. Sin embargo, un amor temprano por los cuentos y los tebeos han hecho que tenga una necesidad imperiosa de tener siempre un libro a medio leer y un sinfín de personajes, mundos y aventuras rondando por mi mente y a los que debo dar salida si no quiero que, al final, me invadan por completo.

Siempre he creído que escribir es como tener un superpoder: puedes provocar emociones en alguien solamente por leer aquellas palabras que tú has puesto en un orden determinado. Es una habilidad increíble y no pienso dejar de entrenarla.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El museo de la lluvia que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Ibán S. Macanás vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
To meet the rising demands of the literary marketplace, we need your help!

Your investment will help us print faster, bigger, and better with this top-of-the-line obsolete technology.

 

Um, this is nothing fancy...

Ugly Duckling Presse has been happily making do with scavenged, heavily used, and seriously flawed technology for about 20 years: from over-tonered xerox machines to wonky saddle-stitchers, crooked straight-edges, and squeaky clam-shell presses. We have always printed our own book covers and ephemera on available tools to cut costs, and along the way we seem to have developed an amateur design style, a mix of intuition, material opportunism, and elbow grease. 

We would like to keep working this way and training our interns and apprentices in the art and craft of DIY letterpress printing. But there is a limit to our patience with uncooperative machinery! 

Our most important piece of printing equipment has slowly gone from challenging to unusable.

To keep ourpublishing program going, we need a decent, working press that's built to do what we need it to do -- print faster, bigger, and better -- so we can crank out 1000 copies of a cover and bind some poetry inside. 

Help raise the funds we need to purchase and move a hulking Vandercook proofing press sometime this fall.

 

Please consider donating. Any amount is welcome. 

We're a nonprofit, so take a tax break, and we'll promise to keep printing poetry.

 

The thing costs like $10,000, moving included.

We're hoping to make five grand here and start looking for a press.

 

Any leads?

If you can lead us to a good press we'll give you a year-long subscription.

If you can donate or lead us to a free working press we will give you a lifetime subscription to UDP and engrave your name on the press. 

 

Thanks!

THE UDP TEAM

story:
Our Story

Why are we doing this? Because we’ve had enough!

On January 24th, 2011, a Toronto police officer gave some advice that is all too common: “Women should avoid dressing like sluts in order not to be victimized.” From an 11-year-old in Texas being blamed for being gang-raped to a teenager in Seattle not being able to file rape charges because witnesses “portrayed the act as consensual,” this line of thought pervades our culture. As long as it seems like the woman might like sex, they’re made to take the blame.

The idea that women invite sexual violence by looking like they enjoy sex, or that men’s urges become so uncontrollable at the sight of a little extra skin that they can’t hold themselves back from raping, is ludicrous. People aren’t assaulted because they invited it or enticed others to it by looking a certain way; they’re assaulted because somebody chose to assault them. Saying that survivors could have protected themselves by not looking like “sluts” implies that the survivors are at fault and creates a culture in which the heinous crime of sexual assault is seen as no big deal.

Whatever reason a person is called a “slut,” the word is always meant to hurt them. In addition, the use of the word “slut” to bring people—primarily women—down for their sexuality feeds into a culture that accepts rape. When people are brought down for their sexual choices, it dehumanizes them and allows others to see them as not as worthy of protection from violence. As long as people are judged for how few or how many sex partners they have, how rarely or how often they have sex, or whatever other choices they make for their own sex lives, we cannot eradicate the myth that survivors of sexual assault were “asking for it.”

We’re sick of slut-shaming and victim-blaming being a part of our culture, so we’re doing something about it: we’re going to make our voices heard. This June we will walk in Seattle to stand together, fight the social acceptance of rape in our culture, and re-appropriate the word “slut” as one that cannot be used to harm.

People of all orientations, gender identities, races, ages, abilities, walks of life, and levels of sluttiness are invited to join us. All we ask is that you stand with us for what is right. We’re sick of being shamed for our sex choices and being told that survivors of sexual assault brought it on themselves. If you’re sick of it too, come walk with us!


What We Need & What You Get

We're looking for help to cover the costs of putting on this event. This includes things like permit costs, sound equipment rental, sign-making supplies, printing costs, and speaker fees. Right now, we're doing this all out of pocket, but it'd be nice not to put up all the cash. 

Any money that goes beyond our costs will be donated to local charities and shelters for survivors of rape, sexual violence and abuse, and/or domestic abuse.


Other Ways You Can Help: COME MARCH!

Come to our walk! We meet at Bobby Morris Playfield at 12pm on June 19th. We'll then march down Pike St. to Westlake, where we'll rally. Our Facebook event page is here. For information on other SlutWalks all around the world (including several in the Pacific NW), see the full list.

story:
Our Story

Most of us first learn about Angels when we are children, but how many of us really know and understand our connection to the celestial realm of God's many messengers?  Many children often speak about the imaginary friends they play with at school or at home. Could these playmates be their loving Angels and Spirit Guides?

 

What we may not acknowledge as adults, because we may not physically see them, is exactly what is needed for our children to grow-up empowered and fearless. The knowledge that Angels are around us all the time ready and willing to help us with any problem or crisis that confronts us is a great asset to our spiritual growth and personal development.

 

As a visionary artist and hypnotherapist, I remember my first encounter with an Angel when I was soaking in the bathtub at the age of 6. I would imagine an Angel on my shoulder whispering words of encouragement in my ear. At the ages of 0 to 6, we are downloading programming that is taught to us by people in our environment. We are told what to believe and what not to believe. Often times the beliefs serve us well, but sometimes they don't. By acknowledging the Angels and Spirit Guides who are around us to guide us at a young age, as we grow older our journey through life's ups and downs will be less tumultuous and more balanced.  

 

This 56 page Angels and Spirit Guides Coloring and Activity Book, written and illustrated by me, Wanda Whitaker, portrays Angels and Spirit Guides of different cultures and backgrounds as well as the specific roles they may play in our lives. Additionally, children learn how to connect with them. Fun activities allow the readers to explore their inner creativity while discovering the love within themselves and the love Angels have for them.

 

Nine Archangels including  Metatron, Michael, Gabriel, Raphael, Uriel, Ariel, Zadkiel, Raguel, and Chamuel are featured as well as explanations about the difference between Guardian Angels and Spirit Guides.

 

The project fulfills my Divine life purpose - to educate, empower and inspire others through the arts and sciences.. For more information, visit my website at www.anchoredinspirit.com.

 

The Impact

As I've grown older and more spiritually aware, I've experienced my Angels and Spirit Guides more often. Most recently, they have helped me prepare for my mother's transitioning (death). My mother, who's name happened to be Angelyn, was my inspiration. That's why I've dedicated this book to her and all of the families going through end-of-life care for a loved one or

story:
Short Summary

The Transgender Resource Center of New Mexico has a long track record of pioneering programs designed for transgender folks here in our community. We provide transgender "cultural humility" training all over the state of New Mexico, do advocacy at the individual and policy level, and operate a drop-in center where we offer tons of services to our community. You can check us out at www.tgrcnm.org or on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/TGRCNM. 

In addition to helping folks with basic survival needs, we are also committed to programs that nurture the dreams and talents of our community members. We are collaborating with the Southwest Gay & Lesbian Film Festival to bring the first transgender film festival to the entire southwest region on April 5, 2014 - with amazing support through our Indiegogo campaign, where we reached our $1000 goal. And now, we want to work with local talented poets to come in and help our community members with  their poetry. These workshops will take place once per month and will culminate in the publication of a real anthology book. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need a total of $2000 for one year of this program. We will use the funds to provide a small stipend to the visiting poets and to purchase special food for the workshops. We are managing to do a program like this on a real shoestring, so you can rest assured that your donation will go straight to the program. 

We would love to shout out to you on our Facebook page for your support. At the $25 level, we will get you your own copy of the book we publish at the end of the year. 

The Impact

If you aren't familiar with the challenges that transgender folks face in our world right now, they are quite severe. In 2011, the National Center for Transgender Equality and the National Gay & Lesbian Task Force surveyed 6500 trans* people and the resulting document was entitled Injustice At Every Turn. You can check it out here: http://www.thetaskforce.org/reports_and_researc.... Every day, we work with folks who are experiencing incredible discrimination, family rejection and very real physical violence, simply because they are transgender. We provide HIV testing, a shower, laundry facilities, food, case management and so much more. But we don't simply want to help people survive. We want to help them tap into their talents and fulfill their dreams! This is going to be such a special program and you can be part of it with your donation. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help with money, we would ask you to help spread the word about us in general and about this campaign specifically. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to post to Facebook, Twitter and other social media outlets. Thanks for any help you can provide!

story:
Hi,

I'm a professional illustrator since 1980 as well a veteran fencer and coach, father of a cadet fencer girl. The mix of my experiences lead me to make an illustrated book about fencing. Not a manual but an overview about this sport. I hope it can be an help for the families and their kids at the first approach. I already published the Italian version but due every country have is own fencing world I need to do more custom editions. 

This kind of book don't let too much space for big incoming, so is better take the self publishing way. I have more projects and my dream isn't only publish this book but maybe run a publisher house about illustrated fencing. Please support me to come the dream true.

For the moment I need funds  for USA and maybe UK versions to lunch for Xmas gift campaign. Of course every supporter will have is reward as one or more copies, more generous, a poster or a limited and signed printed illustration.  

I'm sorry if some words aren't correct on preview, I'm editing the text.

Thanks 
Ciao
Massimiliano ( call me Max :)

Please visit this link to see the Italian edition :

http://issuu.com/massimilianolongo/docs/conosce...



The US edition cover




    and British cover of course.....




    A UK edition page

    ( text aren't completely edited)




    The USA page about the uniform:



    The grand salute unveiled!


    The referee poster, the  reward add bonus!


    A real size game to teaching, learning and gaming!

    #fencingflashmob  me,  on board of  PlanetSolar the bigest sun powered ship of the world! Long life to fencing!

story:
Through my work with Live Different, I have seen lives altered on many levels. I have helped to give wings to programs that have helped to give hundreds of families safe and healthy homes, restored broken dreams and changed perspectives globally. I have also known what it is to struggle and wonder if you can ever make a difference that will last.

And the answer is Yes! We Can!

Hi, I'm Christal Earle. As the co-founder of an international youth empowerment and humanitarian charity, I have been an integral part of making change in lives across Canada and globally since 2000. I have invested my energy, passion and vision into making the world a safer and freer place for those who have experienced pain and exploitation because I believe that we each have the power to make a difference in our world.

That change has to start with who we are and what we believe about ourselves.

I have dedicated my life to helping to make a path for the next generation. I have personally mentored and coached hundreds of young leaders and humanitarians and I am now intent on doing that in a new capacity: coaching and creating community for entrepreneurs and social change makers around the globe.
My sights are now set on using my speaking and writing gifts to reach a larger audience with a unique and personal call to action: The call to first change the story we are telling ourselves about who we are and what we are capable of accomplishing. 

Resonate is not just about my story -- it's about the stories we all find ourselves living out on every level.

I have created tangible ways in my book that can help us to change the world, starting with how we view ourselves and our individual power of choice. 
We all need someone to believe in us, and sometimes the first person we need to convince is ourselves!

And that's why I'm asking you to help make this message bigger, louder and more accessible to those who need it most!

Resonate: The Stories We Tell Ourselves is a book, a workbook, a coaching/mentoring program and a movement for change. It's a message that is alive inside of me and I believe it's a message that can help heal and restore millions of lives. I have been changed by hope and I invite you to help me and my team make that change real for thousands of lives around the globe.

We truly need your help to launch Resonate in the fall of 2014!

By contributing to the Resonate campaign, you will be a part of three very significant steps towards continuing to heal our world.
ONE - By helping our team publish the book and release the programs around it, I truly believe that the message contained in the book can help to create change and hope in your own life.
TWO- You can help us to get the message out to more lives to uncover the power of their story to heal and change the world through purchasing a perk that comes with extra copies of the book.
Three - You will help us to make the world a safer and freer world for women and children, as 10% of book sales are going directly to help victims of trafficking and exploitation with an organization that Christal and Live Different have supported and volunteered with since 2006.

By being a part of our campaign, you are literally going to help to RESONATE  hope and change around the world! We can't do it alone - and we want to create change together with you.

Over the next 32 days we are seeking to raise $17,500 in our campaign. Here is what we plan to do with that money:
$3500    Professional Editing by Milner and Associates
$2500    Publishing and Access to retail distribution to over 25,000 global book retailers via Friesens Press and Ingram Book Company 
$4000    Book Release event management (includes social media, advertising and book release program for 5 months until our official book launch in the fall)

$2800    Support of pre-launch perks and "Resonate" products via Indiegogo 
$1700     Video, photography and editing for campaign launch
$1500    Website Design and Development
$1500   Projected Donation to Buddies Along the Road from Pre-sales B (if we reach our full funding goal of $17,500)

*If we exceed our goal, we will use additional funds to amp up our online campaign for the book launch, as well as continue to put 10% of pre-sales towards Buddies Along The Road in Thailand.

The Resonate Campaign is centred around the pre-sale of books to help cover the costs of professional editing, publishing and distribution. However, as you can see from the list of perks, I am also calling for us to work together to help create change through getting more copies of the book into the hands of those who need it most and through the power that can come through personal coaching and mentoring.

AND BECAUSE OF MY COMMITMENT TO CONTINUING TO BE A PART OF HOPE AND CHANGE ON A GLOBAL LEVEL...

In the future 10% of all total print book sales are going directly to projects that our team supports globally that are focused on fighting exploitation and slavery.

The organization that we will be supporting through our portion is called Buddies Along the Road, a children's home that I have personally worked with through Live Different since 2006.  Buddies Along the Road focuses on rescuing and rehabilitating children from Thailand and Myanmar who have been victimized by sexual exploitation and slavery. They are helping to create a future of hope for them through the security that comes from belonging and solidarity -- and I am honoured to be able to play a part in helping to create that future.
It's possible for our generation to help end exploitation and shame, but we have to be willing to recognize the power of our life to make that difference. Resonate is a call to recognize the power of our lives and this financial commitment through book sales is me putting actions to my words.

It's possible that you may not be able to contribute to the campaign right now, and I understand. But that doesn't mean you can't be a powerful part of making it bigger and better! Please make some noise with us and share the campaign through the tools below. Many voices can make big waves of change as they resonate together.

We can change the stories that we all tell ourselves. For a better future. Together.


Info graphic created by coolgraphics890 -  To Learn More Please Click Here

Buddies Along the Road's aim is to intercept the children from the human-traffickers and to ensure the fundamental human rights of these street children are upheld and are given the chance of living a quality life.

To Learn More Please Click Here

 

Freedom Culture is a lifestyle brand that is inspired by HOPE, dedicated to FREEDOM, and passsionate about CULTURE. We donate a portion of each sale to ending the sale of humans. Join us. Love Wins!
To Learn More Please Click Here

We are about change. We are about hope. We are about the continual dream and reality of making a positive difference in the world around us. We believe that together, we really can make a difference!
To Learn More Please Click Here

"The rich, captivating stories within Resonate: The Stories We Tell Ourselves will do more than entertain and astonish you. They will challenge you to bravely toss aside any masks you hide behind and discover the freedom gained from releasing those empty feelings of inadequacy, pain and self-doubt. With gentle authenticity and courageous vulnerability, Christal masterfully relates her personal triumphs and tragedies. Be prepared to experience a powerful connection with a world class humanitarian and at the same time receive exceptional clarity on what is needed to create a vibrant, passionate and fulfilling life.  I recommend taking this emotional, insightful journey towards self-discovery."  William J. Nippard, Author of The Teamwork Ladder: 8 Steps to MAXIMUM Success

"Christal has a way with words that simply pulls you in - and doesn't let you go. Her stories are for you, me, every woman who has ever experienced fear, uncertainly, loss... but also joy, connection, purpose. This book has the power to change lives; it needs to get out into the world." Carol Schulte, www.carolschulte.com

"An emotionally charged book that is honest and raw.  It delivers painful truths with a lot of passion and a little bit of humour.  In this life we write our own stories and create our own histories.  But with this book we are given a chance to craft a future with a better version of ourselves. A stronger more confident self." Angela Cacciavillani

"Resonate:  The Stories We Tell Ourselves is at once contemplative, riveting and practical.  Christal brings you along on her journey with an honesty and authenticity not often shared.  She selflessly hands you the tools she fought so hard for, so that you can apply them to your own life story.  If you endeavour to live a life that you script, rather than being the victim of life's circumstances, then this book has to be on your "must read" list." Cheryl Boyce, Chief Freedomizer at Freedom Culture

"Christal is a master storyteller so it seems quite fitting that she is writing on the subject of the power of the stories we tell ourselves.  Though it is clear that she writes very purposefully and withcarefully crafted language, Christal also writes with a warmth and her own personal style that makes you feel like you're sitting down for coffee with a good friend.  The kind of friend who isn't afraid to open right up to you and let you see her for who she really is. 

Walk away with new insights on how to discover the lies you have been believing and how to plant new seeds of truth in your mind. Be empowered to tell the stories you want your life to tell and be reminded of the connections between our own stories and those of people around the world." Sara Brown, Certified Funeral Celebrant, Teller of Real-Life Stories at www.sarabrowncelebrant.com

6 WEEK interactive group coaching experience that might just result in an extreme shift in how you understand, share and leverage your story from this point forward. The Story Shifters Experience will take you on a journey of exploration, growth and strategy and it is for those who want to be part of a group where they can build relationships and connections, grow in their own confidence and understanding of who they are, and be a part of a growing community of brilliance!  To Learn More Please Click Here

Is this book just an autobiography or memoir?
No, we would call this book 'inspirational'. Although Christal uses many personal stories from her life and the people she has worked with, the book is truly about helping readers find their own story and find direction through that process.

What if I purchase a coaching session but don't yet know who I want to give it to?
It's all good! Just email angela@yourbrillianceunlimited.com and she will make arrangements with you to contact your recipient. You have until June 30, 2014 (the last day of the campaign) to give us the name of your recipient.

When is my order likely to arrive?
We’re working closely with the distribution team to have all e-books and print copies delivered before the end of October.  Please note that due to overwhelming demand, these are our best estimations. We will contact you via Indiegogo update and direct email with exact dates after our campaign. We cannot tell you an exact date at this point.

I entered my address incorrectly. Can I change it?
No problem. Please email to angela@yourbrillianceunlimited.com with subject title: ‘Address Change’. Thank you. 

How do I add Shipping? 
Shipping must be added manually. Follow these steps: Click on the perk you want. You will see a box that reads "How much would you like to contribute?" Add the cost of your shipping to the cost of your perk. Easy! If you have already contributed but forgot shipping, you can edit your pledge amount through your account. If you still have questions or need assistance please email angela@yourbrillianceunlimited.com with the address title ‘confused shipping’.

Why is international shipping so expensive? 
We want to acknowledge that the cost of shipping internationally is expensive. We worked with multiple carriers in search of the best solution to ship these books. Most importantly, we want the book to arrive safe and fast. 

Where do I add my shipping address? 
You can add it when you contribute. If you forgot to include this then don’t worry - at the end of the campaign, we will email you requesting your shipping address, email and any other information required to process your order.

A stronger more confident self." Angela Cacciavillani"Resonate:  The Stories We Tell Ourselves is at once contemplative, riveting and practical.  Christal brings you along on her journey with an honesty and authenticity not often shared.  She selflessly hands you the tools she fought so hard for, so that you can apply them to your own life story.  If you endeavour to live a life that you script, rather than being the victim of life's circumstances, then this book has to be on your "must read" list." Cheryl Boyce, Chief Freedomizer at Freedom Culture"Christal is a master storyteller so it seems quite fitting that she is writing on the subject of the power of the stories we tell ourselves.  Though it is clear that she writes very purposefully and withcarefully crafted language, Christal also writes with a warmth and her own personal style that makes you feel like you're sitting down for coffee with a good friend.  The kind of friend who isn't afraid to open right up to you and let you see her for who she really is. Walk away with new insights on how to discover the lies you have been believing and how to plant new seeds of truth in your mind. Be empowered to tell the stories you want your life to tell and be reminded of the connections between our own stories and those of people around the world." Sara Brown, Certified Funeral Celebrant, Teller of Real-Life Stories at www.sarabrowncelebrant.com6 WEEK interactive group coaching experience that might just result in an extreme shift in how you understand, share and leverage your story from this point forward. The Story Shifters Experience will take you on a journey of exploration, growth and strategy and it is for those who want to be part of a group where they can build relationships and connections, grow in their own confidence and understanding of who they are, and be a part of a growing community of brilliance!  To Learn More Please Click Here

Is this book just an autobiography or memoir?No, we would call this book 'inspirational'. Although Christal uses many personal stories from her life and the people she has worked with, the book is truly about helping readers find their own story and find direction through that process.What if I purchase a coaching session but don't yet know who I want to give it to?It's all good! Just email angela@yourbrillianceunlimited.com and she will make arrangements with you to contact your recipient. You have until June 30, 2014 (the last day of the campaign) to give us the name of your recipient.When is my order likely to arrive?We’re working closely with the distribution team to have all e-books and print copies delivered before the end of October.  Please note that due to overwhelming demand, these are our best estimations. We will contact you via Indiegogo update and direct email with exact dates after our campaign. We cannot tell you an exact date at this point.I entered my address incorrectly. Can I change it?No problem. Please email to angela@yourbrillianceunlimited.com with subject title: ‘Address Change’. Thank you. How do I add Shipping? Shipping must be added manually. Follow these steps: Click on the perk you want. You will see a box that reads "How much would you like to contribute?" Add the cost of your shipping to the cost of your perk. Easy! If you have already contributed but forgot shipping, you can edit your pledge amount through your account. If you still have questions or need assistance please email angela@yourbrillianceunlimited.com with the address title ‘confused shipping’.Why is international shipping so expensive? We want to acknowledge that the cost of shipping internationally is expensive. We worked with multiple carriers in search of the best solution to ship these books. Most importantly, we want the book to arrive safe and fast. Where do I add my shipping address? You can add it when you contribute. If you forgot to include this then don’t worry - at the end of the campaign, we will email you requesting your shipping address, email and any other information required to process your order.
