(Note: 90% of content shown in video is directly from the book.)


A Quick Overlook

Project Prolepsis is the fictional historical account of the oceanic city of Prolepsis. The city stood on a circular platform in the middle of the Pacific Ocean near California. It was founded in 1927 by a man named Henry Johnson, who believed that remembering the past robbed people of true free will. As a result, Prolepsian citizens had to forfeit their knowledge of the past in order to live there. The timing of the Great Depression served Johnson well as people flocked to his city to escape poverty. No one, not even Johnson, expected that in just a few years, Prolepsis citizens would actually begin to see the future!


A Fictional Story Set in a Real Time Period

As the events of Project Prolepsis unfold, the reader will find references to what is going on in the rest of the world during the 1930's. Real important historical figures will also be mentioned throughout the book and might actually play a role in the fictional events of Prolepsis. 


A Content-Driven Book

Though a narrative will guide the reader through the timeline and give insight to the content around it, it will be everyday things like letters, newspaper articles, advertisements, and audio dictations (to Prolepsis these were common) that ultimately tell the bulk of the tale.

A Prophetic Culture

The main focus of Project Prolepsis, which is uncommon in other books, is not necessarily the individuals who see the future themselves, but the culture created by the presence of hundreds of prophetic citizens. The fascinating inventions, social structures, and architecture that arose from the fusion of 1930's technology and glimpses into the near and far future are good examples of this.


What Happened? Who's the Author?

Project Prolepsis is a historical account. The city mysteriously disappeared from the face of the earth around 1941. Many didn't notice its absence until much later. The author of the book is the only known survivor of Prolepsis. However, this person is not very anxious to disclose their identity. 


What Support Will Go Towards

Both the physical book and ebook will come with bonus audio/visual content to bring the text to life. This Kickstarter will go towards hiring voice actors to portray the main characters and graphic artists to create stunning and accurate visuals. The collaborative storytelling of the visuals, audio, and text are what make this book unique.

Thank you for your support! 


Visit the interactive website to see more content: www.projectprolepsis.com


(Note: Site works best on computer, not mobile device.)

story:
The project

This project is about opening a unique book store, Letters Matters, right in the heart of Lisbon, containing only the most important books ever written. How do I know what they are? I asked over 1000 readers from around  the globe to share the books that have had the biggest impact on their life journey. I would like you to contribute too.

But Letters Matters is more than just a place that sells important books. It is an atmosphere bookshop, an emotional bookshop, an inspiration and a motivation bookshop. It is a large space designed to be able to hold music gigs, artist exhibitions, literary circles and workshops. The store will contain a café serving fresh, delicious, healthy food in full acknowledgment that we need to nourish our minds, souls and bodies alike.

Letters Matters is a place for conversation and connection, an attempt to reconnect people with books and with each other. To give back time, time to discover letters, ideas, tastes and emotions, to express and discover yourself. It is meant to create a true and long forgotten comfortable ambience, non-virtual social media surrounding, to inspire people, help build their confidence, and open their hearts and minds to dreaming again.

The story behind it 

My name is Florentin Bosse, a "professional nomad", born in Bucharest, with German ancestors and a Portuguese heart, who lived and worked in New York, Chicago, London, Paris, Frankfurt, München, Berlin and Lisbon.  

I had the idea of creating this place of harmony, wisdom and emotional well- being during my five month self-imposed exile from society – when I undertook a solitary pilgrimage of over 3.800 km, from Berlin to Santiago de Compostella in Spain and further to Fatima in Portugal. I came back from my journey with this strong feeling that there is a painful search all the way through our communities for regaining authenticity, authenticity of our values and our purpose. My intention with creating Letters Matters is to give people back the joy of reading, to give them back the ability to dream with open eyes. As Oscar Wilde said, "it is what you read when you don't have to, that determines what you will be when you can't help it.”

It is my deepest hope that reading will not be a skill or a function that will lose its meaning and get atrophied like an appendix in the next centuries; it is Letters Matters' mission, philosophy, and credo that our duty is to ensure this will not happen.  

The venue

The store will be located in the middle of Lisbon, in one of the most sought after areas in Lisbon, Principe Real. With over 200 square meters, with two cosy terraces, the store contains plenty of space to accommodate books, cosy reading corners, and a café. The business plan has been validated by certified accountants.

There is an initial investment required to completely refurbish the place.   The initial investment has been estimated to be ca. 250.000€, with a capital / fixed assets value of 80.000€.  

It goes without saying - but I write it - that all the money collected via this financing vehicle will be utilised exclusively to build the premises for this unique experience.    

The request 

Creating such a project comes up with a high start-up cost component. I am acting in a private capacity and not as a corporate investor. This is a passion and heart project, and I would like to request your financial help to enable me to open this unique bookshop-café, and reverse the irreversible.

Furthermore, let's create this project together not just financially but also with our united hearts and minds: Please send me the names and authors of the best 5 books they have ever read, so that YOUR books can find their place on Letters Matters' shelves, too.    

So please help by:

  • Sending us your book list with your best 5 books that you ever read 
  • Making a financial contribution to help make this happen
  • Spreading the news to your friends about this beautiful educational, spiritual and culinary experience

story:
KAMAKURA & ENOSHIMA

Only an hour from the Tokyo megalopolis lies a modest peninsula that juts into the sea separating the bays of Tokyo and Sagami— the Miura Peninsula.

Situated on the shore of Sagami Bay at the base of the peninsula is a town graced by mountain and sea,  Kamakura, and connected to it by a bridge is the small island of Enoshima.

They both

  • are located only an hour train-ride from Tokyo
  • have sea and mountains.
  • have history rich with Samurai and Zen   
  • have a unique culture of old and new

                       
LOCAL FOCUS is for those who

  • enjoy exploring small towns  
  • avoid crowded, touristy spots    
  •  step off the beaten path   
  • value well-crafted arts and time-tested traditions        
  •  prefer smoke-free dining
  • prefer organic, all natural food                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  

Using the LOCAL FOCUS guidebook eliminates the need to rely on the internet to search endlessly through random sites for information on sightseeing locations, inns, or restaurants, and no unnecessary time or energy is wasted aimlessly searching for WiFi spots on your smart phone while you are traveling. Furthermore, not all reviews on the internet can be trusted, and the reviewer may hold preferences and values that are completely different from yours, rendering their impressions practically useless. 
 

For those visiting Kamakura and Enoshima for the first time, we offer efficient travel plans to match your interests and schedules; and for those who have already been to the popular sites of the area, we feature hidden spots and shops that are free of crowds and touristic trappings.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　 　                                                                                                                            
LOCAL FOCUS features;

  • 200 pages in full color
  • over 100 places to visit selected by the production team
  • easy to read maps
  • at a glance icons for "English menu available" "Take credit cards" "Barrier free" etc.
  • history, culture, food, local communities and more (please see "TABLE OF CONTENTS" on our "Preview Version" below)

 

Production Team (arigatou books)


LOCAL FOCUS is created by a team of freelance editors, writers, photographers and designers who reside on Miura Peninsula in Kanagawa Prefecture where Kamakura is located. We all love nature, culture, and community of the area we live, and would like to share the charm of the towns we live.

LOCAL FOCUS is made up of both local Japanese and non-Japanese members; to create this guidebook, our non-Japanese speaking members identified what was necessary to assist foreign travelers who can’t speak the language, while our Japanese members compiled their insider information. This was then compiled into a graphically pleasing and user-friendly practical guidebook that will enable any visitor to have an authentically rich travel experience without the need to learn Japanese or have any local contacts.   　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             


How did the production team select the places?

Our production team strongly places value on the nature, culture, and community of the area, and LOCAL FOCUS is a careful compilation that presents Kamakura and Enoshima as the backdrop for daily living, featuring shops that are part of the everyday life of the production team, or introducing the must-sees, -dos, and –eats, where they take their guests from overseas, or recommend to traveling friends.
We avoided any kind of sponsorship from the featured sites so that we could introduce them with a fully unbiased approach and perspective. 


We have been working hard to publish our first book to introduce the area we live and love to non-Japanese who could share the same interest and value. About 80% of the work has done, and now it's time for us to get our book published and need your help.

 

Why do we need your help?

This work has been a labor of love so far, and now it is in the phase to finish up the rest of the work and get printed.

We are seeking a total donation amount of $20,000 USD to cover:
  *The cost to print 1,000 copies in Japan. ($10,000 USD)
  *The partial amount to support the work of about 10 freelance translators. ($9,000 USD)
 *Marketing and advertising (creating a website, making flyers etc). ($1,000 USD)

 

3 easy steps to support our project:

       1. Check out our 3-minute video.

       2. Check our 20-page "Preview Version."

       3. If you like our project, select a donation option.

 

Sneak-peak "Preview Version" of LOCAL FOCUS




PERKS

*We are planning to hold "Supporters-only" secret tours and events for you to discover the history, culture, and community of Kamakura and Enoshima. (Fees will be charged to cover the costs.)

*If our target is not met for the bulk printing of LOCAL FOCUS, we will release only a digital edition available for purchase. (To those of you who select the donation amount that includes the perks of a printed copy, we will print those on-demand and deliver you a copy…We will stick to our promise!)
 

1. LOTUS: Donation amount of $8.00 USD
    1 E-book (downloadable to PC and tablets)


2. CHERRY BLOSSOMS: Donation amount of $20.00 USD 
     + shipping (ships worldwide with many beautiful Japanese postage stamps)    

     1 Printed copy (about 200 pages, size: Approximately 175mm × 2570mm),
     Printed in Japan                                                                                                                                                                                                
3. GREAT BUDDHA: Donation amount of $25.00 USD                                                                                       
     + shipping (ships worldwide with many beautiful Japanese postage stamps)
     Combo of LOTUS and CHERRY BLOSSOMS: 1 E-book and 1 printed copy
                      
4. MOUNT FUJI: Donation amount of $85.00 USD                                                                                                         
     + shipping (ships worldwide with many beautiful Japanese postage stamps) 
     5 Printed copies                                                                                                                


*If you are interested in getting more than 6 printed copies, please contact us by e-mail.
  localfocus55@gmail.com
 

5. COMPASSION: Donation amount of $30.00 USD       

1 Daibutsu ("Great Buddha") sticky notes
(20 pages, 75mmx75mm)  (Ships worldwide with beautiful Japanese postage stamps. Shipping fees included.)                                                    

If you don't live in Japan or don't know when you might have a chance to go to Kamakura but would like to support our project, this perk is for you. We’ll send you a pad of our original sticky notes to show our appreciation.



6. GREAT COMPASSION: Donation amount of $50.00 USD                                                                               

A set of Daibutsu and Jizo sticky notes.
(20 pages, 75mmx75mm) (Ships worldwide with beautiful Japanese postage stamps. Shipping fees included.)

If you don't live in Japan or have any idea when you might get to Kamakura but would like to support our project, this perk is for you.
We will send you a set of two pads of sticky notes with our original design to show our appreciation.

7. ALL-IN-ONE:Donation amount of $120.00 USD                                                                                       
     shipping INCLUDED (ships worldwide with many beautiful Japanese postage stamps)
     1 E-book, 1 printed copy, 1 sticky note with Great Buddha, 1 sticky note with Zizo Buddha, and your (nick ) name in a book !

 

Supporting our project would help

  • Make it easier for non-Japanese to find and meet unique local places and people which 　would make connections and bond between different cultures
  • Small, local business stay in operation      
  •  Maintain the town’s culture and character                 
  • Promote local organic farming                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      

 

Risks & Challenges

Since our team has already completed 80% of the work, the risks in publishing the e-book will be very minimal, however, printing the guidebook may not be possible without sufficient funds. Accordingly, we plan to print only a few copies, despite the higher cost per copy.
 

<Production Team>
   Producer, writer: Mariko Miki (marikomikifogell@gmail.com)
   Editor, writer: Sae Yamane
   Graphic designer: Sousuke Hirai (so-hirai@jcom.home.ne.jp)
   Photographer: Sarah Goff
   Photographer: Taisuke Yokoyama (http://taiseye.com/)

   Chief translator: Norie Lynn Fukuda (nfukuda@mbi.nifty.com)

<Video Crew>
   Music: Kazz (http://www.kazz.vg)
   Drone footage: Go Nakamura (https://www.lswf.co)
   Video producer: George Kodama (https://vimeo.com/user8897078)
   Videographer: Hideyuki Iwasaki (https://vimeo.com/user8897078)

 

*Follow our SNS where we share tid bits of Japanese culture and local information.    

*Come and meet the earnest, charming, and hip people featured on LOCAL FOCUS !

 

Arigatou ("Thank you" in Japanese) for your interest and support!

 

＜日本のみなさまへ＞
LOCAL FOCUSに興味を持って頂き、ありがとうございます！

value well-crafted arts and time-tested traditions         
 prefer smoke-free dining 
prefer organic, all natural food                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
Using the LOCAL FOCUS guidebook eliminates the need to rely on the internet to search endlessly through random sites for information on sightseeing locations, inns, or restaurants, and no unnecessary time or energy is wasted aimlessly searching for WiFi spots on your smart phone while you are traveling. Furthermore, not all reviews on the internet can be trusted, and the reviewer may hold preferences and values that are completely different from yours, rendering their impressions practically useless.  For those visiting Kamakura and Enoshima for the first time, we offer efficient travel plans to match your interests and schedules; and for those who have already been to the popular sites of the area, we feature hidden spots and shops that are free of crowds and touristic trappings.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　 　                                                                                                                            LOCAL FOCUS features;
200 pages in full color
over 100 places to visit selected by the production team
easy to read maps
at a glance icons for "English menu available" "Take credit cards" "Barrier free" etc.
history, culture, food, local communities and more (please see "TABLE OF CONTENTS" on our "Preview Version" below)
 Production Team (arigatou books)LOCAL FOCUS is created by a team of freelance editors, writers, photographers and designers who reside on Miura Peninsula in Kanagawa Prefecture where Kamakura is located. We all love nature, culture, and community of the area we live, and would like to share the charm of the towns we live.LOCAL FOCUS is made up of both local Japanese and non-Japanese members; to create this guidebook, our non-Japanese speaking members identified what was necessary to assist foreign travelers who can’t speak the language, while our Japanese members compiled their insider information. This was then compiled into a graphically pleasing and user-friendly practical guidebook that will enable any visitor to have an authentically rich travel experience without the need to learn Japanese or have any local contacts.   　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
How did the production team select the places?Our production team strongly places value on the nature, culture, and community of the area, and LOCAL FOCUS is a careful compilation that presents Kamakura and Enoshima as the backdrop for daily living, featuring shops that are part of the everyday life of the production team, or introducing the must-sees, -dos, and –eats, where they take their guests from overseas, or recommend to traveling friends.We avoided any kind of sponsorship from the featured sites so that we could introduce them with a fully unbiased approach and perspective. We have been working hard to publish our first book to introduce the area we live and love to non-Japanese who could share the same interest and value. About 80% of the work has done, and now it's time for us to get our book published and need your help. Why do we need your help?This work has been a labor of love so far, and now it is in the phase to finish up the rest of the work and get printed.We are seeking a total donation amount of $20,000 USD to cover:  *The cost to print 1,000 copies in Japan. ($10,000 USD)  *The partial amount to support the work of about 10 freelance translators. ($9,000 USD) *Marketing and advertising (creating a website, making flyers etc). ($1,000 USD) 3 easy steps to support our project:       1. Check out our 3-minute video.       2. Check our 20-page "Preview Version."       3. If you like our project, select a donation option. Sneak-peak "Preview Version" of LOCAL FOCUS
PERKS*We are planning to hold "Supporters-only" secret tours and events for you to discover the history, culture, and community of Kamakura and Enoshima. (Fees will be charged to cover the costs.)*If our target is not met for the bulk printing of LOCAL FOCUS, we will release only a digital edition available for purchase. (To those of you who select the donation amount that includes the perks of a printed copy, we will print those on-demand and deliver you a copy…We will stick to our promise!) 1. LOTUS: Donation amount of $8.00 USD    1 E-book (downloadable to PC and tablets)2. CHERRY BLOSSOMS: Donation amount of $20.00 USD      + shipping (ships worldwide with many beautiful Japanese postage stamps)         1 Printed copy (about 200 pages, size: Approximately 175mm × 2570mm),     Printed in Japan                                                                                                                                                                                                3. GREAT BUDDHA: Donation amount of $25.00 USD                                                                                            + shipping (ships worldwide with many beautiful Japanese postage stamps)     Combo of LOTUS and CHERRY BLOSSOMS: 1 E-book and 1 printed copy                      4. MOUNT FUJI: Donation amount of $85.00 USD                                                                                                              + shipping (ships worldwide with many beautiful Japanese postage stamps)      5 Printed copies                                                                                                                *If you are interested in getting more than 6 printed copies, please contact us by e-mail.  localfocus55@gmail.com 5. Make it easier for non-Japanese to find and meet unique local places and people which 　would make connections and bond between different cultures
Small, local business stay in operation      
 Maintain the town’s culture and character                  
Promote local organic farming

Accordingly, we plan to print only a few copies, despite the higher cost per copy. <Production Team>   Producer, writer: Mariko Miki (marikomikifogell@gmail.com)   Editor, writer: Sae Yamane   Graphic designer: Sousuke Hirai (so-hirai@jcom.home.ne.jp)   Photographer: Sarah Goff   Photographer: Taisuke Yokoyama (http://taiseye.com/)   Chief translator: Norie Lynn Fukuda (nfukuda@mbi.nifty.com)<Video Crew>   Music: Kazz (http://www.kazz.vg)   Drone footage: Go Nakamura (https://www.lswf.co)   Video producer: George Kodama (https://vimeo.com/user8897078)   Videographer: Hideyuki Iwasaki (https://vimeo.com/user8897078) *Follow our SNS where we share tid bits of Japanese culture and local information.    *Come and meet the earnest, charming, and hip people featured on LOCAL FOCUS ! Arigatou ("Thank you" in Japanese) for your interest and support! ＜日本のみなさまへ＞LOCAL FOCUSに興味を持って頂き、ありがとうございます！こちらのサイトからも応援が可能ですが、「英語のサイトでは手順がよくわらかない」というお声を頂き、日本のクラウドファンディング・サイトでもキャンペーンを展開いたします。＜期間：2017年12月11日（月）〜2018年1月11日（木）（日本時間）＜キャンペーン・サイト：Motion Gallery＞http://motion^gallery.net/projects/LOCALFOCUS＜facebook日本語ページ＞LOCAL FOCUSに関する様々な情報を日本語でお知らせしていますので、ぜひフォローお願いします。https://www.facebook.com/LOCAL-FOCUS-日本語-...応援のほど、どうぞよろしくお願い致します。

story:
The Baltimore Institute For Nonprofit Journalism returns for another fundraiser and once again we are in emergency mode.

As you may have read already, the Baltimore Beat is no more. After just four months, the owners of the Beat have decided to shut it down. The story is one you have heard plenty of times before: a lack of ad revenue. Baynard Woods and Brandon Soderberg founded BINJ with Marc Steiner after the Baltimore City Paper was closed for the same “lack of revenue” reason precisely because it was clear that the for-profit model could not be the sole model for local journalism.

Soderberg and Woods helped get the Beat off the ground and helped edit the paper working with Lisa Snowden-McCray and Maura Callahan, and so, along with this being a blow to  local journalism and the city, it’s a blow to BINJ. We are devastated. And there is less local journalism at a time where the city needs more eyes on those in power than ever.

We are however, used to operating in crisis mode. So we're asking for some money from you to keep funding journalism. With the money raised during BINJ's initial fundraiser, we created an issue of City Paper put together by Writers in Baltimore Schools, helped fund the third issue of Lawrence Burney's “True Laurels,” and fully funded the first issue of Reginald Thomas II's “The City That Hoops,” all the while developing the Beat. You can read about our progress so far here.

We also have a few pending projects related to Mondawmin Mall's history and a look at Baltimore gangs on the way and some information sessions planned. Due to the Beat coming about, we put the first BINJ money into long-term projects assuming the Beat could fund day-to-day journalism. BINJ will continue to fund these kinds of big projects—especially the second issue of “The City That Hoops”—but this second fundraiser will mostly begin to help fund ongoing news coverage.

Your donations will fund reporting that you will see quickly and will be part of ongoing investigative and/or on-the-ground reportage.The collaboration between the Beat and Real News to cover the Gun Trace Task Force and other coverage which contrasts and complements more conventional daily news is necessary and we want to keep getting this journalism out there and providing it to the outlets that are still around

We need your help to do that.

Donate if you can.

About BINJ:

The Baltimore Institute for Nonprofit Journalism (BINJ) is a guerrilla newsroom raiding the ruins of corporate media and fixing Baltimore’s media desert.

BINJ was founded by Baynard Woods, Brandon Soderberg, and Marc Steiner in response to the dearth of progressive media in Baltimore following the end of The Marc Steiner Show on WEAA and the imminent closure of the Baltimore City Paper. BINJ addresses this problem by raising money to pay freelance journalists to investigate issues and institutions affecting the city and distributing the stories to already-existing independent outlets—at first, one story at a time and eventually, we hope, by funding entire beats and reporters.

Based on the Boston Institute for Nonprofit Journalism, BINJ Baltimore is a fast-moving nonprofit (operating under the fiscal sponsorship of the Center for Emerging Media). We don’t want to buy a building or rent an office or pay a big staff. All the money we raise—except processing fees and that sort of bullshit—goes to producing journalism. We're looking to support the talent here that is overlooked, rejected or left undeveloped by the media landscape.

While we are a nonprofit this fundraising campaign is not using Indiegogo's nonprofit platform for logistical reasons. If you would like your donation to be tax-deductible, donate directly to the Center For Emerging Media and make it clear to CEM it's for BINJ.

BINJ.Baltimore@gmail.com / medium.com/@BINJ.Baltimore

story:
La Novela

Sean Lally encarna la figura de un fugitivo, un nómada condenado al castigo de una vida errante. Sin hogar, sin pareja, sin amigos. Deambula sin destino, en constante alerta. Siempre atento, siempre vigilante. Cada pocos días debe mudarse a un lugar diferente. Tan solo huye. En permanente movimiento, tratando de pasar desapercibido, de ocultar su estela. Le buscan, y le matarán sin piedad si son capaces de encontrarle.
          Este joven irlandés, cuyo único objetivo consiste en escapar de sus perseguidores, rememora durante su peregrinar la azarosa existencia que le ha llevado a esta penosa situación. Desde las venturas y desventuras de su juventud en un pequeño pueblo cercano a Dublín, pasando las circunstancias que le condujeron a abandonar su isla natal, su participación en el tenebroso mundo del juego on line, del póker, y de las mafias del lujo y la prostitución para millonarios, hasta la catarsis que le obligó a emprender la perpetua evasión en la que se limita a intentar sobrevivir un día más.
          Pero nada en este mundo es inmutable, por más que a veces pueda parecerlo. De pronto surge el factor inesperado que agita su coctelera, y Sean no puede seguir escondiéndose. Debe encontrar una solución, y para ello se verá obligado a recurrir a los fantasmas más oscuros y olvidados de su pasado. Tendrá que jugarse el todo por el todo, porque limitarse a seguir corriendo para mantener la integridad del hilo del que pende su supervivencia habrá dejado de ser una opción.

El Autor

Jaime Rodríguez-Avial García (Madrid 1969), es licenciado en Derecho y en Ciencias Empresariales en la Universidad Pontificia de Comillas (ICADE) y reside en su ciudad natal donde actualmente trabaja como abogado. Lector compulsivo desde su niñez, nunca se había decidido a trasladar su pasión por los libros a una obra propia.

Amante de la novela negra, Invisible es su primera incursión en el género literario.

Una Muestra

«Las 8:00. Abro los ojos. Llevo un rato despierto. Me ocurre lo mismo cada mañana. Hace ya bastante tiempo que mi sueño se ha convertido en una especie de perpetua duermevela. Han pasado meses, quizás años, desde que descansé de un tirón por última vez. Siempre atento, siempre pendiente, nunca dormido del todo. Siempre preparado para saltar de la cama y huir. Siempre tenso, siempre concentrado, nunca relajado. 
          Otro día, otro país, otra ciudad, otro pueblo, otro albergue, otra pensión, otra habitación, otra cama. Siempre escondido. Siempre pagando al contado, siempre viajando, ligero de equipaje. Sin hogar, sin patria, errante.
          Algunas veces no resulta tarea fácil elegir el siguiente destino. Eso sí, países europeos, para poder cruzar la frontera sin problemas. La localidad seleccionada no debe ser especialmente pequeña, para no llamar la atención. Y debo procurar no repetirme. Y si repito, cambiar donde me alojo. Además, trato de evitar ser predecible; mejor carecer de un patrón, o que este no sea muy evidente. Si alguien detecta mi presencia en algún emplazamiento concreto, intento que sea difícil deducir cual será el siguiente. A veces me traslado un día doscientos kilómetros al norte, y al siguiente retrocedo cien hacia el sur para dificultar el rastro. Y por supuesto, en la medida de lo posible, tengo que rehuir aquellos lugares en los que pienso que alguien pueda conocerme.
          Es trascendental que no me encuentren; si lo hacen, me matarán. Tengo que vivir en permanente movimiento. Cuanto más pequeña sea la población en la que estoy, menos días procuro quedarme. Si se trata de una capital, a lo mejor unas semanas, pero trato de variar donde pernocto. Soy un viajero, un apátrida ciudadano de ninguna parte.
          Viajo en tren o en autobús, nada de aviones. No puedo permitirme el lujo de pasar controles, ni de equipaje ni de pasaporte. Ni me planteo usar coche, ni tengo opción de alquilar uno sin tarjeta de crédito, ni puedo arriesgarme a que me pare la policía por alguna estúpida infracción de tráfico. El auto-stop es una opción, aunque hay métodos parecidos o alternativos muy anónimos.
          No confraternizo demasiado, nada de amigos, y mucho menos de novias. No puedo permitirme debilidades. Y tampoco es que me dé tiempo a consolidar relaciones de ninguna clase. Siempre fui bastante sociable, pero cambiando de residencia cada pocos días… Y este autoimpuesto aislamiento es duro, quizás lo más cruel de mi situación, soy un ser social, y esta soledad me hace enloquecer. Pero no hay nada que pueda hacer para remediarlo. Si me aventurara a quebrantar esta regla, la ruptura acarrearía mi perdición, estoy seguro».

El Objetivo

En esta campaña preventa nos hemos propuesto alcanzar el equivalente a 55 reservas, es decir, 980€, recibiendo quienes participen el libro en su casa sin gastos de envío (en España) antes de que entre en circulación... existiendo incluso la opción de reservar el libro con tu nombre en los agradecimientos por un poco más del precio de venta, como detalle exclusivo.

También, usando la opción BACK IT, podéis realizar donaciones a la edición; opción a través de la cual no se os pedirá dirección de envío porque no conlleva contraprestación de ningún tipo.

Media

Por otro lado, independientemente de que colaboréis realizando vuestra reserva o no, en ocasiones no se puede, sería una inestimable ayuda que os hicieseis eco de esta campaña a través del boca-oreja o por redes sociales... la Cultura, Distrito 93 y Jaime Rodríguez-Avial os lo agradeceremos.

Y por supuesto, en la medida de lo posible, tengo que rehuir aquellos lugares en los que pienso que alguien pueda conocerme.          Es trascendental que no me encuentren; si lo hacen, me matarán. Tengo que vivir en permanente movimiento. Cuanto más pequeña sea la población en la que estoy, menos días procuro quedarme. Si se trata de una capital, a lo mejor unas semanas, pero trato de variar donde pernocto. Soy un viajero, un apátrida ciudadano de ninguna parte.          Viajo en tren o en autobús, nada de aviones. No puedo permitirme el lujo de pasar controles, ni de equipaje ni de pasaporte. Ni me planteo usar coche, ni tengo opción de alquilar uno sin tarjeta de crédito, ni puedo arriesgarme a que me pare la policía por alguna estúpida infracción de tráfico. El auto-stop es una opción, aunque hay métodos parecidos o alternativos muy anónimos.          No confraternizo demasiado, nada de amigos, y mucho menos de novias. No puedo permitirme debilidades. Y tampoco es que me dé tiempo a consolidar relaciones de ninguna clase. Siempre fui bastante sociable, pero cambiando de residencia cada pocos días… Y este autoimpuesto aislamiento es duro, quizás lo más cruel de mi situación, soy un ser social, y esta soledad me hace enloquecer. Pero no hay nada que pueda hacer para remediarlo. Si me aventurara a quebrantar esta regla, la ruptura acarrearía mi perdición, estoy seguro».
El Objetivo
En esta campaña preventa nos hemos propuesto alcanzar el equivalente a 55 reservas, es decir, 980€, recibiendo quienes participen el libro en su casa sin gastos de envío (en España) antes de que entre en circulación... existiendo incluso la opción de reservar el libro con tu nombre en los agradecimientos por un poco más del precio de venta, como detalle exclusivo.
También, usando la opción BACK IT, podéis realizar donaciones a la edición; opción a través de la cual no se os pedirá dirección de envío porque no conlleva contraprestación de ningún tipo.
Media
Por otro lado, independientemente de que colaboréis realizando vuestra reserva o no, en ocasiones no se puede, sería una inestimable ayuda que os hicieseis eco de esta campaña a través del boca-oreja o por redes sociales... la Cultura, Distrito 93 y Jaime Rodríguez-Avial os lo agradeceremos.

story:
The Campaign

My name is Megan Bostic, I'm a young adult author. My first novel Never Eighteen was published by Houghton Mifflin Harcourt in January of 2012. Contrary to what you may think, just because you're published doesn't mean you're making a ton of money, and doesn't automatically guarantee you'll be published again.

After parting ways with my agent and looking for another with no success, and then trying to land another book deal, also with no luck, I've decided to go Indie. I could continue my pursuits to be published traditionally, but at this point if I found an agent and a publisher, more than likely I'd be looking at a 2015 publication date.

I'm passionate about writing contemporary teen fiction. I like to remind today's teens that no matter their problems, they are never alone, there is help out there, and there is always a light at the end of the tunnel.

When my last book was published, I received emails quite often from teens who connected strongly with my characters and their problems. With your contributions I'll be able to reach teens with my words in a matter of months, rather than waiting a couple of years.

Dissected, the Novel

Here is a summary of the novel you will be helping get off the ground:

Sydney Warner, a teenage girl, whom after being abandoned by her mother at a young age, becomes a thrill seeker with a penchant for extreme sports and a fascination with death. She’s brash, she’s spunky, and she doesn’t take crap from anyone.

Withdrawn and broody David, from English class, is the boy of Syd's dreams, but love soon becomes just another extreme sport when Syd finds out that David has cheated on her with her best friend. Betrayal, loneliness, and a mishap with a picture frame set Syd on a course of self-destruction that includes alcohol, drugs, and self-mutilation in the form of cutting.

After nearly bleeding to death during an arm carving mishap, Syd is tossed unwillingly into a teen psyche ward where she comes to realize she’s not alone. Through new friendships, unwelcomed therapy, and her love of the stars, she finds alternate ways to cope with her emotions on her path to forgiveness and redemption.

Where Your Contributions Will Go

Whether getting published traditionally or indie, a mid-list author has to invest a ton of time, money, and resources to get their book off the ground. Here's where your contributions will go:

ISBN numbers. These are numbers that identify your book. If you're going to put your book online and audio, you need more than one and they are sold in blocks of ten.
~Distribution costs. In order to get into your local bookstores, my book will need to be carried with major distributors, which costs money.
~Editing. To get the best product possible on the shelves, I'd like to buy editing software and pay for a professional editor to assist me.
~Marketing. This is where most of the money goes. Getting your book noticed is no easy task. Book marketing takes ads, bookmarks, postcards, press kits, books for reviews and giveaways, and shipping costs. Also, since I write for teens, I also buy SWAG - Stuff We All Get, buttons, stickers, and bracelets. They love these little extras and it helps engage them during school and library visits.
 
Speaking of visits...
 
~Your money will also help with travel costs to bookstore, library and school events. These events are one of my favorite things about being an author. I love to talk to readers and aspiring writers.
 

If you can't donate

You could help by spreading the word to those you think might be interested and watch for my novel to hit shelves later this year. I'm shooting for summer.

Thank you so much for considering my campaign. It's much appreciated.

story:
OUR STORY

Who: Me the author of It Happened at Nextfest, Bobby Thomas 

What: 7 years of work on a near future political thriller

When: Before the Frankfurt Book Congress in October 2011

How: Start advertising the novel now, in major US magazines before presenting it at my own book stand at the Frankfurt Book Congress in October 2011. 


 

WHY YOU SHOULD CARE

To be honest you really shouldn't care. Why you should not care? Even if this book is a success, there is nothing we can do to stop the train from running past its stop. Ted Kaczynski tried to stop the future with bombs then a published manifesto. Maybe a policy maker, after reading this book, will attempt to slow the train down. It can't be stopped. 


WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

I need to raise enough cash to take out a full page ad adverising my self-published novel in a major US magazine. Everyone that supports my goal will receive a free non-DRMed ebook copy of “It Happened at Nextfest”.

HOW ELSE YOU CAN HELP

It is to late to do anything. Even I am looking forward to a nanothingy that can remove the smell of cat piss from the mat in my bathroom.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Cassandra and I am an actress/writer from the Washington D.C. Metro area.  As an actress, I know how crucial the right monologue can be to the success of an audition.  All too often, I have seen good actors, who've put their entire heart and soul into rehearsing a piece, lose their opportunity because they've chosen a monologue that contained excessive profanity or was likely to have been seen by the audition auditors several times before.  That is why I wrote "You Ain't Heard Nothin' Yet!  Monolgues for Actors by an Actor."  In it, actors will find a wealth of original material with flawed and diverse characters that are waiting for them to breathe life into their words.  Each monologue has been written without profanity and edited for ease of recitation. 

I know how difficult the artist's life can be.  It is my hope that this book helps make an often rough journey a little easier for many performers.  As such, I would like to ensure that it reaches the broadest audience possible.  My objective is to have it sitting on the shelves of libraries, universities, schools and actors' organizations, as well as in the homes of my fellow actors.  Unfortunately, my efforts to get "You Ain't Heard Nothin' Yet!" published through traditional channels have not achieved a satisfactory outcome.  That's why I'm asking for your help. 

What We Need & What You Get

I would like to publish "You Ain't Heard Nothin' Yet!" through the Espresso Book Machine (EBM) system, which has services spread throughout libraries and bookstores across the world.  Using this system would help further my goal of cultivating an extensive readership for my book. 

My funding goal of $12,000 is designed to fund both the publication and promotion of "You Ain't Heard Nothin' Yet!" 

-$10,000 will be used to generate a first printing of 1,000 books at $10 a book, in order to reach the level of audience that I believe can be helped by "You Ain't Heard Nothin' Yet!" 

-$1,000 will be used to purchase formatting services offered by the Espresso Book system, inclusion of my book on the EBM's online registry and advertising on actor websites like Backstage and Dragonuk Connects. 

-The remaining $1,000 will be used towards shipping and handling for books sent to donors who give $25 or more. 

Whether I reach my goal or not, any monies received through this campaign will go towards publication and promotion of "You Ain't Heard Nothin' Yet!"  

All donors at the $5 mark will receive a personal email message from me thanking them for their time and generosity, as well as recognition on my book's Facebook page.

In addition to the above perk, those at the $10 mark will have their names included in the book's Acknowledgements page.

Anyone who donates $25 will get a signed copy of "You Ain't Heard Nothin' Yet!," plus their name in the Acknowledgements, my gratitude email and a Facebook shout-out.

Donors at the $50 level will receive all the perks, plus one additional signed copy of "You Ain't Heard Nothin' Yet!" 

Those who give $100 or more will get four signed copies of my book with a personal dedication to them and three other recipients of their choosing.  And of course, they'll also get their name in the Acknowledgements, an email and a Facebook shout-out.

Other Ways You Can Help

Look, I realize that times are tough.  Sometimes people can't help financially.  That's okay.  By just taking the time to look at my campaign, you've already given me the gift of your attention.  Please spread the word and help "You Ain't Heard Nothin' Yet!" get the exposure it needs.  You can use the Indiegogo share tools to share this campaign with your friends or you can like "You Ain't Heard Nothin' Yet!" on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/aintheardnothinyet

On an unrelated note, my pitch image came courtesy of the following website:
olc.spsd.sk.ca/de/onlineresearch/oral.html

story:
Hi.

So, those of you who know me know that I am, first and foremost, a tap dancer. I'm also an avid artist, writer, educator, and entrepreneur. I'm from Seattle but I'm currently living in Austin while performing on residency with Tapestry Dance Company ...and writing this 3-part book series.

What the Heck?

Maybe you're wondering:  How did I begin to take interest in writing motivational, self-help books?

  • In my 27 years of life, I've had over 20 reconstructive surgeries to correct birth defects. I live every single day of my life in full awareness of my differences - of the things I cannot change about myself, even if I wanted to. But you know what? I LOVE myself - exactly as I am, even though I must constantly practice acceptance. Every day, I wake up, choose to be okay, choose Love, and then I carry on with my ceaseless mission to create art, music, and writings that will uplift others and bring people together.

Withinspiration is one of these offerings. It is also my first foray into book publishing. I am thrilled to be taking these steps and cannot wait until I have the tangible books in my hands to start spreading around.

Publishing Date Goal.

I am working to have book one published by March 2014, but I'd like to be clear that this is a 'soft launch' goal because I want to be sensitive to the fact that there could be a few hiccups along the way - that's life! That said, for those of you selecting "THE BOOK" perk or anything below it, know that I will keep you updated every step of the way on my progress as well as any estimated launch changes.

The Money Goal.

In reality, self-publishing a book often runs in the $5k to $7k range, if one is to strategically allocate funds towards editing, design, and marketing.

I'm publishing three books!

I set this campaign goal at a low $1,500. On purpose.

I want it to be attainable. I want you to feel comfortable contributing whatever amount you can or desire.  (Plus, we all know that exceeding my pre-set goal is completely acceptable!)

The Money Potential.

If we exceed my $1,500 goal:

  • TIER 2   $1,500 - $6,000    =   Use for book one marketing, editing, and illustrating*
  • TIER 3    $6,000 - $12,000   =  Set aside for book two
  • TIER 4    $12,000 - $18,000  =  Set aside for books two and three
  • TIER 5    $18,000 +   =   Expand marketing plan; Purchase premium domain, Seek partnerships that will get these books in the hands of adults and teens in difficult life situations, free-of-charge; Research and possibly help fund Withinspiration App development.

*Know that I have some financial wiggle room because, typically, an author would also have to hire an illustrator. Since I'm wearing both hats, I am fully prepared to illustrate this book and bootstrap it uncompensated. That said, should any additional funds emerge above my $1,500 goal, I will first allocate them towards my marketing plan and then graciously 'pay the illustrator' (and she would be so happy about that!). As I mentioned in my campaign video, I have estimated that book one will take me 200 hours to illustrate due to the detailed nature of my art style. I will only begin to account for an illustration fee at a total intake that exceeds $2,000. 

Your Assistance.

Your contribution would mean so much to me. Also, please know that whether you contribute or not, it is also immensely helpful for you to share this campaign with your friends!

Have any questions? I'd love to hear from you!
-->   jessie [dot] sawyers [at] gmail [dot] com

Peace,
Jessie

-------------------

On the Web:
www.JessieSawyers.com.

story:
About

The Riveter is a magazine that celebrates narratives and longform journalism by women. We are dedicated to exposing the power of women’s experiences and women as storytellers, because, as two female twentysomething journalism students, we noticed a void in the representation of female longform journalists. This is our effort to fill it. We don’t believe in stories that can be summed up in a sell line.

We publish original stories by women about any subject, located in any place, seen from the female perspective. We also profile these women writers who are not getting appropriate mainstream recognition. We foster a space for these powerful discourses to mingle.

This is riveting content.

Cheers,

Joanna Demkiewicz & Kaylen Ralph

What We Need 

The very reason we created The Riveter is to support writers. We value their work and the energy required for creating longform journalism and narratives. Their stories are the backbone of The Riveter; therefore, we will not sacrifice the part of our budget that supports them. We plan to publish four stories per month and to pay $150 per story. The stories we choose will provide our topics for commentary in The Column and in interviews with writers.

We are asking for monetary support because we want to be a pioneering publication that is dedicated to paying for writers' work. With this dedication, we will be able to increase the diversity of writers’ voices and reach demographics and sub-cultures that cannot, under regular freelance standards, afford to write for free. These funds will also help with outreach, design, branding, maintaining our website presence and compensating the people who currently work so hard for us pro-bono: 

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow us on Twitter for updates about the industry as well as links to our content @TheRiveterMag

Tell your writer friend to submit to The Riveter!

story:
On ne lâche pas! Nous avons besoin de votre soutien! :D

Notre histoire

En 1975, à la suite de la vive interpellation de Paul VI aux chrétiens, les exhortant à s'impliquer dans les médias, Paul Bouchard a lancé un tabloïd qui s’appelait alors Esprit Vivant. Sans argent, sans formation particulière, sans outils adéquats, il s’est complètement livré à ce projet, convaincu de répondre à un appel : “Témoigner de l'Évangile de Jésus-Christ et servir son règne social de paix et de justice sur la terre par les moyens de communication sociale” (extrait des lettres patentes).

En 2010, 35 ans plus tard, il passait le flambeau à sa fille, Sophie Bouchard. Mue par le désir de faire des pas de plus pour accomplir cette mission et appuyée sur les demandes répétées de Jean-Paul II et de Benoît XVI, la nouvelle équipe rajeunie, passionnée et débordante d’idées donnait naissance, en février 2012, à une publication complètement métamorphosée: Le magazine La vie est belle! (Si vous ne connaissez pas le magazine La vie est belle!, c'est avec plaisir que nous vous enverrons un exemplaire PDF gratuitement sur demande à info@mlveb.com.)

Ce nouveau magazine se voulait loin des controverses et désirait plutôt interpeller par la beauté. Il fallait désormais tendre la main à ceux qui sont isolés, nourrir la vie spirituelle des assoiffés, offrir un moment de détente à ceux qui sont stressés, raconter les passages de Dieu à ceux qui manquent d'espérance, marcher avec ceux qui ont besoin d'être accompagnés, déjouer ceux qui soulèvent des doutes et annoncer l'amour à ceux qui crèvent de solitude. Tout cela, l’équipe de La vie est belle! le réalise tant pour celui qui est en recherche de sens que pour le chrétien convaincu. C’est la nouvelle évangélisation.

Mais comment rejoindre concrètement tous ces gens qui attendent une parole d’espérance? Eh bien! là même où ils cherchent le bonheur, bien sûr, c'est-à-dire dans les magasins, et plus précisément, dans les kiosques à journaux.

 

Nos besoins

Nous sommes des passionnés qui veulent transmettre ce qu’ils ont reçu. Nous avons le zèle, mais nous sommes continuellement aux prises avec un obstacle de taille : les ressources financières. Notre équipe est dirigée par des laïcs et est formée principalement de laïcs. Nous ne sommes liés à aucune communauté religieuse, à aucun diocèse ou sanctuaire, ni à aucune association. Mais l'inconvénient de cette indépendance, c’est que nous ne sommes pas non plus soutenus financièrement de façon récurrente et officielle.

Nous avons besoin d’argent pour rester sur la place publique. La distribution en kiosque est coûteuse et ne nous rapporte pas d’argent. Au contraire, nos pertes annuelles brutes s’élèvent à 5768$ pour la première année de distribution, soit une perte mensuelle de 576$. Un bon comptable dirait qu’il faut cesser la distribution pour atteindre un équilibre budgétaire. Mais alors, notre mission s’en trouverait affectée. Il faut donc aller à l’encontre de la logique comptable et plutôt compter sur la Providence.

Voilà la raison d’être de cette campagne de financement : maintenir la distribution en kiosque. Et si votre générosité est suffisante, diminuer le prix du magazine pour le rendre accessible à plus de gens. Ceux qui soutiennent le magazine La vie est belle! participent à cette mission et répondent, par le fait même, à l’appel du Christ : “Allez dans le monde entier et proclamez la bonne nouvelle.”

 

Ce que vous obtenez 

Rien de ce que nous pourrons vous donner en contrepartie ne pourra rendre justice à la valeur de vos dons. Mais c’est avec joie que nous tenons à vous exprimer notre gratitude dès ici-bas, au nom de Dieu.

Le reçu de charité

Nous pouvons émettre des reçus de charité aux canadiens qui nous font parvenir un don de 25$ et plus.

L'écran de veille

Un écran de veille qui peut aussi servir de fond d'écran. Il est composé des meilleurs clichés de nos photographes, soit les pages centrales 2012 du magazine La vie est belle! (images à venir)

L'abonnement au magazine La vie est belle!

Le magazine La vie est belle! c'est:

  • 52 pages de détente, de ressourcement et de beauté
  • 10 numéros par année
  • Un outil d'évangélisation moderne
  • Format PDF ou papier

 

 

 

 

Le coffret de paroles joyeuses La vie est belle!

Charmant boîtier de 72 paroles bilingues (français au recto et anglais au verso) à disposer sur la table de la cuisine, à côté de son lit, au coin de prière ou sur son bureau. Servez-vous-en pour transmettre un « message de la part de Dieu ». Un espace est prévu sur le dessus de la boîte pour afficher la parole pigée. (format : 5 x 7,5 cm)

Deux thèmes disponibles:

  • Versets bibliques: joie
  • Paroles de saints

 

Tableau de reconnaissance

Trois catégories figurent au tableau de reconnaissance:

  • L'artisan pour les donateurs de 1000 $ à 4999 $
  • Le bâtisseur pour les donateurs de 5000 $ à 9999 $
  • Le grand bienfaiteur pour les donateurs de 10 000 $ et plus

 

 

L'impact espéré

Les réactions à la suite de la métamorphose complète de notre magazine en 2012 ont dépassé nos attentes. Vingt-trois pour cent (23%) de nos abonnés actuels sont de nouveaux clients. Selon notre sondage maison réalisé en mars 2013, notre lectorat a rajeuni de 6%. Ces résultats sont en partie attribuables à la distribution en kiosque. Mais il y a encore beaucoup de travail à faire. Il faudrait même installer des présentoirs pour attirer davant age l’attention.

La vie est belle! Mais tout le monde ne le sait pas encore. Nous croyons que notre magazine contribue à transmettre ce goût de la vie et de la beauté au monde. Notre style tranche avec les bonheurs superficiels auxquels notre société attache tant d'importance. Ce n’est pas une prétention, c’est une expérience. Ce bonheur goûté, nous voulons le faire goûter. Nous voulons donner au suivant.

 

D'autres façons d'aider

Vous appréciez notre projet, mais vous n'êtes pas en mesure de nous aider financièrement? Voici ce que vous pouvez faire pour entrer avec nous dans la nouvelle évangélisation :

1) Partagez cette invitation à vos amis. Ça ne coûte rien et ne prendra que quelques secondes. Vous pouvez utiliser les outils de partage d'Indiegogo.

2) Abonnez-vous à notre magazine! Version électronique (30 $) ou version papier + électronique (50 $ au Canada, 70 $ aux États-Unis et 90 $ pour les autres pays). Vous ne connaissez pas notre magazine? Dites-le-nous (info@mlveb.com) et nous vous enverrons gratuitement et avec joie la version électronique d’un de nos numéros .

3) Utilisez notre magazine comme outil pour transmettre le message du Christ : abonnez de nouveaux mariés, demandez-nous quelques exemplaires du magazine à distribuer dans vos réseaux, ou encore, communiquez-nous des adresses de personnes que vous souhaitez toucher et à qui nous enverrons un numéro gratuitement.

4) Bien sûr, vous pouvez prier pour nous, pour que nous donnions le témoignage du Christ, selon l’appel que nous avons reçu. Pour cela, vous aurez toute notre reconnaissance!

story:
Let me Sum Up!
On June 23, 2013 I will have reached my 50th year on this little planet of ours.  During the past year, I was able to work in the video game industry, live abroad in CHINA, and greatly change my life and career paths.

Since returning from Asia in March, I have combined seeking out a new endeavor (see: job), and travelling on my own specialized ‘Walkabout’ using the funds saved from China. I have learned to live on very little, and have the least amount of possessions that I can recall. The Minimal life suits me just fine. 

Not a Stereotype!
This is not a midlife crisis, but more of a midlife of saying YES!

The open road again beckons, and serendipitous happenstance had presented me with the opportunity to travel with a friend across the North American continent for the next 6 weeks, from end to end.   

San Francisco to Florida, via Seattle… Hey, it makes sense to me!

Humble Bundle Birthday?
My personal funds saved from China were finite and have run dry. Any small amount in contribution would be greatly appreciated and humbly, gratefully accepted.

I have set the closing date for this campaign on my Birthday, on June 23rd.

What is in if for me?
As with any campaign, the funding tiers or perks, have … perks.  I have listed only 4 tiers and am open to suggestions or requests beyond the ones offered. 

Alternatively, direct PayPal contributions can be submitted via paypal.com to: danielmc@gmail.com

 

Many Thanks from The Open Road!

Follow along on the new Blog launching on 06/15/2013!
@ http://danielmcdeavitt.com/blog/
