story:
Too many student & mentor poets today are missing each other. We have this thing called the internet to connect them, but no network getting it done.

      Until now. For the past year Brooklyn Poets has been designing and laying the groundwork for such a network. In homage to Hart Crane, we call this The Bridge. And you can help build it.

TWO KEY THINGS THE BRIDGE WILL DO

  • Help student poets find mentor poets to get critiques of their work without having to go through a workshop structure or writing program.
  • Help mentor poets find student poets by offering critiquing services — at their own prices.

     Students find mentors for less money than a workshop or writing program would cost, and mentors get paid without having to land one of those hard-to-find teaching jobs. It's that simple.

     Students choose mentors based on price, services offered, location and other factors such as skills and stylistic influences. If they like, they can sign up for workshops proposed by mentors--workshops not governed by the mandates of any institution, for however long mentors want, with however many students, at whatever price, online or on site. 

AND THAT'S NOT ALL

     You'll have Readers, not Followers.

     You'll create new work. Each week on The Bridge we’ll feature a poetry assignment proposed by a mentor in our community.

     Sharing your work will be a creative process. You can choose images to represent your poems and captions to go with them—like book covers for your individual poems. Add tags so readers can find your poems based on similar interests.

     When a reader clicks on one of your poems, a lightbox will open up featuring the text of the poem in a clean layout. Readers can comment on your work, like it or star it for safekeeping in their own catalogue of favorite poems, quotes, words and books on The Bridge.

     Awesome, right? You can share your favorite quotes and words on the Bridge as well as your books in the same beautiful format as your poems. You can include photos of your writing space and library along with your bio, skills and influences and links to other sites.

     All this to put more attention on reading and the written word than ever before, to create a deeper, more dynamic community of readers and writers.

STILL GOT QUESTIONS?

     Check out the FAQ at the bottom of this page for more details on how mentorship on The Bridge will work. Scroll through all those awesome perks on the way!

WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT

     Worstofalldesign, the design team behind the new Brooklyn Poets website, has already designed The Bridge—we’ve covered that expense. And we've already paid our programming team to build the invite portion of the site so you can create an account right now and reserve your username for only a $10 donation. But the cost to develop the entire Bridge is steep; after all, this is a social networking site with an e-commerce platform built in.

     We could wait, and try to accrue the funds ourselves--but that could take years. Help us fund The Bridge now and we can have it up and running by the beginning of next year. Help pay for something that will pay you back. If you’re looking for mentors and workshops, finding them on The Bridge will cost you far less than enrolling in a graduate writing program—and you’ll have hundreds of mentors and workshops to choose from! If you’re a published poet looking for work, you can make money from the expertise that is not currently being rewarded on the job market.

     We've set our fundraising goal at $20,000 but the total cost of development is $28,000. Help us meet our initial goal and we can begin development of The Bridge but will take on debt. Remember, even if we hit our initial goal, we lose 7% to Indiegogo and credit card fees and must also take out the cost of producing & shipping our perks--and that ain't cheap. If we don't hit our goal, we lose 12%!

     Our stretch goal is $40,000. Help us hit that goal and we can cover all the fees and production & shipping costs and fund the complete development of The Bridge.

PERKS

     As Jay-Z might say, We invented swag. We're gonna hook you up with something awesome for your money.

Brooklyn Go Hard: 3-Pack of Brooklyn Poets Wristbands

White: "My Word I Poured" (Hart Crane)
Black: "We Go Hard" (Jay-Z)
Grey: "I Contain Multitudes" (Walt Whitman)

Lemon Andersen Straightrazor Book-Launch
(for STRAIGHTRAZOR and VOYAGER and higher perks)

     On Thursday, November 21, the final night of this campaign, Brooklyn Poets will present a book-launch benefit performance by Tony Award winner Lemon Andersen at the Irondale in Fort Greene. Andersen will read from his new collection of poems, Straightrazor, and all ticket holders will receive a signed copy of the book. Doors open at 7, performance at 7:30. 

     Raised in Brooklyn, Lemon Andersen watched his mother, father and stepfather die from heroin abuse and AIDS complications, leaving him and his brother to grow up alone and impoverished. But his passion for poetry, hip hop and acting led him to gifted mentors who recognized his talent and encouraged him to develop as an artist and a performer. As a poet he appeared the greatest number of times on HBO'S Russell Simmons Presents Def Poetry--eight times in six seasons. He won a Tony award for his writing and performance as an original cast member of Russell Simmons Presents Def Poetry Jam on Broadway, for which he was also nominated for a Drama Desk Award. His staged memoir County of Kings: The Beautiful Struggle, produced by Spike Lee, premiered at the Public Theater in 2009 to rave reviews from the New York Times, New Yorker and Brooklyn Rail, among others. Since then, he has toured the one-man show--which took the grand prize at the 2010 New York Book Festival--at campuses and theaters across the U.S. and on three continents. More recently, Andersen was the feature of the internationally acclaimed documentary Lemon, screened in 2012-2013 at film festivals and performing arts centers across North America. 

Brooklyn Poets Tees

     All our tees are screen printed locally at Pete's Print Shop in Williamsburg using water-based ink on super-soft, eco-conscious Alternative Apparel tees. Click on the individual t-shirt links for product details, close-up images and size chart.

Brooklyn Poets Tee

Brooklyn POets Graffiti Tee

Just in time for the PONets season, this shirt is printed on a black Alternative Apparel organic crewneck tee (unisex 2XS, XS, S, M, L, XL) with the same fit and feel as our organic Yawp and Baseball tees below. Only available now through this campaign!

Organic Yawp Tee

Women's Yawp Tee


Organic "Whitman #55" Baseball Tee

Organic "Crane #24" Baseball Tee

Organic "Auden #39" Baseball Tee

Free Admission to Brooklyn Poets Yawp (for VOYAGER and higher perks)

     Touted as the "best poetry event in the borough" by Brooklyn Magazine, the Brooklyn Poets Yawp is a monthly poetry workshop & open mic held at 61 Local in Cobble Hill on the second Monday of every month from 7-9 PM. $5 admission, but Brooklyn Poets members get in free!

Brooklyn Poets Level I or II Workshop (for GENIUS and higher perks)

     Brooklyn Poets offers small, intensive poetry workshops (4-8 students) taught by award-winning poets in their own homes to foster closer mentoring, peer feedback and attention to craft than traditional graduate workshops offer—at a fraction of the price. Free Level I Foundational Forms or Level II Contemporary Practice workshops in 2014 are available for GENIUS and higher perks.

Signed Book by Brooklyn Poets Faculty Member

Museum-Quality B.I.G. Print

With purchase of a GENIUS perk, get a museum-quality Instacanvas print of one of our B.I.G. blog photos capturing the visual poetry of Brooklyn.

Brooklyn Poets Retreat in the Hamptons (for J-HOVA and higher perks)

     Enjoy poetry classes, workshops and readings next May in a beautiful house in the Hamptons within walking distance of the Peconic Bay, with nine ocean beaches nearby and a swimming pool, tennis court, beach volleyball court and hot tubs all on-site. Lodging in a private room, food and drinks for the entire weekend are included with this perk!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

     If you want to contribute and like one of our tees but prefer to buy it individually, visit our swag store and get it there--though you're getting a deal and saving on shipping through these perk packages. Or come to one of our upcoming events (YAWP or Reading Series) and get some swag or make a donation there. Or visit our Memberships & Donations page and contribute that way. Or just spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, etc, or by writing an article or blogging about The Bridge. Every little bit helps.

FAQ

Will The Bridge be free?

     Yes. Anyone can use The Bridge for free. If you'd like to request a critique from a mentor or take a workshop, you'd pay whatever price was set by the mentor; but there is no requirement to do that. If you're simply interested in sharing your work on The Bridge and exploring others', that's all you have to do!

Why do I have to pay at all?

     We'd love to make everything free on The Bridge. But the fact is, mentor poets are already underpaid and overworked, and we're trying to help them as much as the students--we're trying to help them help each other. We're trying to change the culture of poetry education in this country, not contribute to the problem. You'd be paying a mentor because you value his or her particular expertise (that, say, your mom who loves all your poems can't offer), because that mentor is taking time out of what's likely a very busy schedule to give your work the sustained, focused attention it deserves.

How many poems can I have critiqued and what will it cost?

     You can submit any number of poems for critique based on the bundles offered by the mentor you choose. Brooklyn Poets will recommend several bundles to mentors at what we think are reasonable prices--and let the mentors decide what's right for them. For example:

  • 1 poem (1 pg) $15
  • 1-2 poems (2 pgs) $20
  • 3-5 poems (3-6 pgs) $40
  • Writing sample (10-12 pgs) $70
  • Chapbook (24-32 pgs) $100
  • Full-length book (48-64 pgs) $145
     Again, these are recommended prices; mentors can offer cheaper or more expensive bundles based on the services they're offering and what they think those are worth.

But what if I can't afford a mentor?

      Here's the cool part: you can get free critiques. You can submit individual poems to the free critiques queue on The Bridge, which a prospective mentor will critique as part of the application process--you just wouldn't know the mentor's work or skills/influences or how long it would take to get your feedback.

Can mentors choose which poems they want to critique?

     Yes. We don't think mentors should have to critique work they're not the best judge of--this doesn't serve the student or the mentor. Mentors can preview student work submitted for critique and accept or decline it. If declined a critique, students can move on to find other mentors without wasting their time or money on a mentor who's not excited about their work.

Can students provide feedback on mentors' critiques?

     Yes. After receiving a critique or taking a workshop, students can leave feedback about a mentor's work, which only we and the mentor will see. Mentors can earn stars based on the number of positive ratings they receive. The better the critiques, the more stars a mentor can earn, attracting more students. Too many negative ratings of a certain kind and a poet can be stripped of mentorship privileges.

Is a comment on a poem the same thing as a critique?

     No. Anyone is free to comment on a poem on The Bridge, including mentors, but that is not what we mean by a critique. A critique would be, at the very least, a rigorous written response to a student's work that a mentor would return to a student's inbox on The Bridge. A mentor might offer more critiquing services than that for a higher price, including off-site phone or video conferencing or in-person meetings, but that is up to each mentor.

How will mentors get paid?

     Students will pay mentors for critiques and workshops through our secure e-commerce platform. Mentors will get paid by direct deposit into the bank account they've linked to the site. Brooklyn Poets will take a small percentage of the payment for setting up, handling and securing the transaction.

When will I get my perks?

     We're planning to have any material perks to you by Christmas (wristbands, tees, books, etc.), so you can enjoy your holiday season in style and/or give someone else the gift of swag. You can get The Bridge perk right now for any $10-and-above contribution--we'll send you an invite so you can reserve your username before the network opens to the public. Straightrazor, Voyager, Bard and Lemon's Crew perks can be picked up on November 21, the night of Lemon Andersen's performance at the Irondale in Fort Greene, provided we already have them in stock. If your perk includes a Brooklyn Poets membership, the membership begins the date you make your contribution and is good for one year; so if you purchase the Voyager perk, for instance, you'll get free admission to the next Yawp on our calendar.

How do I choose what I want if my perk includes options?

     Once we've received your contribution, we'll contact you to find out which t-shirt color/style/size you want, or which faculty book or B.I.G. photo, etc.

Is my contribution tax-deductible?

     Not yet. We’re incorporated as a 501(c)(3)-type nonprofit in New York, but are still in the process of applying for 501(c)(3) status from the IRS, so contributions are not yet tax-deductible but hopefully will be soon.

ABOUT

     Founded on Walt Whitman's birthday, May 31, in 2012, Brooklyn Poets is a nonprofit literary organization celebrating and cultivating the poets, poetry and literary heritage of Brooklyn through workshops, readings, open mics, walking tours and writing retreats, as well as the popular Poet of the Week feature on our website. But from the beginning our mission has been to connect the poets of Brooklyn to poets everywhere by building The Bridge.
story_txt:
Too many student & mentor poets today are missing each other. We have this thing called the internet to connect them, but no network getting it done.
      Until now. For the past year Brooklyn Poets has been designing and laying the groundwork for such a network. In homage to Hart Crane, we call this The Bridge. And you can help build it.
TWO KEY THINGS THE BRIDGE WILL DO


Help student poets find mentor poets to get critiques of their work without having to go through a workshop structure or writing program.

Help mentor poets find student poets by offering critiquing services — at their own prices.

     Students find mentors for less money than a workshop or writing program would cost, and mentors get paid without having to land one of those hard-to-find teaching jobs. It's that simple.
     Students choose mentors based on price, services offered, location and other factors such as skills and stylistic influences. If they like, they can sign up for workshops proposed by mentors--workshops not governed by the mandates of any institution, for however long mentors want, with however many students, at whatever price, online or on site. 
AND THAT'S NOT ALL
     You'll have Readers, not Followers.
     You'll create new work. Each week on The Bridge we’ll feature a poetry assignment proposed by a mentor in our community.
     Sharing your work will be a creative process. You can choose images to represent your poems and captions to go with them—like book covers for your individual poems. Add tags so readers can find your poems based on similar interests.









     When a reader clicks on one of your poems, a lightbox
will open up featuring the text of the poem in a clean layout. Readers can
comment on your work, like it or star it for safekeeping in their own catalogue of favorite poems, quotes, words and books on The Bridge.








     Awesome, right? You can share your favorite quotes and words on the Bridge as well as your books in the same beautiful format as your poems. You can include photos of your writing space and library along with your bio, skills and influences and links to other sites.






     All this to put more
attention on reading and the written word than ever before, to create a deeper, more dynamic community of readers and writers.
STILL GOT QUESTIONS?
     Check out the FAQ at the bottom of this page for more details on how mentorship on The Bridge will work. Scroll through all those awesome perks on the way!



WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT
     Worstofalldesign, the design team behind the new Brooklyn Poets website, has already designed The
Bridge—we’ve covered that expense. And we've already paid our programming team to build the invite portion of the site so you can create an account right now and reserve your username for only a $10 donation. But the cost to develop the entire Bridge is steep; after all, this is a social networking site with an e-commerce platform built in.
     We could wait, and try to accrue the funds ourselves--but that could take years. Help us fund The Bridge now and we can have it up and running by the beginning of next
year. Help pay for something that will pay you back. If you’re looking for mentors and workshops, finding
them on The Bridge will cost you far less than enrolling in a graduate writing
program—and you’ll have hundreds of mentors and workshops to choose
from! If you’re a published poet looking for work, you can make money from the expertise that is
not currently being rewarded on the job market.
     We've set our fundraising goal at $20,000 but the total cost of development is $28,000. Help us meet our initial goal and we can begin development of The Bridge but will take on debt. Remember, even if we hit our initial goal, we lose 7% to Indiegogo and credit card fees and must also take out the cost of producing & shipping our perks--and that ain't cheap. If we don't hit our goal, we lose 12%!
     Our stretch goal is $40,000. Help us hit that goal and we can cover all the fees and production & shipping costs and fund the complete development of The Bridge.
PERKS
     As Jay-Z might say, We invented swag. We're gonna hook you up with something awesome for your money.
Brooklyn Go Hard: 3-Pack of Brooklyn Poets Wristbands


White: "My Word I Poured" (Hart Crane)Black: "We Go Hard" (Jay-Z)Grey: "I Contain Multitudes" (Walt Whitman)

Lemon Andersen Straightrazor Book-Launch(for STRAIGHTRAZOR and VOYAGER and higher perks)

     On Thursday, November 21, the final night of this campaign, Brooklyn Poets will present a book-launch benefit performance by Tony Award winner Lemon Andersen at the Irondale in Fort Greene. Andersen will read from his new collection of poems, Straightrazor, and all ticket holders will receive a signed copy of the book. Doors open at 7, performance at 7:30. 

     Raised in Brooklyn, Lemon Andersen watched his mother, father and stepfather die from heroin abuse and AIDS complications, leaving him and his brother to grow up alone and impoverished. But his passion for poetry, hip hop and acting led him to gifted mentors who recognized his talent and encouraged him to develop as an artist and a performer. As a poet he appeared the greatest number of times on HBO'S Russell Simmons Presents Def Poetry--eight times in six seasons. He won a Tony award for his writing and performance as an original cast member of Russell Simmons Presents Def Poetry Jam on Broadway, for which he was also nominated for a Drama Desk Award. His staged memoir County of Kings: The Beautiful Struggle, produced by Spike Lee, premiered at the Public Theater in 2009 to rave reviews from the New York Times, New Yorker and Brooklyn Rail, among others. Since then, he has toured the one-man show--which took the grand prize at the 2010 New York Book Festival--at campuses and theaters across the U.S. and on three continents. More recently, Andersen was the feature of the internationally acclaimed documentary Lemon, screened in 2012-2013 at film festivals and performing arts centers across North America. 

Brooklyn Poets Tees
     All our tees are screen printed locally at Pete's Print Shop in Williamsburg using water-based ink on super-soft, eco-conscious Alternative Apparel tees. Click on the individual t-shirt links for product details, close-up images and size chart.
Brooklyn Poets Tee


Brooklyn POets Graffiti Tee





Just in time for the PONets season, this shirt is printed on a black Alternative Apparel organic crewneck tee (unisex 2XS, XS, S, M, L, XL) with the same fit and feel as our organic Yawp and Baseball tees below. Only available now through this campaign!
Organic Yawp Tee



Women's Yawp Tee




Organic "Whitman #55" Baseball Tee


Organic "Crane #24" Baseball Tee



Organic "Auden #39" Baseball Tee


Free Admission to Brooklyn Poets Yawp (for VOYAGER and higher perks)
     Touted as the "best poetry event in the borough" by Brooklyn Magazine, the Brooklyn Poets Yawp is a monthly poetry workshop & open mic held at 61 Local in Cobble Hill on the second Monday of every month from 7-9 PM. $5 admission, but Brooklyn Poets members get in free!


Brooklyn Poets Level I or II Workshop (for GENIUS and higher perks)
     Brooklyn Poets offers small, intensive poetry workshops (4-8 students) taught by award-winning poets in their own homes to foster closer mentoring, peer feedback and attention to craft than traditional graduate workshops offer—at a fraction of the price. Free Level I Foundational Forms or Level II Contemporary Practice workshops in 2014 are available for GENIUS and higher perks.



Signed Book by Brooklyn Poets Faculty Member















































Museum-Quality B.I.G. Print



With purchase of a GENIUS perk, get a museum-quality Instacanvas print of one of our B.I.G. blog photos capturing the visual poetry of Brooklyn.
Brooklyn Poets Retreat in the Hamptons (for J-HOVA and higher perks)
     Enjoy poetry classes, workshops and readings next May in a beautiful house in the Hamptons within walking distance of the Peconic Bay, with nine ocean beaches nearby and a swimming pool, tennis court, beach volleyball court and hot tubs all on-site. Lodging in a private room, food and drinks for the entire weekend are included with this perk!


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

     If you want to contribute and like one of our tees but prefer to buy it individually, visit our swag store and get it there--though you're getting a deal and saving on shipping through these perk packages. Or come to one of our upcoming events (YAWP or Reading Series) and get some swag or make a donation there. Or visit our Memberships & Donations page and contribute that way. Or just spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, etc, or by writing an article or blogging about The Bridge. Every little bit helps.

FAQ
Will The Bridge be free?     Yes. Anyone can use The Bridge for free. If you'd like to request a critique from a mentor or take a workshop, you'd pay whatever price was set by the mentor; but there is no requirement to do that. If you're simply interested in sharing your work on The Bridge and exploring others', that's all you have to do!Why do I have to pay at all?     We'd love to make everything free on The Bridge. But the fact is, mentor poets are already underpaid and overworked, and we're trying to help them as much as the students--we're trying to help them help each other. We're trying to change the culture of poetry education in this country, not contribute to the problem. You'd be paying a mentor because you value his or her particular expertise (that, say, your mom who loves all your poems can't offer), because that mentor is taking time out of what's likely a very busy schedule to give your work the sustained, focused attention it deserves.How many poems can I have critiqued and what will it cost?     You can submit any number of poems for critique based on the bundles offered by the mentor you choose. Brooklyn Poets will recommend several bundles to mentors at what we think are reasonable prices--and let the mentors decide what's right for them. For example:


1 poem (1 pg) $15
1-2 poems (2 pgs) $20
3-5 poems (3-6 pgs) $40
Writing sample (10-12 pgs) $70
Chapbook (24-32 pgs) $100
Full-length book (48-64 pgs) $145
     Again, these are recommended prices; mentors can offer cheaper or more expensive bundles based on the services they're offering and what they think those are worth.But what if I can't afford a mentor?      Here's the cool part: you can get free critiques. You can submit individual poems to the free critiques queue on The Bridge, which a prospective mentor will critique as part of the application process--you just wouldn't know the mentor's work or skills/influences or how long it would take to get your feedback.

Too many negative ratings of a certain kind and a poet can be stripped of mentorship privileges.

story:
Short Summary

  • Welcome to ‘Feeding The Chambers Indie GoGo campaign. My name is Omena El and I am a Board Certified Nutrition Coach. I graduated from the Institute of Integrative Nutrition 4 years ago in 2009. Prior to starting the Professional Training Program at IIN, I’d been leading a holistic Vegetarian lifestyle for 11 years. Since then, I’ve worked with and coached many clients throughout the country. One of the common factors I noticed amongst my clients, was the emotional causes around the food choices they made.

  • After making this observation I decided to BE... Proactive, and extend my life’s mission by writing a book entitled ‘Feeding The Chambers’. It is my destiny to transform the world one person at a time through Holistic Nutrition Services, and Healthy Food Preparation. Distributing this book to the masses is important to me, because it will ultimately save lives by increasing clear communication, building functional relationships, saving loads of money, promoting limitless happiness and joy, while perpetually educating people on how to heal emotional trauma.

  • Can you imagine what our world will look like when people gradually learn how to love up on themselves and others more and more? I can and I do everyday. To some this may sound like a lofty goal, but to me it’s what I live, breathe, sleep, and eat. It’s what my mind needs, to be sane, what my body needs to thrive vibrantly in the world, and what my soul needs to sustain.

  • As a supporter and contributor to my FTC campaign, you will be assisting me in achieving the for-mentioned goal of globally transforming lives and healing emotional eating. You will also help me to publish, and print 100 copies of the book, get the book copyright, finish paying for the cover design and other logistics of completing this book project. My contribution to the world through the content in the book is vital. Someone, somewhere will decide to start living after reading FTC and they will have you to thank as a contributor as well.  


What We Need & What You Get

  • As of now I need $4500. $ 1000 will go towards producing 100 hard copies of the book. $1750 towards book tour promotional materials(i.e. FTC workshop paper copies, t-shirts, book quote postcards, business cards, pens, banners, stamps, etc.) and local transportation for 90 days  $500 goes towards hiring a PR Consultant to help promote the book and get press coverage. $500 goes toward a graphic designer to complete the cover/book design. $125 for ISBN number and $149 for copyright and government filing fees. $180 for annual e-commerce account for the website. $100 goes towards Google AdWords advertising fees, and $196 goes towards Facebook advertising.


  • If I do not reach my entire goal the funds will go towards cover design, copyright, and publishing the 100 hard copies of the book. There are some GREAT perks that I am giving away to contributors. For starters I will distribute a Thank You digital card along with a special quote from the book to our $5 and $10 contributors. Additionally, I am giving away 25 copies of the book as well as providing a Personal Nutrition Counseling session to 30 of the contributors. Lastly Our big donors of $100 or more will receive a Thai yoga massage if they’re within the NYC area, or a digital weekly meal plan with 7 recipes from the book.  

The Impact

Once again, your support in funding my project will not only help me to heal emotional  eating,  increase clear communication, while creating a harmonious ripple effect amongst humanity,  it will also assist me to perpetually save lives.  My desire and goal is that the reader will have a fresh perspective on emotional healing as it relates to food, and be a bit more proactive in sustaining the health of the planet. 68% of Americans are overworked, under-appreciated, and creating delusional results for happiness. We have allowed complacency and fear of lack to clog our discernment.

  • Besides the statistics, I want the reader to have their own connection to the energy behind every word, thought, and concept written in this book.  I pray that Feeding The Chambers will ignite a flame of inspiration, movement, and spiritual attunement in the souls of humanity.  
  • Lastly, I have worked with over 160 personal clients within the past 7 years and have presented Nutrition Workshops to 11 NYC based organizations and corporations on the topic of healing emotional eating.  Each time a major breakthrough with the participants have occurred. One woman was able to discover that she was unhappy at her job and submitted her 2 weeks notice, another man discovered that he’d been coveting a eating disorder due to the transition of his mother. These are just a few. So again, I know that my approach heals, and has begun the transformation process.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Here are a few ways you can help me achieve my goal and transform humanity. First please send positive beliefs and thoughts to the success of this campaign. Help to visualize with me the healing of the planet through ‘Feeding The Chambers’ book and workshops. Second please help promote the campaign on your social media outlets and your personal network database. Please also hit the share tool on the Indie Go Go page. I am asking that you basically become a Willing and Vibrant cheerleader for the FTC campaign. Thanking each of you sincerely from the core of my heart chakra

Suite à notre campagne de sociofinancement estivale où nous avons amassé un mince pourcentage de notre objectif, 8%, nous réitérons avec une suite à la campagne. Au montant inscrit ci-haut s'ajoute donc 1 942 $, gracieusement offert par 74 donateurs lors de la campagne initiale. Aidez-nous à atteindre notre objectif et permettez-nous ainsi de continuer à vous abreuver de notre belle culture régionale.

Pour continuer sa mission, votre journal a besoin de fric, de main d’oeuvre, de soutien, de dollars, de plouse, d’aide, de cash, de liquidité, de lecteurs, d’oseille, de bacon, de camelots, de bidous, de collaborateurs, de pognon, d’engagement, de foin, de coopération, de blé, de pécune, de moyens, d’air, d’argent, de sécurité et de lousse...

PARCE QUE nous avons en masse de sujets, de chroniqueurs, de danseurs, de passionnés, d’activités, de poètes, d’artistes, de créateurs, de concepteurs, de diffuseurs, d’apiculteurs, d’historiens, d’auteurs, de conteurs, de peintres, de fromagers, de chanteurs, de violoncellistes, d’inventeurs,  de muséologues, de maraîchers, de cinéastes, de documentaristes, d’idéateurs, de designers, de graphistes, d’éclairagistes, de philosophes, d’économistes, de propagandistes, de flûtistes,  d’acrobates, de comédiens, de chefs d’orchestre, de scénographes, de sonorisateurs, de menteurs, de chefs cuisiniers, de producteurs,  d’illustrateurs, de brasseurs, de festivaliers, de guitaristes, de metteurs en scène, de scénaristes, de gribouilleurs, de voyageurs et de penseurs...

PARCE QU'ENGAGEMENT RIME AVEC ARGENT
PARCE QUE COOPÉRATION RIME AVEC RÉGION
PARCE QU'AMOUR RIME AVEC TOUJOURS

story:
Campaign for Lisa to Publish The Players

My name is Lisa Monks and I am launching this Indiegogo Campaign in order to raise funds to publish my memoir The Players with Iguana Books, an independent publishing house in Toronto.

The Players is the true story of my misadventures dating a series of famous athletes.

Everybody wants to find love. Nobody wants to be played, lied to, or cheated on. I want to make sure this doesn't happen to you. I want to make sure you see the signs.

The players is a heartfelt book about my journey to find love, and what I found instead.

After you read this you'll know how to detect a Player before they even have a chance to break your heart. It's up to you to take yourself out of the game after that. I can give you the tips, you'll see the red flags immeditely. However I can't be there to hold your hand, and drag you away from these smooth talkers.

For those who love to peek inside celebrities private lives, I offer plenty of hot steamy details of what it's like to date a professional athlete. All the perks, the fun, the sleazy side, and the drama. 

I can tell you how to meet, and attract any guy you want.

Would I recommend having flings, and living in the moment. I'm not sure. I would however say to proceed with caution, and make sure you have your head on straight.

My past is for you to learn your own lessons from. My life is an open book. Everyone deserves to at least know what kind of messed up mind games, and sexual games are being played out there.

I wrote The Players as a way to use my experiences as a vehicle to entertain, inform, and help other women avoid the same mistakes I made. Because sometimes loneliness can make you do crazy things…

By contributing to my Indiegogo campaign, you will be helping me share my stories with the world. Please follow me on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram to keep in touch, get updates on the publishing process, and to learn when and where you can read all the juicy details of my scintillating exploits.

 

Sample Chapter

Internet dating  

I’m not against it, unless it’s me. All my friends who lived through these experiences with me really need to stop pushing me to try the internet again. It pisses me off when I have to remind people the same people over and over again, why I'm never ever going to try it again. 

If the experiences I had weren’t obvious warning signs that the love of my life is not on the internet then I don’t know what is. But you don’t need to hit me over the head  twice when things turn out this bad. After these disastrous encounters I got the message. The right man is out there somewhere for me, but he sure as hell isn’t on the internet. My first experience was when I flew to California. I picked someone in Cali, because I’d always wanted to live there. I figured I may as well meet someone there, since I didn't want to live in Canada for the rest of my life.

Everyone kept bugging me to try dating on the internet, so I gave in and tried it. I went fishing, and boy did I come up with quite the catch. After talking on the phone for a few months I decided to fly out there. One of his pictures wasn’t him at all, it was a male model, and the other one was him 30lbs lighter, and 15 years younger, lean and ripped. It’s was a lie. It's wrong to have someone fly half way across the country for a lie. I figured I was there, I'd taken the time off work I may as well try to get to know him, and see if there could be any kind of relationship between us. 

He asked me to share an entrée with him, my first night there. He had no groceries, no money. By my third night he said if I wanted to eat I had to pay. 

This was bullshit. I paid for my own flight and hotel. I took care of  all my expenses during the day while he was at work, and he couldn’t even spring for dinner, and a movie, or groceries. 

One afternoon he left me at his place, and I decided to snoop through his stuff, something didn't seem right. I found a piece of paper that said there was a warrant out for his arrest. Don’t even try to criticize me for that, with all his sketchy behavior, I had a right to know what kind of guy I was dealing with. I’d been scammed, and I wanted to find out the truth about this guy. Then I found a letter from one of his ex-girlfriends about him cheating on her. She said in the letter that she couldn’t believe someone that acted so in love with her could do such a terrible thing to her. 

I immediately called my sister, and she said get the hell out of there. I called the airline and changed my flight to leave that night. I had to pay a hundred dollars more just to get the hell out of there.....cont. in the update section  

 

Facebook: www.facebook.com/LisaannmarieMonks

Twitter: https://twitter.com/strawberycakeca

Instagram: instagram.com/lmonks76

*Just an aside, some athlete’s names will be changed for legal reasons.

What We Need and What You Get

A list of some of the perks I am offering:

  • a shout out with a big thank you on my Facebook page, plus good karma sent your way,
  • virtual twitter kisses,
  • digital copies of the book before it is published,
  • an actual copy of the book in print signed by me,
  • your name with a big thank you for all the love and support printed in the book,
  • a love note, or thank you card for the ladies, you can email me for free to ask my advice - I'll share with you which toys have doubled my pleasure and some tips on procedures, supplements, food, and products that really work for those who want to look, and feel younger,
  • a $10.00 gift code for your next Kobo purchase, or a $10.00 gift card for Chapters, a lunch date with me when you’re in the Toronto area, with a bottle of Grey Goose signed by me.

Where is the Money Going?

The publishing and editorial process, which includes: a full line edit of the manuscript, a copy edit of the manuscript, the book cover design, publicity, publishing expenses, printing, and distribution.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help me to reach my publishing goal at this time, your effort to share the news of this campaign through Indiegogo's social media sharing tools, or your own social media platforms would be greatly appreciated. 

Spread the word in whatever way you feel most comfortable and confident in. Even that can go a long way.

Thank you for taking the time to read about my campaign. And if you can contribute today, thank you for your support.

story:
Summary

"What are you doing with your life?"

Ah, the question that every young professional dreads, but must face at some point in their life or another. I have been avoiding this question like the plague ever since starting college and realizing that what I loved to do was most emphatically *not* what I loved learning about. Throughout my post-collegiate life, I have witnessed with stronger and stronger conviction that a person's job, career, and academic interest are not necessarily all the same thing. So far, I have been lucky enough to pursue jobs and academic interests and, now, I would like to pursue a career: writing.

Writing has always been a part of me, the strongest bridge I seem to have between the world(s) inside me and the world around me. It is the way I can communicate. It is the way I can show people how much they mean to me and what they have taught me. It is my expression. It is my magic. 

And I feel a little stupid for trying to ignore it as much as I have. Writers don't make very much money. Writers are crazy. Writing is a dying art form. Anyone can be a writer... Lies I've been told and have been telling myself for years have kept me trying to do something else with myself. 

Well, I am ready to embrace the writer in me. I'm ready to forgive myself for all my silent days. I'm ready to dedicate myself to my craft. I hope I've proven that to some degree, by publishing my first novel, So Echoes the Thunder. I have learned so much through the experience, and I never want to stop. 

However, this presents a problem. As throughout most of this project, I've been using my brother's computer (thanks, Tris!) and am now using my mom's laptop (thanks, mom!). My own laptop is unusable, which is why I am starting this campaign. In order to be a writer, I need a reliable laptop, so I can write and save and access my stories, as well as be able to electronically handle all the steps towards publication. 

I also recently had the chance to speak with a wonderful woman about setting up a website for me, as an author, that could link me to my books' pages, social media, and several other features. So this campaign is also to raise money for creation of that webpage. 

What I Need & What You Get

To be the best writer I can be, I need a reliable writing tool. In the past, I have gotten less expensive windows laptops, and they have all failed within the first year of purchase. So, this time, I am raising money for a Mac. The first $1200 I raise will go towards a Macbook. The rest will go towards my website and purchasing a decent word processing software.

In return, along with all the stories your little eyes, ears, and hearts could hope for from me, there are quite a few perks for you. I love getting people involved and the more people I can work with, collaborate with, and give to, the better!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are as poor as I am, and cannot offer monetary support- that's ok. I still love you! I still want to share this experience with you. You could share this page with your friends. You can cheer me on and help get my name out there to the world. You can bring me smiles and caffeine when I'm on a writing streak. And, most importantly, you can still read my stories. 

    After all, that's what this is all about. Getting the stories heard.

Short Summary

We are looking for contributions toward:

  • Creating a website that showcases psychics, healers and coaches
  • Affording the software and technology to make this website able to offer courses, events and video conferencing that keeps everything at the same website.
  • Affording marketing and SEO services for this website.

What We Need & What You Get

Here is what we need:

  • Funds to pay the web-designer for her time and services.
  • 300$ to purchase a wordpress plugin for video conferencing (will allow those offering events and courses to use video-conferencing technology that is already paid for rather than available by a monthly plan.
  • Funds to pay for marketing services and a press release to get the word out.

What you get:

  • Those who contribute 100$ or more receive a free listing for their course for 3 months, 3 months free advertising in the magazine/website, or free attendance to a course of their choice.
  • Those who contribute 60-100$ can receive a free 15 -20 minute reading from a Diamond Psychic of their choice.
  • $30-$60 A free email reading by a Diamond Psychic of their Choice.
  • See the gallery tab for the images of mugs, caps and t-shirts that are available with 25$, $30 and 40$ donations.

      The Impact

      This enterprise will help psychics, healers and coaches receive more exposure for their articles, events, services and courses in a way that markets all their talents and abilities in one place.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you feel unable to offer a financial contribution, there are other ways you can support this campaign:

      • Help us to get the word out about this project, website and mission.
      • Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools as often as you want!

      Blessings ~

story:
¿Qué?

Hugo Holmes es un adolescente de catorce años que quiere ser investigador, pero no como cualquier detective... sino como el mismísimo Sherlock Homes.

Sin embargo, a pesar de seguir cada una de sus técnicas, haber leído cada uno de sus casos más de mil veces e incluso seguir al pie de la letra cada gusto del famoso detective, no consigue resolver los eventuales y pequeños misterios que se le presentan. Por todo ello, sus compañeros de clase lo consideran rarito y se burlan de él, llamándole friki-detective.

Sólo tiene una única y mejor amiga que lo apoya, Elena. Gracias a ella, descubre aquello que le falta y que podría ayudarle a resolver casos: necesita un Watson.

Mientras tanto, algunos alumnos están desapareciendo del pueblo. Todo es muy extraño y, lo que empieza como un juego, parece un serio caso que Hugo deberá resolver. ¿Conseguirá el Don Quijote de los detectives resolver un verdadero misterio? ¿O quizá su obsesión por ser detective le está haciendo ver gigantes donde sólo hay molinos de viento?

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Rocío Selene.

Nacida el 2 de abril de 1992 en la mágica ciudad de Granada, siempre ha vivido en un bonito pueblo de la vega cercano a ella, pero le encanta escaparse a la ciudad morisca y contemplar su Alhambra.

En su pueblo ha crecido y estudiado, intercalando el estudio con su querido grupo de teatro Arabuleila, en el cual estuvo durante cinco años.  Se graduó recientemente en la facultad de Trabajo Social de Granada. 

En 2013, publicó su primer libro llamado Pegaso, una novela de aventuras piratas en busca de leyendas, la cual puedes leer en su blog (http://pegasorocioselene.blogspot.com.es/) y Wattpad. También fue finalista en el primer certamen de relatos cortos del GrupMTM, con el relato Como si fuera un sueño, el cual fue publicado en la “1º Antología de Relatos Cortos” (Serial Ediciones, 2015). Además de recientemente publicar relatos en la revista electrónica Nuevas Opiniones.

A Rocío no solo le gusta escribir, también es aficionada a lectura, el teatro, la música... y los crepes de chocolate.

Hugo Holmes es su segunda novela, envuelta en la aventura y el misterio que tanto le gusta leer.

Rocío Selene te sorprenderá...

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Hugo Holmes que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Rocío Selene vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Short Summary

Do you notice that the stories you read as a child stuck with you throughout your life? Joseph Campbell taught that each individual is the hero of his or her own story. Do you think that maybe, if your favorite story persona had been that of the Goddess, conscious manifestation may have come easier throughout your life?

  • Author, Ashley Kimler, is an Oregon native mother of three (you can read her bio here: Luz's Paintbrush Starter Site), and a dynamic introspective storyteller.
  • Illustrations are being drafted by New York visionary artist Myztico Campo.
  • This story was gifted from spirit to positively impact lives of parents and children in the midst of the current awakening. 
  • Contributors to the Luz's Paintbrush project will be giving the gift of consciousness & awakening through literature.

It's time to make this story available to the world!

What We Need & What You Get

The text for Luz's Paintbrush has been copyrighted, and 20% of the illustrations completed. At this point, we need to finish producing illustrations, design the layout, print, and promote:

  • We need at least $1,500 for illustrations, $2,000 for design & printing, and $500 for the initial promotions, including web design & advertising. 
  • We want to thank you however we can, via hand written notes from the author, social shout-outs, seeing your name in the first edition copy of Luz's Paintbrush. Major contributors even have the opportunity to earn money from the author's portion of book sales!
  • If, for any reason, we don't reach our funding goal, the first measure of money raised here will go into illustrations. Whatever is left over will be saved until we raise the needed funds elsewhere.

The Impact

The illustrator was chosen by the author's children, who each resonated deeply with his alchemistic visual depiction of reality. Families and classrooms will fall in love with the dreamlike creation story. The intention is that we are reminded to integrate the wisdom from this story, whose moral is the essence of unity, into daily parenting and teaching.

When we hit critical mass in our understanding, paradigm shifts occur.

Other Ways You Can Help

If this project resonates with you, but you can't afford financial contribution right now, you can help by sharing. Use the social sharing buttons on this site, include a link to our campaign in your email list, talk about us on your blog. 

PLEASE, SHARE, SHARE!

Generally intending that we reach our goals is another way to silently contribute. 

Your support is appreciated!

Namaste.

story:
Schizophrenia - The Stigma

People diagnosed with mental illness will often face an uncertain future and their diagnosis will often be accompanied by stigma.  This stigma is heightened by media misconceptions, a lack of public knowledge and a history of fear towards mental illness especially schizophrenia. 

When the general public hears the word schizophrenia they think of people like James Holmes, the shooter in the movie theater in Colorado or John Hinkley who shot President Reagan

Recent Headlines:

The word schizophrenia literally means “split mind” which incorrectly leads many to associate schizophrenia with multiple personality when in fact the condition actually involves a “split from reality.” This misnaming of the illness has enhanced the stigma of schizophrenia.

Diagnosed with Schizophrenia

Bill MacPhee was a typical normal young person, but then in 1987 his life changed forever. He began suffering from delusions, paranoia and depression and found himself isolated in a psychiatric ward. He was 24 years old and diagnosed with schizophrenia.  Bill was very ill, he was hospitalized six times, lived in three different group homes and he had a suicide attempt.

Bill MacPhee – An Inspiration of Hope

Despite living with the stigma of the name and unable to find few resources, Bill refused to spend the rest of his life lying on a couch.  With the help of medication, therapy, the renewed support of family and a new network of friends, he progressed to the point where he is now able to undertake the daily challenge of managing his illness. Today he is happily married with three children and a business of his own.  It was not an easy road, but he was able to find hope and purpose in his life. Success stories involving people with schizophrenia are rare.  Bill MacPhee is a text book case of schizophrenia and as a role model he is an inspiration to others.

Change the Stigma - Change the Name 

After learning to deal with this illness and experiencing first-hand the lack of support and the stigma associated with the name, motivated Bill to reach out to others faced with the same diagnosis. 

Bill wants to raise money to fund a speaking tour throughout North America in 2014 to spread knowledge about schizophrenia and to work toward changing the name “Schizophrenia” to “MacPhee Syndrome.”  

Renaming schizophrenia to “MacPhee Syndrome” will reverse the misnomer and will allow for the public to be re-informed about the symptoms of the illness and reduce the fear that is directed towards those who suffer from the illness.

The money raised for this campaign will be used to pay for travel and venue expenses for himself and a small team of supporters.  The funds will also be used to help pay for publicity which will help inform the public.

Helping those dealing with Schizophrenia

As part of his desire to help those dealing with schizophrenia, he began a publishing company, “Magpie Media”, to help spread awareness about schizophrenia.

Magpie Media began publishing SZ Magazine in 1994 for quarterly distribution in Canada and later in the United States. The magazine, which is the only one of its kind in North America, provides information about mental illness to the community and professionals.  Ruth Baruuk, a Toronto psychiatrist, reported that “she reads every issue cover to cover.”  It also provides a platform for advertisers to directly reach those who need their products.

Bill has delivered inspirational speeches, provided consulting services and just recently finished an autobiography that is both informative and encouraging.  He is already well known as a spokesperson for families who are challenged by this illness.  Some of his many awards include: 2011 Kaiser Foundation National Awards for Excellence- Media, Reporting, 2009 Transforming Lives Award (Center for Addiction and Mental Health), 2007 Ontario Psychiatric Association Theodore Allen Sweet Award

All donations will be greatly appreciated.  Help us to inform a wider section of the public as we work towards changing the name and stigma of schizophrenia to “MacPhee Syndrome.”

Follow us as Bill pursues his dream of helping others help themselves.

We Value Your Support - Thank You

"Let Me Fly" - Amanda Lynn

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

For more information on the tour: Tour Details

story:
About Shenette

My name is Shenette Pierce. I graduated with a Bachelor of Arts degree in Mass Communication an emphasis in Broadcast and Journalism. I'm the seventh child out of eight kids. I have been writing poems and plays ever since I was 15 years old. The passion of writing has inspired me to write my first novel titled “The Book of Ramonia Gemini Part One: Life’s Journey and The Struggles That Follow.”

 

A Little About The Book of Ramonia Gemini

The Book of Ramonia Gemini Part One, takes each and every one on a journey of a woman’s real life struggles told through the eyes of a fiction character named Ramonia Gemini. In Part One, a health issue starts to unravel dark secrets that have been embedded in Ramonia’s troubled soul for years. With the help from family, friends, and a certified specialist putting Ramonia back on the right path is something easier said than done. 


Q: Why Is This A Must Read Book?

At some point in our life troubles will arise and sometimes those troubles soon become struggles we have to address and deal with. In The Book of Ramonia Gemini, a range of topics dealing with family, friends and financial issues as well as health problems will be what Ramonia's character must fight through in order for her body and soul not to be destroyed.

If you or someone you may know is going through some type of issue or struggle in their life, remember that you are not alone and that this book just may make you re-examine the people you have in and around your own life. 

 

Q: Why Do You Need $8,000?

A: Since I’m going the self-publishing route, everything that I will need has to be paid up front. This is where the $8,000 will go towards:

  • Advertisement/Marketing- radio, press release, newspaper, internet marketing, promotion, SEO, etc. ($3,000-$4,000)
  • Graphic Design- book cover, e-book cover, book trailers etc. ($1,500)
  • Internet- website maintenance ($500-$1,000)
  • Editing and Proofreading ($300)
  • Printing, e-book publishing, ($500)
  • Postage

 If I were to raise more than the $8000, all remaining monies will go towards my second book Part Two.

 

 What Will I Get For Contributing?

You will get some awesome perks (on the right hand side) for helping me reach my goal a blessing from the Lord and an amazing journey of your life. 

"Give, and it will be given to you; good measure, pressed down, shaken together, running over, they will pour into your lap. For by your standard of measure it will be measured to you in return."

Luke 6:38

How else can I help?

Here are other ways you can help contribute to my campaign if money is tight.

Spreading the word by mouth, social media and using the tools provided by indiegogo would be a blessing.

Any kind of marketing/advertising, website, editing, proofreading or design support is AWESOME!

Any other ways you can get my campaign out will be fine with me, because those who can’t contribute but still help will be blessed as well!

If you go on my website please sign up for my newsletter@ shenettepierce.com!!

Thanks so much for your help and contributions!

story:
(Scroll Down for English !!)

Se viene las Jornadas del Orgullo LGBTI en Ecuador! Y este año desde este preciso instante puedes ser parte y apoyar a esta iniciativa. Necesitamos tu ayuda monetaria  para hacer realidad la celebración del Orgullo LGBTI! Nuestra meta es recaudar $15 000. Cada dólar nos ayuda un montón.

En Ecuador, la homosexualidad fue despenalizada en 1997, pero solo a partir de 2004 se empieza a celebrar en el espacio público, a la vista de todos, sin miedo a la discriminación a través la Marcha y Fiesta del Orgullo LGBTI, como una iniciativa de la Fundación Ecuatoriana Equidad. 

Son ya diez años en los que hemos visto cómo la participación y el entusiasmo, las ganas de salir y expresarse con libertad y alegría, han aumentado entre todos quienes nos autodefinimos como lesbianas, gays, bisexuales, personas trans e intersex y todos los que nos apoyan.


La lucha contra la discriminación hacia las personas LGBTI la hacemos con alegría, demostrando que el hecho de querer o amar a alguien de tu mismo sexo, o el expresar tu género de una manera diferente, no es una imposibilidad para vivir bien, ser felices y tener el mismo acceso a los beneficios de la ley y al uso del espacio público.

Queremos a través de las actividades organizadas en las Jornadas del Orgullo desaparecer las imposiciones sociales que nos oprimen, celebrar nuestras diferencias y dar a conocer que el ser gay, lesbiana, transexual, bisexual, intersex,  no es una maldición, ni un estado inferior del ser humano, sino,  la maravillosa posibilidad de querer a quien queremos querer. Y ser justo como queremos ser, porque ‘Todos tenemos iguales derechos’

Si no puedes ayudarnos con dinero, puedes ayudar posteando esta página en Facebook, en twitter, en cualquier lugar del el mundo virtual o en el mundo real, contándole a tu familia, a tus amigos, a tus enemigos, a la vecina y a todos los demás.  Y por supuesto asistiendo a los eventos de las Jornadas de Orgullo LGBTI. 
Vale mencionar que Indiegogo es una prestigiosa  plataforma mundial para recaudar fondos. Donar dinero es seguro , y no te cobran ningún gasto adicional  por la transferencia. 

----------------------------------------English-Version-------------------------------------

It is the time of the LGBTQ pride celebration in Ecuador! And this year,
right here ,right now you can become part of this project . We need your
financial support to make the celebration of the LGBTQ pride become a
reality. Our goal is to rise 15 000 Dollars. Each dollar will help us a lot!
In Ecuador, homosexuality was decriminalized in 1997, but just 
since 2004 it started to be celebrated in public spaces, with no fear of 
discrimination. This celebration started as an LGBTQ pride rally and 
party organized by Ecuadorian Foundation ¨Equidad¨. It is been 10 years 
since the first LGBTQ pride week took place in Ecuador, and we have 
seen an exponential growth in the amount of people coming out to the 
streets supporting the free expression of love and gender identity. 
We fight against homophobia and discrimination towards LGBTQ folks 
with happiness. Showing that the fact of loving someone of the same 
sex, or expressing your gender in a non-normative fashion, is not an 
impossibility to have a good life and to have fair access to public spaces 
and legal rights.
Through the activities organized for the LGBTQ pride journeys we 
want to vanish the social impositions that oppress us. We want to 
celebrate our differences and let other people know that being gay,
lesbian, transsexual, bisexual, intersex or queer is not a punishment, or 
an inferior state of existence, but it is rather the wonderful possibility 
of loving exactly how and whom we want to love. And it is also the 
possibility of being exactly who we want to be. 
If you cannot help us with money, you can help us by posting this page 
on facebook, twitter, anywhere in the internet or outside of it. You can 
help us by talking about our campaign with your family, your friends, 
your enemies, your neighbor and everybodyelse. And of course, you can 
help us by showing up to the events and bringing people with you.

story:
Plus de fonds

Quand les fonds vont dépasser mes attentes :

CAD$ 4526 - 250 copies supplémentaires du livre pour librairies

CAD$ 3573 - Un enregistrement audio de Patrick narrant HAUT ET BAS

CAD$ 2473 - Mise en ligne du livre sur un blog avec auto-répondeur

 

  HAUT ET BAS 

Patrick Louche-Pelissier, fort de son expérience de voyageur, de son expertise en Programmation Neurolinguistique (PNL) et en Hypnose, a su conjuguer la compréhension du travail sur l’inconscient au plaisir de lire un conte ou une histoire.

Chaque histoire de ce livre a été conçue de manière à permettre l’ouverture à de nouvelles pistes de compréhension. Aussi les histoires valorisent l’être intérieur et l’invitent à trouver des solutions qui sauront rejoindre tout être vivant dans son développement.

Je vous invite à profiter pleinement de cette lecture et à partager, via le conteur qui s’éveille en vous, les histoires que vous découvrirez dans les pages suivantes. 

Les lire pour soi ou les conter aux autres libère le bonheur du cœur !

Isabelle David (Idcom international)

Explication du projet

Bonjour, mon nom est Patrick LP. Je suis coach professionnel certifié en PNL. Et je suis avant tout un accompagnateur de voyages intérieurs. J’ai besoin de votre aide pour faire voyager mes histoires parmi vous.

Saviez-vous que métaphore vient du grec, et signifie transport ? Ces métaphores vous transporteront naturellement d’un état à un autre, d’une réalité à une autre, elles vous permettront de voir l’autre côté de la montagne qui se dresse devant vous. Une métaphore, c’est la clé pour ouvrir le coffre aux trésors de vos ressources, de vos savoirs et de vos compétences cachés.

Pour être percutante et efficace, une métaphore se construit avec la personne qui est en face de vous, en observant l’état dans lequel elle est, en notant les ressources dont elle a besoin et en voyageant avec elle vers ce qu’elle désire, vers son objectif. C’est vraiment une histoire de connexion.

En fonction de la situation (deuil, conflit intérieur, acquisition de nouvelles compétences ou changement de comportement), je construis une partie de mon histoire sur une technique de PNL ou d’Hypnose avec un ingrédient spécial. Cet ingrédient est particulier pour chacun d’entre nous. Ce peut être l’Amour, l’Intention, l’Empathie ou la Relation. Le nom importe peu mais sachez que c’est lui qui  fera une différence.

Dans ce recueil, les métaphores que je partage sont réécrites de façon plus personnelle, plus poétique. L’ingrédient dont je parlais plus haut est toujours présent. L’idée est de vous faire vibrer au plus profond de vos cellules, de faire bouger quelque chose en vous de façon consciente ou inconsciente. Vous pouvez lire ces histoires en écoutant de la musique ou entouré de nature. Vous pouvez demander qu’on vous les raconte ou les raconter à quelqu’un d’autre (les enfants sont un merveilleux public). Un point important sera de poser une intention avant de lire, d’entendre ou de sentir ces histoires qui seront pour vous autant de voyages et d’aventures.

Nous sommes tous reliés et c’est l’entraide qui va transformer notre monde. Nous sommes les créateurs de notre vie. Nous sommes une multitude de vies, d’instruments ou de gens qui vibrent ensemble. Comme tous les membres d’un orchestre symphonique, nous sommes tous importants. Comme les éclats de Corie dans un bâton de pluie, vous êtes tous importants. Ensemble comme les milliards de gouttes d’eau qui forment un océan. Égales mais avec un rôle différent. Pour que le rêve devienne réalité, j’ai besoin de votre aide.

Voici les coûts pour éditer le livre

CAD$   118 Illustration 123nf

CAD$   300 Correction Emmanuelle Mozayan

CAD$   172 Infographie Gauvin

CAD$   953 Imprimerie Gauvin

CAD$   230 Frais postaux

TOTAL  1773 CAD$ pour 250 copies imprimées

  HAUT
ET BAS  

Patrick
Louche-Pelissier, fort de son expérience de voyageur, de son expertise en
Programmation Neurolinguistique (PNL) et en Hypnose, a su conjuguer la
compréhension du travail sur l’inconscient au plaisir de lire un conte ou une
histoire.
Chaque
histoire de ce livre a été conçue de manière à permettre l’ouverture à de
nouvelles pistes de compréhension. Aussi les histoires valorisent l’être
intérieur et l’invitent à trouver des solutions qui sauront rejoindre tout être
vivant dans son développement.
Je
vous invite à profiter pleinement de cette lecture et à partager, via le
conteur qui s’éveille en vous, les histoires que vous découvrirez dans les
pages suivantes.  
Les
lire pour soi ou les conter aux autres libère le bonheur du cœur !
Isabelle
David (Idcom international)
Explication
du projet
Bonjour, mon nom est Patrick LP. Je suis coach
professionnel certifié en PNL. Et je suis avant tout un accompagnateur de
voyages intérieurs. J’ai besoin de votre aide pour faire voyager mes histoires
parmi vous.
Saviez-vous que métaphore
vient du grec, et signifie transport ?
Ces métaphores vous transporteront naturellement d’un état à un autre, d’une
réalité à une autre, elles vous permettront de voir l’autre côté de la montagne
qui se dresse devant vous. Une métaphore, c’est la clé pour ouvrir le coffre
aux trésors de vos ressources, de vos savoirs et de vos compétences cachés.
Pour être percutante et efficace, une métaphore se construit avec la personne qui est en face de
vous, en observant l’état dans lequel elle est, en notant les ressources dont
elle a besoin et en voyageant avec elle vers ce qu’elle désire, vers son
objectif. C’est vraiment une histoire de connexion. 
En fonction de la situation (deuil, conflit
intérieur, acquisition de nouvelles compétences ou changement de comportement),
je construis une partie de mon histoire sur une technique de PNL ou d’Hypnose
avec un ingrédient spécial. Cet ingrédient est particulier pour chacun d’entre
nous. Ce peut être l’Amour, l’Intention, l’Empathie ou la Relation. Le nom
importe peu mais sachez que c’est lui qui 
fera une différence. 
Dans ce recueil, les métaphores que je partage sont
réécrites de façon plus personnelle, plus poétique. L’ingrédient dont je
parlais plus haut est toujours présent. L’idée est de vous faire vibrer au plus
profond de vos cellules, de faire bouger quelque chose en vous de façon consciente
ou inconsciente. Vous pouvez lire ces histoires en écoutant de la musique ou
entouré de nature. Vous pouvez demander qu’on vous les raconte ou les raconter
à quelqu’un d’autre (les enfants sont un merveilleux public). Un point
important sera de poser une intention avant de lire, d’entendre ou de sentir
ces histoires qui seront pour vous autant de voyages et d’aventures.
Nous sommes tous reliés et c’est l’entraide qui va
transformer notre monde. Nous sommes les créateurs de notre vie. Nous sommes
une multitude de vies, d’instruments ou de gens qui vibrent ensemble. Comme
tous les membres d’un orchestre symphonique, nous sommes tous importants. Comme
les éclats de Corie dans un bâton de pluie, vous êtes tous importants. Ensemble
comme les milliards de gouttes d’eau qui forment un océan. Égales mais avec un
rôle différent. Pour que le rêve
devienne réalité, j’ai besoin de votre aide.

story:
Short Summary

For the last 45 years I’ve lived an extraordinary life as an Evolutionary Gypsy. I'm going to share my own story.  An e-book about my life so far, the lessons I've learned that have allowed me to embrace my own wacky happiness. I also hope that while my book reaches other adults like me, who have not embraced their unique selves yet, that it also finds its way into the hands of adolescents or young adults, before they start trying to make themselves over in the image they think they see around them. Can you imagine the future wingnuts like us who get their uniqueness early on and don't waste valuable time trying to fit in and be normal.  They could spend that time being themselves- creating, growing, sharing and just brightening the world for all of us.

This book will include lots of now-humorous short stories including my escape from China, and being escorted to the plane by armed guards in Tahiti.. really, that was a little overkill on their part.

If we want kids to live fuller lives and express themselves in healthy ways; if we want to curb youth violence, depression and even suicide- then we need to help them change their lives.

I have spent my whole life living a lifestyle that most people only dream about. It is not out of reach for many of them, but they think it is, and so therefore don't try. At the same time, as I was growing up and always the new kid, I was harassed and bullied and teased. So, this book will serve several purposes. It will inspire people to go ahead and reach for whatever it is they want.  At the same time I hope it will help guide younger readers to stay their course-  not veer from the path they know and feel is right, but are feeling pressured to change.

What We Need & What You Get

Right now, I just need basic funding for research and development of an ebook.  I am an accomplished writer and this will be my first ebook, so I will be learning the process and formatting etc. I'm a hands-on, DIY kind of gal, an Evolutionary Gypsy characteristic. The amount I chose as a goal, combined with my own savings, covers 6 months of time and resources to put this together. This is just step one in a long process. Find me on facebook and follow the process there or here.

  • My goal is $6,000 to comfortably do this project right. I understand you don't know me- I really encourage you to check me out on facebook. That is the real me with lots of real friends whom I have actually met.  I really am a writer, speaker, coach and story-teller and I really am going to complete this project and many more that will make a difference in so many lives.
  • Funders will receive personal attention. Personal notes of thanks along with their ebook, Shout-outs for all to see and mentions in the actual book.  In the future, there will be even better perks, but right now, this is what I have to offer.
  • I'll be writing this book anyway. I have chosen a flexible payout so whatever is funded is great and appreciated and helps me immensely. If I achieve the goal and then some, the extra will be going for the next step, which is workbooks and travel for workshops and seminars, and also development of the curriculum for the school programs. That will be discussed in a future funding campaign, and I think you'll like what you hear. 

The Impact

The people who are floundering in their current lives, trying to convince themselves they are happy and the young people being bullied or who are surrounded by violence and a feeling of not-belonging, all have something in common. They haven't found themselves or hung onto themselves through their personal turmoil.  I get that. Life Lessons of an Evolutionary Gypsy is the book for them.

Other Ways You Can Help

If we want all of us to live fuller lives and express ourselves in healthy ways; if we want to curb youth violence, depression and even suicide- then we need to help change their lives.

There is no one size fits all mold anymore, if there ever was. We need to all embrace the wingnut inside of us. 

Step one is writing and publishing  the book. Other steps include workbooks and workshops for people who are looking for change. Another part is a curriculum for schools as an invited guest speaker.  

I'll share rough draft ideas and pages or blogs with you as we progress. After the book is finished and published as an ebook, I'll be speaking to groups about it and will create a series of workbooks and workshops for other evolutionary gypsies to leave the current  path and cut through the bramble over to their own, real path. But that is down the road. First step, this book. 

However, we need to get the word out. Please share this link with as many friends as you can. Post it on facebook and twitter and as many social media outlets as you happen to have access to. I will also continue to do some public speaking, even during the writing of this, and offering workshops, so feel free to book me.  In the future, when we have written materials to use for training, I'll be looking for other Evolutionary Gypsies who want to be on the front lines speaking with people and helping them one-on-one to embrace their true selves and find an outlet to express it.

I don't have a million followers or a thousand subscribers... I just have you. Together we can put something out into the world that will make a difference in so many lives and maybe even change the course of many. Join me.. get to know me... watch the process. We can do this.

story:
In September 2012, I self-published my first epic fantasy e-book, A Noble's Quest. Since then, I have published a mini-anthology of related short stories, Dawn: A dwarven story of creation.

For most authors, they do not gain a following until they have published 5-6 books. Thus, understandably, in the few short months that my first book has been available, I have not earned enough to cover the costs of continuing on with the trilogy. However, it's my dream to write, and I am hoping that you can help me achieve this goal.

First, let me provide a short blurb so you know what this is all about!

The Tamorran Empire has entered a new golden age of cooperation and wealth. But even as the citizens rejoice, long forgotten dark forces beyond Tamor's borders awaken. Although Thomas, Sarentha, and Eliza thought they had dealt with their greatest foes, worse is yet to come. Wizard Ramar Wettias hopes to unearth ancient powers to help protect Tamor, and he needs to gamble the lives of Tamor's newest heroes to succeed.

There are several costs I need covered, so I will list them in order of priority:

Editing A Wizard's Gambit = $250 (Funded! Thank you!)

Cover Art: A Noble's Quest = $500 (Funded! Amazing!)

Cover Art: A Wizard's Gambit = $500 ($445 raised so far [$65 cash donated])

Editing A Hero's Birth (final book in trilogy, hopefully done next year) = $250

Cover Art: A Hero's Birth = $500

The editing services are to be provided by RJ Blain (http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/a-wizard-s-gambit/x/3896405)

The cover art is from Harvey Bunda http://soulspline.cgsociety.org/gallery/

If I do not reach my entire goal, I will put the money aside until I can generate the rest myself to edit the books/generate cover art. Since this is a dream of mine, I will eventually get this trilogy published, but I would like to bring the books out in a timely manner for my readers. No one wants to wait years between books!

But what perks do you receive for donating to the cause?

$2 - My short story anthology, Dawn: A dwarven story of creation, as well as the following short story series. It will contain the backstory dealing with the antagonist from A Wizard's Gambit, "Demon Invasion" (working title, may change)

$5 - my first book, A Noble's Quest. If you already have it, you will receive A Wizard's Gambit when it is released. Plus the short story anthologies previously mentioned. (NEW) I will also include the digital artwork for the map from A Noble's Quest, remade by Harvey Bunda.

$10 - both books, and the short story anthologies. You will receive A Wizard's Gambit before it officially goes on sale in thanks for your generous support! (NEW) Also, anyone who donates $10 or more will receive a digital copy of the cover art for A Noble's Quest as a wallpaper.

$25 - add a poster sized print of the cover art for A Noble's Quest, once it is created by Harvey Bunda.

$50 - all three e-books from the Empire's Foundation trilogy, plus all short story anthologies I create in the meantime, and all three posters for the entire trilogy's cover art. This one is a steal!

$100 - a lifetime of e-books. I'm only 34. That's a lot of years of writing left in me, so this could wind up being a great deal! (sorry, posters not included at this level... it's already a really good deal, and I'm taking a bath with the $50 level already!)

$500 - when I bring out the books in physical form, you will get this trilogy in paperback for free, and I will sign all the copies before mailing them out to you. Plus if the books move to other formats (e.g., games, movies, etc), you can expect to get some extra stuff in the mail from those! (plus everything previously listed)

$1000 - There can be only one... number one fan. If someone out there donates at this level, you get the autographed original hand drawn map used in A Noble's Quest along with a glowing letter of my eternal gratitude. I have another series planned for after this one, and you will also get that in paperback, signed.

As previously mentioned, this project is incredibly important to me because I love to write, and I have just scratched the surface of the action, intrigue, and turmoil that my heroes will face. But I can't do this alone, and I need your help to bring this story to readers around the world.

One book won't do it. Many indie authors publish one book and get discouraged because they don't get rich quick. I want to be able to continue writing on the side for years to come, but at this moment in time that ideal is in jeopardy.

Even if you can't donate funds, you can still contribute to this campaign if you want to support my writing. Share this link, and generate interest! I don't know enough people personally to fund a project of this magnitude, so I am asking you to put the word out, and help me achieve my goal. Indiegogo provides sharing tools so we can easily reach as many people as possible.

Thank you!
