story:
The story:

Several years ago, I was a major player of Final Fantasy XI, an online Massively Multiplayer Online Role Playing Game. 

One day, while seeking information about something in the game, I found that there were novels based on the game. These novels were originally released in Japanese, but were translated to German and French, but not English.

I knew a little German and decided to order one of the German novels and proceeded to translate half of it into English (and fixed a few errors in the text as well). I tried to get Square-Enix to grant me permission to translate the whole series, but I was rejected (if anyone from SE is reading this, I'm still interested in doing that project!).

Anyway, I discovered I really liked translating German to English. I found a public domain collection of Japanese fairy tales that had been translated into German and translated that into English (so my English translation was a translation of a translation). 

My favorite story from that collection can be found at my site, which is: http://intellectualeconomy.wordpress.com/2013/06/21/the-wily-policeman/

After that, I translated a Sci-Fi novel from 1909 entitled Der Rote Komet (The Red Comet), which is about a comet (which we all know would really be a meteor) crashing to Earth in the far future and it's up to Romulus Futurus to find a way to save the Earth from impending doom.

What you are paying for:

You are paying for me to be able to work on more translation projects. For this project, I aim to translate four more novels into English. Once the deadline for this campaign passes, everyone who donates at least $2 will receive a digital copy of The Red Comet in their choice of format: ePub, .Mobi, or PDF, all DRM free (if you need your copy to be in some other format, let me know and I will see what I can do).

Currently, I am working on a translation of Der Tunnel (The Tunnel) by Bernhard Kellermann, a novel from 1913. So for the backers who purchase one of the further tiers, this would be the second novel you will receive. I do not know when it, or any other novel, will be completely translated and delivered.

As for the other three novels, I have not discovered them yet. They will be Sci-Fi novels (unless I can find a public domain novel that's not Sci-Fi that is so completely awesome I have to translate it and share it with all of you backers). I plan on using some of the funds gained from this campaign to obtain the other books written by Robert Heymann (the guy who wrote The Red Comet), as well as seeking other books worthy of being translated.

If any backers out there has any suggestions, please, don't hesitate to let me know. The only stipulations on the books have to be:

1. They have to be German.

2. They have to be public domain (published before 1923).

3. Never before translated to English.

4. Easily findable (if you have the book in a digital format, let me know, or if you know where a hard copy can be found easily).

So there we have it. If there are any questions, let me know.

As I find new novels, I intend on making it known to the backers that I've found a new book and I will send the backers an email detailing a few details about the book.

These novels were originally released in Japanese, but were translated to German and French, but not English.I knew a little German and decided to order one of the German novels and proceeded to translate half of it into English (and fixed a few errors in the text as well). I tried to get Square-Enix to grant me permission to translate the whole series, but I was rejected (if anyone from SE is reading this, I'm still interested in doing that project!).Anyway, I discovered I really liked translating German to English. I found a public domain collection of Japanese fairy tales that had been translated into German and translated that into English (so my English translation was a translation of a translation). My favorite story from that collection can be found at my site, which is: http://intellectualeconomy.wordpress.com/2013/06/21/the-wily-policeman/After that, I translated a Sci-Fi novel from 1909 entitled Der Rote Komet (The Red Comet), which is about a comet (which we all know would really be a meteor) crashing to Earth in the far future and it's up to Romulus Futurus to find a way to save the Earth from impending doom.What you are paying for:You are paying for me to be able to work on more translation projects. For this project, I aim to translate four more novels into English. Once the deadline for this campaign passes, everyone who donates at least $2 will receive a digital copy of The Red Comet in their choice of format: ePub, .Mobi, or PDF, all DRM free (if you need your copy to be in some other format, let me know and I will see what I can do).Currently, I am working on a translation of Der Tunnel (The Tunnel) by Bernhard Kellermann, a novel from 1913. So for the backers who purchase one of the further tiers, this would be the second novel you will receive. I do not know when it, or any other novel, will be completely translated and delivered.As for the other three novels, I have not discovered them yet. They will be Sci-Fi novels (unless I can find a public domain novel that's not Sci-Fi that is so completely awesome I have to translate it and share it with all of you backers). I plan on using some of the funds gained from this campaign to obtain the other books written by Robert Heymann (the guy who wrote The Red Comet), as well as seeking other books worthy of being translated.If any backers out there has any suggestions, please, don't hesitate to let me know. The only stipulations on the books have to be:1. They have to be German.2. They have to be public domain (published before 1923).3. Never before translated to English.4. Easily findable (if you have the book in a digital format, let me know, or if you know where a hard copy can be found easily).So there we have it. If there are any questions, let me know.As I find new novels, I intend on making it known to the backers that I've found a new book and I will send the backers an email detailing a few details about the book.

story:
Finishing a book means you’ve just done one-third of the work needed to get it into the marketplace and read by the public.  On-line publishing has made what used to be an almost impossible second step very easy.  But the hardest, most important step in the process still remains --  Marketing.  Getting exposure for your book to gain sales.

 

Publishers used to do that for you.  With self-publishing, the writer now needs to do it.  And that means money needs to be spent.

 

Social media is making it easier for artists and writers to find their audience, but it still takes money for the ads.  Google and Facebook will be the main conduits of advertising for “The Jesus Narrative” and I will seek to gain the highest exposure for the longest time with the money allocated.  This will help jump start the sales momentum.

 

The goal is to raise  $5000.  This will help provide several months worth of high-frequency ads so that the audience for “The Jesus Narrative” can be built.  A small portion of this money will need to be used for creating the ads.

 

For more details on "The Jesus Narrative," please visit: http://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Jesus-Narrati...

story:
UPDATE:

I've reached my goal for Book 1, and have officially begun 3 months of full time editing! All additional funds raised go toward the completion of Book 2, and the costs associated with querying high profile agents. I'm aiming high. Thank you so much for donating!

 

Excerpt:
Lightwalkers - Book One - Prologue:

Pervasive silence. And then, ever so slowly, a thin creaking noise twisted the air. He hated the creaking. Hated it more than anyone had ever hated anything--besides the cold, of course. But the creaking meant that the cold was about to get worse--that his miniscule reprieve, the icy grip of daylight, was about to vanish into the silent and even deeper cold of night.

It was hard to imagine that there was such a thing as colder. His mutated blood froze in his veins, every inch of him paralyzed on the metalized composite floor. He hated this floor. He hated the cold. He hated the creaking. He hated the dark--the endless, uninterrupted dark.

And then he saw it, through closed eyelids. Only a hint at first, but growing larger as he waited. Light. The glass door that separated the dark room from the dark corridor slid open, and a quiet shuffling taunted his sound starved ears. His eyes refused to open, but they didn’t need to. He knew what it was. Rather, who it was. Everything in him railed with fury, but still his body would not move. Not the slightest twitch. He willed the man to come closer. 5 minutes, just for 5 minutes. Even 2 minutes. Just long enough for me to thaw, you vile bastard, he ranted silently. Just long enough for me to put YOU here in a heap on the floor for the agony of eternity! The shuffling stopped.

“Evening Martinez.” The deep voice strained with the effort of speaking, catching haphazardly on the words. “I’ve brought you some company--pretty little thing,” the voice continued. “We both know you like the pretty ones.” The voice, even straining as it was, was filled with contempt. Shuffling sounds punctuated the silence that followed, before the man haltingly murmured one last phrase. “If you never leave this room, it’ll be too soon.”

Obscenities exploded in Martinez’s brain as jerky footsteps moved away from him toward the door, before being drowned out by the whoosh as the door slid shut. Silence descended with icy fury over the room.

 

Book 1

Lightwalkers is a novel about overcoming the darkness after you've lost everything - including your life. Turns out it's true: writers write what they know....

 

My Story

Four years ago I was a stunt woman. I was pretty much winning at life in all the ways that mattered. And then suddenly, I wasn't. Almost overnight, I fell mysteriously - and violently - ill. I made EVERY possible effort to get better, and to return to my stunt career, but it just hasn't been possible. Here's Plan B.

 

My Goal

I have already written a book called LIGHTWALKERS (excerpted above). What I really need is funding assistance while I finish editing, so that I can send it to my proofreader by the end of October. The first $900 will allow me to finish editing Book 1, and anything raised above that goal will go toward writing and editing Book 2 of the Trilogy (writing during NaNoWriMo in November 2013, editing Jan-March 2014).

I intend to seek representation with a major agency, and in the long term, to write a bunch of Sci Fi Adventure novels. When life gives you lemons... write books...?

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share on twitter, facebook, everywhere you can! Mention it to friends and coworkers who love science fiction too! =)

 

Stay in the Loop

If you're interested in this book series, and future books, send an email to Kali.Reigh@gmail.com and ask to be added to the email list. I'll only send one email per month (or less) unless there's a major announcement, and I'll never share or sell your information. =)

story:
THE DARK is a bimonthly e-magazine of dark fantasy and dark science fiction which will be published both online and in ebook format.

In the pages of THE DARK, you will find a different kind of dark fiction. Just that - different. And dark. Not necessarily horror, per se, with blood and guts and serial killers, but fiction that is weird and offbeat; magic realism; the fantastic; dark science fiction (and not your ordinary "robots and aliens" science fiction). No variation is off limits, and we will be encouraging our writers to take chances with their fiction.

Edited by award winning editor, Jack Fisher, every other month THE DARK will bring you a mix of dark and fantastic fiction, featuring a variety of authors—from the bestsellers and award-winners you already know to the best new voices you haven’t heard of yet. We openly welcome new and aspiring authors, and love to showcase brand new talent! We will not be a magazine that publishes only "name" authors, nor will we close our doors to unsolicited submissions! 

Our planned publication schedule every other month and will include two to four pieces of original fiction. We will also publish ebook issues, which will be available for sale in ePub format via our website and also available in other formats such as Kindle and Nook, for sale through all major vendors, including Amazon.com and barnesandnoble.com. We will also offer subscriptions to our ebook edition in a variety of formats.

Jack Fisher is the former editor of the long-running print magazine, Flesh & Blood. During his tenure as editor and publisher, Flesh & Blood went on to win the Writer's Digest Best Zine award of 2002, as well as dozens of short fiction reprints in "Best Of" anthologies, and numerous award nominations, and accolades. Jack was also an assistant editor for Francis Ford Coppolla's online zine, ZOETROPE: ALL STORY.

Jack has a Bachelor's degree in Education with a minor in English Literature. He has a deep interest in strange, bizarre, offbeat, and fantastical fiction, and THE DARK has been his brain child for two years in the making. Having been widely published in over one hundred different professional fiction markets, Jack believes that every writer deserves the chance to be published - he refuses to close his doors to just the "big names", and wants everyone to have fair consideration.

Jack lives in South New Jersey where he works in the medical field.

Risks and challenges

All of the money raised by this project will go into issue #1 and with help lifting THE DARK Magazine onto its feet, specifically the huge cost of webhosting and web design. Anything left over will go for paying authors professional rates for their work (at least 5 cents per word or more), promotion, and artwork. Anything raised above and beyond our stated goal will go toward the production of future issues of THE DARK.

story:
Project Summary

I am currently a writer, indie publisher and avid reader. I grew up in the Rocky Mountains of Colorado and a little over a year ago exchanged the Rockies for the Andes. I spent the previous year writing and teaching English in my new home in Medellin, Colombia. What I discovered in my classes is that my students had very little knowledge of their own origins and history. That spawned an idea for a historical novel series set during the Colombia’s fight for independence from Spain. There is a secondary issue that I have in mind that is a second reason for my project. Less than 5% of Colombians are regular readers. They are able to read, but simply do not do so. To me, this is a tragedy. My books are intentionally in a short (100 page), format (only about ¼” thick), so that they will be less intimidating to new readers. My project is to pay for print publishing costs of 500 books of each of the two titles to be distributed in and around Medellin and Bogotá at book fairs and other events connected with literacy and encouraging reading. This is the first step toward the ultimate goal of having all six books in the series complete, along with another historical novel based on the life of General Jose Maria Cordoba, by 2019 when Colombia celebrates her Bicentennial.

What We Need & What You Get

This is a very simple project:

  • How the funds will be used:
    • The funding goes directly to the process of printing 1000 books. $1200 doesn’t seem like much for 1000 books, but that amount goes a very long way in Colombia
    • Through distribution at book fairs and other cultural events, it allows for a great deal of exposure not only to the books, but to increase the number of new readers in Colombia.
  • What do you get for helping?
    • Any amount helps, but there are special rewards for each contribution, all contributors will be given recognition for either themselves or their business in my blog I Swallowed a Bookworm… And Choked on His Glasses and at my author’s website Bil Howard Novelist
    • Contributions between $5 and $9 (10.000 to 19.000 COP), will receive your choice of either “Zipaquirá” or “Rionegro” in electronic form in either English or Spanish. (If you live in Medellin, you can choose to wait for the printed format.)
    • For contributions between $10 and $19 (20.000 to 39.000 COP), you will receive the above under a special “Gold Contributor” title and also receive both “Zipaquirá” and “Rionegro” in electronic form in either English or Spanish. (If you live in Medellin, you can choose to wait for the printed format.)
    • Finally, for contributions of $20 (40.000 COP) or above, you will receive a listing like those above, however, under the title of “Platinum Contributor,” plus links or contact information. You will also receive an electronic copy of “Revolution” which is a full length novel that includes the two books above, plus the third in the series “Chorros Blancos”. (Contributors in Medellin can wait for the printed version of all three titles.)
  • All funds, regardless of whether or not the goal is reached, will go to the process of printing the books.

The Impact

Your contribution will help:

  • Open the door for an exciting way for Colombians to take pride in their heritage.
  • Increase the number of regular readers in Colombia.
  • Contribute to the celebration of Colombia’s Bicentennial in 2019.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute with a cash donation there are other ways to help:

  • Purchase my ebooks through my website, Smashwords or Amazon.
  • Talk to other friends or relatives that have a heart for this type of project and encourage them to contribute.
  • Promote my project on your website or blog. It is easy to do when you use the Indiegogo share tools!
I already thank you in advance for your generosity and promise that what you are doing will be multiplied many times over for several generations to come.

story:
(A detailed list of expenses is included at the end of this post.)

Hello, everybody, my name is Edward Lorn, and I’m the author of multiple novels, novellas, and short stories, including: Bay’s End, Life After Dane, and, most recently, the serial novel Cruelty, which is why we’re here today.Everything’s been going really well on the Cruelty homefront. As of right now, the series is up to episode five of ten. You can purchase these on Amazon in individual installments (all for $0.99) or altogether in the omnibus edition, Cruelty: Episodes One – Five (for the discounted price of $3.99). The final five episodes are complete and awaiting editing. And therein lies the problem.

On July 1, 2014, I presented to the hospital with right leg paralysis, as well as bowel and bladder incontinence. These were both signs that a condition I’ve suffered with since 2005—cuada equina—had returned. Nine years ago, I injured myself while lifting a patient at the hospital, where I worked at the time. The man had expired in the night. I called a code, everyone flooded in, but no one would help me get the CPR board under him, so I lifted him by myself. We ended up not saving him, and I was forever ruined for a job I truly loved to do. Doctors would later call what happened to me a “catastrophic spinal event.” Basically, disc L5 at the S1 nerve root exploded, sending bony shrapnel into the bundle of nerves above my coccyx. Nerves were pinched, some permanently damaged, and I loss the use of my right foot for six years. In 2011, Dr. Flotte, a neurologist with Coastal Neurological Institute in Mobile, Alabama, did a decompression wherein he removed a mass of scar tissue and calcification roughly the size of a soft ball from my spine. I regained the use of my right foot, and, since then, I’d been doing better, so much so that I was able to control my pain with capsaicin extract alone (that’s the oil found in hot peppers that give them their heat; its also a natural anti-inflammatory drug). Fast forward to July 1, 2014, and me in the emergency room, once again paralyzed on the right side from the waist down. This was my fourth surgery for the same issue. My previous three operations (all hemi-laminectomy discectomies of L5 at S1) were in May 2005, July 2008, and June of 2011. Yep, that’s every three years, almost to the month. Fun times were had by all. The sarcasm drips from the page...

So, how can you help me? Well, first, you need to know that I’m what the publishing industry calls a “hybrid author.” Meaning, I’m self-published as well as traditionally published (Red Adept Publishing is responsible for the publication of Life After Dane, Hope for the Wicked, and Dastardly Bastard). Cruelty is one of my independent releases, and although the serial sells rather well, nothing creates revenue as well as a new release. I have plenty of money for me and my family to live on, but I had to use my publishing budget (all five grand of it) to pay for in-patient physical therapy, some rather outrageously-overpriced pain medicine, and odd electronic treatments. In summation, I don’t have enough left over in my budget to pay for editing and proofreading, two things that are aboslutely mandatory in my eyes. Secondly, you should know that royalties from my published works is my only source of income. I don’t have a “9-to-5”, unless you consider me sitting around talking to myself all day everyday a “day job.” Trust me, I realize how lucky I am to call my favorite pastime a career. Thirdly, I’m obligated to finish Cruelty. My fans have been good to me, and they deserve to know how this story ends. So I come to you today to ask you—beg you, really—to help fund the publication of A Final Act of Cruelty.

I’m available to answer any and all questions you have. I am also willing to offer free copies of Cruelty: Episode One to anyone who requests one, but the series doesn’t really hit its stride until Episode Three. In other words, the first episode, while essential to the plot, is not the episode I would judge the entire series on. The rabbit hole goes much, much deeper.

Please, do not hesitate to contact me with any questions and concerns you might have. Hopefully, together, we can see the end of Cruelty.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

E.

Rundown of Expenses:

Professional Content and Line Editing: 90,000 words at a rate of $0.01 a word = $900.00

Proofreading: Three rounds of proofreading at $60 a pop = $180.00

Professional Formatting: $200

Total: $1280.00

Any amount over the goal of $1280.00 will go toward the formatting costs of the final hardcover omnibus edition,Cruelty: The Complete Novel, and publishing two other completed projects I have waiting in the wings: Fog Warning (A Novella) and Others & Oddities (A Short Story Collection).

suffered with since 2005—cuada equina—had
returned. Nine years ago, I injured myself while lifting a patient at the
hospital, where I worked at the time. The man had expired in the night. I called a code, everyone flooded in, but no
one would help me get the CPR board under him, so I lifted him by myself. We
ended up not saving him, and I was forever ruined for a job I truly loved to do. Doctors
would later call what happened to me a “catastrophic spinal event.” Basically,
disc L5 at the S1 nerve root exploded, sending bony shrapnel into the bundle of
nerves above my coccyx. Nerves were pinched, some permanently damaged, and I
loss the use of my right foot for six years. In 2011, Dr. Flotte, a neurologist
with Coastal Neurological Institute in Mobile, Alabama, did a decompression wherein he removed a mass of
scar tissue and calcification roughly the size of a soft ball from my spine. I regained the use of my right foot, and, since then, I’d been doing better, so much so that I was able to control my pain with capsaicin extract alone
(that’s the oil found in hot peppers that give them their heat; its also a
natural anti-inflammatory drug). Fast forward to July 1, 2014, and me in the
emergency room, once again paralyzed on the right side from the waist down.
This was my fourth surgery for the same issue. My previous three operations (all hemi-laminectomy discectomies of L5 at S1) were in May 2005, July 2008, and June of 2011. Yep, that’s every three years,
almost to the month. Fun times were had by all. The sarcasm drips from the page...
So, how can you help me? Well, first, you need to know that
I’m what the publishing industry calls a “hybrid author.” Meaning, I’m self-published
as well as traditionally published (Red Adept Publishing is responsible for the
publication of Life After Dane, Hope for
the Wicked, and Dastardly Bastard).
Cruelty is one of my independent releases,
and although the serial sells rather well, nothing creates revenue as well as a
new release. I have plenty of money for me and my family to live on, but I had
to use my publishing budget (all five grand of it) to pay for in-patient physical therapy, some
rather outrageously-overpriced pain medicine, and odd electronic treatments. In summation, I don’t have enough
left over in my budget to pay for editing and proofreading, two things that are aboslutely mandatory in my eyes. Secondly, you should know that royalties from my published works is my only source of income. I don’t
have a “9-to-5”, unless you consider me sitting around talking to myself all
day everyday a “day job.” Trust me, I realize how lucky I am to call my favorite
pastime a career. Thirdly, I’m obligated to finish Cruelty. My fans have been good to me, and they deserve to know how
this story ends. So I come to you today to ask you—beg you, really—to help fund the publication of A Final Act of Cruelty.
I’m available to answer any and all questions you have. I am
also willing to offer free copies of Cruelty:
Episode One to anyone who requests one, but the series doesn’t really hit
its stride until Episode Three. In
other words, the first episode, while essential to the plot, is not the episode
I would judge the entire series on. The rabbit hole goes much, much deeper.
Please, do not
hesitate to contact me with any questions and concerns you might have. Hopefully, together, we can
see the end of Cruelty. 
Thank you for your time and consideration.
E.
Rundown of Expenses:
Professional Content and Line Editing: 90,000 words at a rate of $0.01 a word = $900.00
Proofreading: Three rounds of proofreading at $60 a pop =
$180.00
Professional Formatting: $200
Total: $1280.00
Any amount over the goal of $1280.00 will go toward the formatting costs of the final hardcover omnibus edition,Cruelty: The Complete Novel, and publishing
two other completed projects I have waiting in the wings: Fog Warning (A Novella) and
Others & Oddities (A Short Story Collection).

story:
Our Story

Project REDSOKS is a 17-year old Fine Art Nude Photo project dedicated to Gia Carangi(former supermodel) 1960-1986 who inspires us.

The purpose of this project is to use strength in nudity from women to raise attention,eyebrows,awareness,in any way we can to get people to TALK about HIV/Aids in a positive way.

RED being the color we use to represent AIDS and the nudity we use in a NON-sexual way and a show of strength that women have even when you would THINK they would be vulnerable...naked except for SOKS.

Never underestimate the power of a NUDE woman!

See much more at www.projectredsoks.com (though it's respectful to women ...keep the kiddies away)

 


The Impact

Some of the over 165+ models who posed to date for this project have NEVER posed nude before or since but DID for us and this worthy cause. THAT is strong all by itself!

 Gia was fearless in that way too and some of these women did it for her cause of raising awareness alone. Either way...people ARE talking at our shows and events and online to us directly about Hiv/Aids and about Gia. We welcome this conversation!



What We Need & What You Get

What we really need is in the neighborhood of 5000. for the publication and advertising of the book for which we have over 300 images we can choose from! We are asking for half of that to get us going in the right direction.

ALL who donate 10.00 or more will receive mention IN THE BOOK and for those special donors..we will include a copy of the book limited edition and signed by the photographer.

First person to donate 1,000. will receive as a bonus...the ORIGINAL soks the first 20 women in the project WORE!(washed and slightly faded but still here)


Other Ways You Can Help

WORD OF MOUTH always helps to get people to come to the site and buy prints.TELL everyone PLEASE!

We are also looking for sponsors...such as Sock companies or Condom company who will also feature their product.(Socks at the shoots and shows ...condoms at the shows!)

We also welcome any individual as a sponsor as well. We will work out the details of showing our appreciation.

story:
Short Summary

  • Hi, I'm Mike.  Created to be a son of the living God. Husband to my stunningly gorgeous and all-around amazing wife Becca. Father to two mind-blowingly awesome kids under the age of 4: Micah and Josiah Talon...with one more on the way. Currently a pastor at River of Life in Tolland, CT (near UConn). Primary area of oversight for the last several years: a youth movement called The Rising. Work from home helping people with their health and finances. Graduated from ORU - BA in Theology/Youth Ministry.  Wrote a niche book - youth ministry sketches that aren't lame - in 2005. It's on Amazon.

    Dennis Cramer told me in early 2010 that I would write a book for the Kingdom of God. #iamholy is it.

  • This book is about everything "I am" (holy, loved, happy, victorious, passionate, powerful, humble) because of Jesus, the great "I AM"

    #iamholy is not arrogance.  It's not even self-esteem.  Every time I've tried to improve my "self," I've ultimately failed.  In fact, without God, I'll always fail.

    The good news is I am not currently, nor will I ever be again, without God! 

  • Everywhere we've shared this message, there has been an awakening. Teens and adults alike are starting to live victorious over life's circumstances.  I believe contributors to this project will help spark a widespread movement.  People all over the place will begin to move from defeat to victory, from periods of discouragement and depression to unshakeable joy, from unbelief to confidence, from questioning God to resting secure in the truth that He is always good.

    The main audience for #iamholy is Christians who are frustrated with the difference between what the Bible promises and our current reality.  However, there also looks to be a response from curious atheists as well as skeptical legalists.

  • If any of this resonates with you, please consider taking part in this project.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Publishing costs include: formatting, editing, proofreading, copyright, registration, obtaining ISBN number, distribution, design, website, reviews, shipping materials, and an initial printing of around 1000 copies.

    My team believes $6000 will cover these costs completely. The more      money that gets raised, the higher quality the final product will be...and the more copies we can initially print.

  • We tried to be as creative as possible with perks.  I understand some people will want to donate anonymously, which is fine - but please be encouraged to embrace an earthly reward along with the treasure in Heaven.  It's fun!

 

  • Every donation receives the perk(s) for that level...as well as all the lower levels!  (For example, a $50 donation will get the perks for $50, $25, $15, and $5).

The Impact

 

  • Again, I can't put to words how this new perspective has changed my life, my marriage, our ministry...and the revival is starting to spread.  I really get the sense that God has big plans for this book. 

 

  • Feel free to contact me via email or Twitter (MikeMass1) if you want further clarfication or some examples of people whose lives are already beginning to change.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Pray!  I would love to connect with a literary agent who operates with excellence and integrity - but God is ultimately the One who is going to help get the word out.

 

  • Share this project - facebook, youtube, text, email, walking down Main St wearing a sandwich board - any way you can spread the word would be hugely beneficial.

story:
Print Books Are Shipping and Shipping Budgets: Updated August 3, 2015

The print shipments of The Incredible Untold Story of Sailor Moon began approximately a month ago and are continuing gradually.  We are contending with a budgeting issue as domestic shipping via UPS and USPS is running 200% to 300% more expensive than we budgeted.   For example, the last two books we shipped ran an average of more than $21.00 each.  The crowdfunding campaign budgeted $5 for shipping.   This means we're facing an overall shortfall of at least $1500.  

Funds to cover those additional costs are being pulled from other Palace in the Sky projects, which has delayed shipping past our target dates.

We sent an e-mail to everyone who participated in the crowdfunding campaign and numerous customers from our bookstore asking if anyone would be willing to help us offset the additional costs, but we only received one reply.

At this point all we can do is work our way through it.  If your book has not yet arrived, rest assured we are working as hard as we can to deliver it as soon as possible.

We are still sending address confirmations and you will also receive an e-mail immediately after your book ships.

Please note the sablewolf.net domain has been shut down in lieu of a possible future publishing project to be announced.  Visit @sailrmoonuntold on Twitter or http://ladystar.net for the latest news.

Shipping Confirmations Update June 12, 2015

If you ordered a PRINT book or were awarded one as part of a perk, please check your e-mail for your shipping address confirmation and respond if your address is out of date.  For further details, please visit @sailrmoonuntold on Twitter and http://sablewolf.net/moongame

Short Summary

My name is Theodore Jefferson.  I am an author, journalist, and a former marketing consultant for DIC Entertainment.  Myself and my editor, Larissa Kayne, have been considering writing a nonfiction book about Sailor Moon for some time.

I have been studying the Sailor Moon phenomenon for over fifteen years.  I believe there is much more to the characters, its creator, the show and the manga series than most people believe, whether they work in the entertainment business or not. 

I plan to explain to my readers why this show has been overlooked, and why at the same time it may very well have been the foundation upon which a fifty billion dollar animation legacy rests.

After the characters' 20th anniversary and the release of the new anime series, we think it's time the unbelievable true story of Sailor Moon's journey from Japan to the United States was told.

Contributions to this book project will help us meet and interview the people who worked to bring this world-famous television series to English-speaking audiences, and let you hear their story in their words.


What We Need & What You Get

The primary expense for this project is the cost of interviews.  Each interview requires many hours of preparation and coordination.  All will need to be transcribed.  Some will need to be translated.  Some may require travel.  All of the material will need to be written in a manner that makes it informative and entertaining.

Our perks are unique and exciting!  All our contributors get their name in the book and can suggest a question for our interviewees.  Some can reserve the ebook.  Some can get the print version.  Higher level contributions can be credited as Associate Editors and recommend interviewees. 

We also have a series of one-time perks for those who wish to join our Pantheon of Heroes and claim featured pages!  The base goal will give us what we need to do three interviews.  We will launch a stretch goal for each additional interview.  We also plan an audiobook combination stretch goal and perk after the print and ebook version goals are reached.


Stretch Goals:

If we reach $4000, we will make an audiobook version.  Perks for the audiobook will be added after we reach $2000.

The book begins with three interviews.  For every $500 donated after the $2000 goal, we will add a bonus interview.



The Impact

Sailor Moon changed the world.  There is no doubt about that.  Many of her fans are not aware of just how important their favorite character was 20 years ago and how important she is today. 

This book will connect the dots in ways that will inspire you.  No matter how devoted a fan you are, this book will teach you things you don't know about Sailor Moon.  Everyone who reads our book will be surprised by just how influential this animated series really is.  I've written numerous books, and many of them have had considerable success.  None of them have provided me this volume of research.  I have a truly immense selection of information sources for this project. I'm really looking forward to putting what I know into words.  I think you'll agree it was worth our shared effort.


Risks & Challenges

There is little risk the book won't get written if we only reach a portion of our goal.  The quality and completeness of the book, however, is totally dependent on reaching our goal and hopefully exceeding it!

Some of the people we want to interview won't be available.  That is unavoidable.  However, for every interview we can't do, there will be one we can. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to our campaign, but you still want to see this project succeed, please make as much noise about us as you can.  Find other fans and invite them to join us.  It will take fewer than six dozen people to make this book a reality and get us started on our fourth interview.

Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools as well!

Updates
Here is a proposed list of chapters (in publication order) Copyright 2014 Theodore Jefferson:
  • C'est La Vie is Japanese for Superhero
  • Five is a Magic Number: Nakayoshi, TV Asahi and The Golden Age
  • The Fuse is Lit: Nine Hundred Million Reasons To Read Backwards
  • Never Running from a Real Fight: The Deal
  • Grain Futures Don't Sell Action Figures: Syndication
  • Save Our Sailors: The Internet Wars
  • Clash of the Titans: Carl Icahn Defeats the Negaverse
  • The Lewis and Clark of Anime: How a Card Game Vanquished Denmark
  • This One Goes Out To All The Ladies: Toonami and The Silver Age
  • The Wait is Over: Sailor Moon Saves the World
  • Along Came a Spider: What a Difference Forty Years Makes
  • Honors and Privileges: Italian Sports Cars and a Plush Toy Cat
  • That's Teamwork: My Little Incredibles
  • Avenged: The Senshi Initiative
  • Forty Billion Dollar Tiara: From Princess to Empress
  • The Undiscovered Country: The Queen has Returned

story:
My best friend Kelly and I have been planning on backpacking around Europe for 3 months in the summer of 2015 after we graduate college for years now- and it's less than a year away now and I could really use some help funding it. We're both working full time and have been saving for a while now, but this is a lot of money to save up working minimum wage jobs.

This is our last hurrah before joining The Real World, and we're trying to get in as much as we can before we're anchored down by jobs, leases, paying back student loans, and everything that comes with being a college graduate.  

This trip is going to be an incredible and life changing experience, something that we will remember for the rest of our lives, and something that will help us grow as people and change our lives!  We're both planning on trying to write journals and blog posts about our experiences, and even make video blogs to share with the world! 

If you are capable of sparing just a few dollars or want to help me out, I would appreciate it so much, I can't even express my gratitude. Any amount would help- even $5 could buy food for a day while we're over there, and $20 could pay for a place to sleep at night.

Any donations would be going towards lodging and food while we're in Europe and my plane ticket and rail pass.

All together, this trip is going to cost about $6000 or $7000 and any assistance would be amazing.

I know there are obviously a million other causes out there that are so much more important than this, and it seems trivial to be asking for money to travel the world, I recognize that and I agree wholeheartedly- this is immensely unimportant in the scheme of things, But if you have any money to spare and feel like this is worth a dollar or two, it would really help my dreams come true, and I don't think there's any harm in putting this out there, even if no one donates. 

Thank you so much for even reading!

story:
THE ZINE

Welcome to the first edition of This Heart Is Homebound: a compilation zine on toxic beginnings, non-traditional upbringings, and redefining family. 

Like most epiphanies, the idea for this zine became clear after countless midnight conversation and years of going around and around in circles around the heart of the issue: what does family really look like?

We've all seen the images of family put forth by western media: solidly middle class, married heterosexual parents, 2.5 kids, loving by sternly moral. For those of us growing up in abusive families, we had to wonder: are we the only ones carrying this pain? For those of us growing up in cultures and traditions not represented by western television, we wondered: are we the only ones not conforming to this structure? For those of us coping with death, abandonment, deportation, or incarceration of a family member, we wondered: are we the only ones being told our family as it exists is not whole? For those of us starting from scratch in adulthood to build our own chosen family, we wondered: are we the only ones struggling to redefine family?

This zine includes submissions from all over the country and the world exploring the concepts of home through essays, poetry, comics, and art. We hope that our readers find in these pages some seeds of hope, of inspiration, of solidarity, of belonging. But most of all, we hope you find SUPPORT.

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET



We intend to provide a FREE postage-paid copy of this zine to each of our wonderful sixteen submitters. In order to do this, we will be taking pre-orders for our zine through this IndieGoGo campaign. We are charging $6 for a copy, which will break down as follows:

  • $3 - goes toward actually printing your zine (over 50 pages!!) with full color art
  • $1 - goes toward shipping anywhere in the US (more $ for international buyers)
  • $2 - goes toward paying for free copies for each of our submitters
Ultimately, we aim to raise around $200 to cover all printing and shipping costs for our submitters and fundraising supporters alike. IndieGoGo requires a $500 fundraising goal minimum, so any money raised beyond that goal will go toward fulfilling campaign perks and providing zine libraries across the country with free copies of This Heart Is Homebound for their collections.

Please keep in mind, this campaign is a FUNDRAISER. If you aren't able to put up $6 for a zine, don't worry! After this campaign has concluded, we will be selling copies of This Heart Is Homebound online for the $4 base price.

We're offering other perks as well! Pledge $1 to show your support and receive a digital copy of this publication, or $25 for a "Curator Special," which will include two comics by Kayla Arcata, two poetry zines by Patience Young, and a copy of This Heart Is Homebound shipped straight to your door!

Once this campaign has concluded, we will be posting up all finance and funding information on our blog for community transparency. Our blog can be found at thisheartishomebound.wordpress.com. 


THE IMPACT

We hope that by creating this zine and starting this conversation we will be able to build a treasure trove of resources for folks like us who don't identify with the standard definition of home and family. Our goal with this zine is to create a support network of writers, artists, and readers who can explore and find ways to cope with these issues.

This is an ongoing project that will include future issues and local performance events. As we raise funds and awareness, we hope to one day take This Heart Is Homebound on the road and create platforms for people to host their own This Heart Is Homebound events in their communities. 

SHOW YOUR SUPPORT

If you don't have the funds but you'd like to show your support, please share this campaign on social media and tell your friends about us! We could use all the help we can get <3

story:
ABOUT ME: I’m Leonardo--a truth and love seeking passionate book lover. My book “We Can Lift Each Other Up, Higher and Higher” is a collection—one page for each day of the year-- of beautiful thoughts, poems, songs, stories, inspiration, affirmations, humor, profound observations, and healing techniques garnered from saints, seers, mystics, radicals, and sages.

When I realized in my twenties (now 72) that I was asleep, with little understanding of love, truth, or consciousness, my goal became to awaken and be truly alive which involved learning to be present, uncovering essence, understanding my unconscious and dealing with negative emotions. I had a lot to learn and am still learning and what I’ve learned is to keep learning.

Have had several occupations: movie theater owner, newspaper publisher, restaurant, construction, painting, Limousine, taxi. Blessed with four children: Crystal, Bliss, Adam, Hope; two grandchildren: Madeline, Liam; great friends most notably Beriah Wall.

As I waltzed through these various incarnations, I kept a journal and read in pursuit of love and truth, always noting what I found interesting, inspiring, enlightening.

Eventually realized there is a light within all of us to which we can connect with persistent study.

We’re in the midst of a global awakening provoking an inner movement transforming the world in a positive direction. Your support will help you and others to discover the wonders awaiting us if we persist in our search for love and truth. One of the prerequisites of accessing higher spiritual planes is to assist others to rise. Together we can lift each other up higher and higher.

Embroidered Peace Hat


PURPOSE: My book will help open doors within, put a smile of understanding on your face and touch your heart to help you transform into a being of pure light that can serve all living creatures simultaneously and eternally.

We’re all in this together. We are one. We’re all brothers and sisters. With the love of the Universe, I dedicate and share with you thoughts and words that will bring love, peace, harmony, and help you experience the joy of living on the path toward unconditional love.

Great tee shirt!


IMAGINE as John Lennon said and give peace and love a chance. Get on the love train—let’s have a love revolution. Together we can lift each other up higher and higher.

Since I don’t have a recognizable name, it’s been difficult finding a publisher. With a well-known name attached, publishers would be excited about “We Can Lift Each Other Up, Higher and Higher.” When published, sales will be strong, because there are many out there who realize we are on the brink of a new world where people join together and open their minds and hearts and foster unity in contrast to the evil forces of separation that scare us, divide us and start one war after another. 

A major publisher—RedWheel+Weiser+Conari will publish “We Can Lift Each Other Up, Higher and Higher” for $7,500. They will put it in their catalog, on Amazon, etc. If it sells 2,500 copies they will give me a book contract or I could go with Hay House for about the same money.

GOAL: $14,600: 

$7,500 Red Wheel+Weiser+Conari (Publisher)

$2,500 text editing

$1000 Graphic design

$1000 Perks

$2,000 Fees (Indegogo & PayPal)

$600 Computer update


 Warm embroidered micro flex pullover 

As contributor to the publication of "We Can Lift Each Other Up, Higher and Higher" you will be helping to reverse the trend of separation and bring people together by direction them to guides who will open up anew world of understanding __ assisting people to see with love and delight, discovering the light within, fostering mindfulness, and profoundly experiencing the joy of living.

Questions: Email leonarddubrow@yahoo.com

CHECKS: Indiegogo says its ok to accept checks—if you’d like to pay by check my address is 1109 East Manchester Road, Manchester Center, Vermont 05255

Your help will be greatly appreciated. Please share this Indiegogo campaign. Keep your love alive.

The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness. MONTAIGNE

TRY VIEWING EVERYONE WHO COMES INTO YOUR LIFE AS A TEACHER. Wayne Dyer

                                            THE OPTIMISTS CREED

1. TO BE SO STRONG THAT NOTHING CAN DISTURB YOUR PEACE OF MIND.

2. TO TALK HEALTH, HAPPINESS, AND PROSPERITY TO EVERY PERSON YOU MEET.

3. TO MAKE ALL YOUR FRIENDS FEEL THAT THERE IS SOMETHING WORTHWHILE IN THEM.

4. TO LOOKAT THE SUNNY SIDE OF EVERYTHING AND MAKE YOUR OPTIMISM COME TRUE.

5. TO THINK ONLY THE BEST, TO WORK ONLY FOR THE BEST AND TO EXPECT ONLY THE BEST.

6. TO BE JUST AS ENTHUSIASTIC ABOUT THE SUCCESS OF OTHERS AS YOU ARE ABOUT YOUR OWN.

7. TO FORGET THE MISTAKES OF THE PAST AND PRESS ON TO THE GREATER ACHIEVMENTS OF THE FUTURE.

8. TO WEAR A CHEERFUL EXPRESSION AT ALL TIMES AND GIVE A SMILE TO EVERY LIVING CREATURE YOU MEET.

9. TO GIVE SO MUCH TIME TO IMPROVING YOURSELF THAT YOU HAVE NO TIME TO CRITICIZE OTHERS.

10. TO BE TOO LARGE FOR WORRY, TOO NOBLE FOR ANGER, TOO STRONG FOR FEAR, AND TOO HAPPY TO PERMIT THE PRESENCE OF TROUBLE.

11. TO THINK WELL OF YOURSELF AND TO PROCLAIM THIS FACT TO THE WORLD NOT IN LOUD WORDS, BUT IN GREAT DEEDS.

12. TO LIVE IN THE FAITH THAT THE WHOLE WORLD IS ON YOUR SIDE, SO LONG AS YOU ARE TRUE TO THE BEST WITHIN YOU.

                  CHRISTIAN D. LARSON (1874-1954) New Thought Leader

                           Fear Not - - Judge Not -- Resist Not

THR RIGHT QUOTE CAN INSPIRE PEOPLE TO CHANGE THEIR WAYS.

As rare as true love is, true friendship is rarer. LaRochefould

We need 4 hugs a day for survival. We need 8 hugs a day for maintenance. We need 12 hugs a day for growth.  VIRGINIA SATIR

Look at the rain long enough, with no thoughts in your head, and you gradually feel your body falling loose, shaking free of the world of reality. Rain has the power to hypnotize.    HARUKI MURAKAMI

Too much sanity may be madness and the maddest of all to see life as it is and not how it should be.     MIGUEL de CERVANTES

High beings can have the most incredibly beautiful sex imaginable because their hearts are open, which most people having sex in this culture don’t experience. RAM DASS

You have to believe in yourself—that’s the secret. I had the exuberance that comes from utter confidence in yourself.   CHARLIE CHAPLIN

“The words that enlighten the soul are more precious than jewels.”Hazrat Khan

“I think that quotations from great thinkers can profoundly affect one’s life.” Norman Vincent Peale

“Ideas are the mightiest influences on earth. One great thought breathed into a man may regenerate him.” William Channing

“Great thoughts reduced to practice become great acts.” William Hazlit

PLATO: “Serious things can only be understood through laughable things.”

story:
Who Am I?

Oh, hey there! I’m Kelly Mathews, and I am the founder and baker at Pop Up Pastries!

With Pop Up Pastries, I create treats that showcase local, seasonal, and all natural ingredients. I go to the Santa Monica Farmer’s Market every week and let myself be inspired by whatever is in season or tastes or looks interesting to me. I use my market treasures to make pies, jams, crostatas, tarts, and so many other kinds of delicious treats that I share with my family and friends.

And then, in July of this year, I started Pop Up Pastries so I could share my creations with the world!

I launched Pop Up Pastries through bake sales on Instagram and Facebook where I would sell my tarts to my followers. My tarts have a buttery, flaky crust filled with my homemade jams and flavor combinations that are creative, fun and change seasonally to showcase whatever fruit is at it’s peak.



What's Next?

The tarts were a hit! So I started making them available through my website for local delivery and shipping nationwide.  And while online business is now doing very well, I am looking to push Pop Up Pastries on to the next level.  That means doing exactly what the name states - I want to start really Popping Up!

In 2015, I want to take my pastries on the road and share them with as many people as I can at events, conferences, and Farmer’s Markets.  I want to have a physical location where I can meet and talk to the people who love my treats, spread the sugary love, and share my story with all of Los Angeles (and beyond!).

Pop Up Pastries has already been invited to participate in two potentially huge Pop Ups - Artisanal LA’s holiday market and the LA Cookie Con and Sweets Show.  While I am thrilled to be included in such a long list of talented vendors, there are a large amount of expenses that come along with transforming from an online store to a mobile business that is equipped to participate in events like these ones.

All together, my initial Pop Up launch is expected to cost $6000.  As a teeny tiny, just-started business, I simply don’t have the funds yet to make it happen all on my own.


You Can Help!

A pledge to my campaign would help launch Pop Up Pastries from an online web stand to a real, live, in person Pop Up event.  While a launch of this type is significantly less costly than opening a brick and mortar location, many of the same expenses arise when changing from an online business to a mobile one.

Your pledge will help me pay for:

  • licensing, event fees and permits
  • event set-up (tables, a tent, coolers, display cases, etc)
  • branding and publicity
  • kitchen rent and equipment
  • delicious farmer's market fresh produce
  • gas for deliveries
  • peanut butter M&Ms and cherry coke for late night tart baking
  • ingredients, supplies, packaging, labeling...
  • and so much more!!
This campaign being funded would give Pop Up Pastries the funds to make the giant leap toward becoming the bakery of my dreams!


What You Get

I’ve arranged rewards such as discount codes, packs of treats, tarts for your office and friends, a personal dessert cooking class with myself (plus wine!), and even a lavish private dinner for you and a friend prepared by myself and my husband (chef Brad Mathews - he’s a professional, you guys. check out his latest project, Cadet.)

Oh yea, you'll also get the chance to come visit me at all of these awesome events and markets I'll be Popping Up at around LA (and who knows where else)! How much cooler does it get than that??

Thank You!

Lastly, thank you from the very bottom of my heart for your interest in being a part of the expansion of my pastry business.  Getting Pop Up Pastries up and running with a physical location where I can hear stories of how my treats were present for celebrations of weddings, new babies, birthdays or families coming together - that is my dream!

I also wanted to say that no matter what happens with the outcome of this campaign, I will never lose hope.  I plan on doing whatever it takes to make 2015 a very big year in the Pop Up Pastries world, because the world needs more of these pastries!

With your pledge of support, my hope is that Pop Up Pastries will be Popping Up near you very, very soon!

Stay tuned!

Hello all!

My name is Taylor and I am an aspiring writer and poet. I have spent over a year working on my story entitled Man, Uprooted. It tells the story of Llewelyn [Lou-Ellen] Greylyn-Brown: the last surviving human in any city on earth. The story is inspired by novelist Kurt Vonnegut and Canadian poets Michael Turner (Hardcore Logo) and Michael Ondaatje. The story is told as a narrative poem by a Bard 0710, an incorporeal bardic bureaucrat, in other works, he is a spirit who's day job consists of studying a species' experiences and filling away those experiences in this Bardic Institution. Bard 0710 was assigned to capture Llewelyn's story from his near death experience in an office building to his Northern escapade in search of supernatural powers until his return to an empty city with no signs as to what happened or where everyone went.

I am in need of a month of working time to finish writing and editing, and produce a hard copy. I am setting the funding goal at $3,000. If funding is successful the books will be available to the public by October/November 2014. If the funding is not successful the backers will still receive a copy of the book once it is finished but will have to wait until Winter 2014.  

TL;DR: give me money and read a sweet book!

story:
What is Odd One Out?

Odd One Out magazine hones in on the normal, everyday people and their stories. Stories that rarely get heard or written. In each issue we focus on the contemporary generation whose uniqueness reflects the joy and colour that comes from living in Malaysia. We explore the line between foreign and familiar, and discover from each person to the next, how much of their journey feels relatable and familiar, or foreign and inaccessible to us as a reader. This is how powerful storytelling can be, to be able to cut through pre-conceived notion perpetuated from abstractions or a single loose statement. There’s more than just a single story to a person or a place. Malaysia itself is a country beyond the beautiful sand and beaches, with many untold narratives by its people. Each Malaysian individual is nuanced and are compelling characters in their own right and these are their stories.

This is what Odd One Out is truly about: placing people who are the heart and soul of our lives in the spotlight. We hope to shift perceptions and make people realize that there’s more than meets the eye and that stories are often comprised of several beautiful shades of multicoloured layers.

Here are a few spreads from Issue 1.


What your donations will go towards.

The magazine will be offered twice a year with all articles written in English. It will be in a format of 170mm x 240mm with roughly 168 pages. 

Your contribution and support will help us with:

  • covering the cost of printing the first issue
  • to cover the cost of shipping
  • and to cover all cost of the Indiegogo rewards and postage
Your pledges will help to bring our magazine into full production. If we manage to reach our goal all extra funding will go into our future issues and help us secure the future of Odd One Out magazine.

List of your Rewards & Incentives



Issue Zero

For those pledging 15 dollars, you will receive our 12 page Issue zero promotional zine.



Limited Edition Tote Bag

In the package for GOODIES GALORE, you will be rewarded with our limited edition Indiegogo-only tote bag.


Custom Key Tags

Not only that, you will also receive a custom made Odd One Out key tag made exclusively for the magazine.


Photo Prints


Any backers pledging 50 dollars or more will also have the opportunity to select either one of the photo above (either A or B), taken from Odd One Out's photo outtakes, to be received as a 12" by 8" photo print. Printed on quality luster paper, each print is numbered and stamped for authenticity.



Letterpress Cards

In the LETTERPRESS LOVE package, you will also receive a set of 2 letterpress cards above. Each piece of letterpress card is carefully handcrafted by The Alphabet Press. The team is dedicated in preserving the art of letterpress so each card is created with the utmost care and attention. All pieces created by The Alphabet Press is proudly crafted in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.



Polymer Clay Bead Necklace

For backers pledging 150 dollars or more, you will receive one of the exclusive handmade polymer clay necklace above. Each necklace is designed and handmade by the Odd One Out team themselves. Since each necklace is handmade, no two pieces are exactly similar. So in the nature of the material, some small imperfections are likely but adds all the more to the handmade charm.

Risks & Challenges


We've been hard at work since the last few months and is absolutely determined in getting this magazine out to print. But considering the risks involved in print publishing, our major concern and reservations mostly lies with being able to completely sell out our stock for the first issue which would make facilitating future issues immensely challenging.

Having said that, we remain resolute in our commitments to this magazine, and is optimistic that should this campaign be a success, we are able to generate enough interest and awareness for the magazine. 

Other potential challenges would be the delays from printers and getting the rewards together so that they are all shipped on time. But through  due diligence and careful planning that we've put into preparing this campaign, we're confident that we are able to keep this delay to a minimum.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate any help and support we can get. So do help us get the word out for our magazine by tweeting, blogging, FB posting, any form of social network sharing or simply by word of mouth. Thank you!

story:
Vietnam Caves

The book is part of my travel collection books, and is a highly visible guide to some of the caves and attractions in Vietnam. The book shows you in detail what to expect of each place covered. This information with over 350 photographs is not available in other books, and dispels many misconceptions of these places, as well as guiding people in deciding if a place is worth a visit or not, including how much time to allocate for a place.

I did a month long motorcycle ride through Vietnam, starting from Saigon (Ho Chi Minh), all the way up to Hanoi, then back down by train. I visited each place personally, and the tips and information I gained from vising these places are in this book. Each place have accurate GPS coordinates, including how to get to it yourself without a guide. Entry fees are given where applicable.

All donations go towards help in sorting through the over 3500 pictures I have, touching those up that are selected, resizing them for the book, extracting GPS location and verifying the correctness of the data. Also, cover design, editing and proof reading, as well as advertising once the book is released.

Time period of book release will be end of August 2014.

The book will be available in digital form, on both Amazon and my website, and in both color and black and white print.

This is my 15th book, and I am currently backpacking Asia and going for my dream as a full time writer, after resigning in January where i worked for seven years as a technical dive instructor in Cayman Islands.

For more information about my other books and me, see www.antonswanepoelbooks.com

Sites covered in the book are:
Hanoi
Perfume Pagoda / Huong Pagoda/ Chùa Hương

Hoa Lu, Ancient Capital of Vietnam

Phong Nha-Kẻ Bàng National Park
Paradise cave Paradise cave - Dong Thiên Đường
Dark Cave - Hang Toi

Dong Tien Son Cave

Memorial building

Khe San

Helicopter museum

Hoi An
Vinahouse Restaurant and Museum
River ride

Khâm Đức

Statue of Uncle Ho

Da Lat
Da lat City
Thủy Tạ Restaurant on the lake
Xuan Huong Lake in Da Lat
Yersin park.
Prenn waterfall

Dak Mar
Pagoda in Dak mar

Dak Ha
Dak Ha Victory Monument

Rang Dong Vang Wine Castle

Train ride between Saigon and Hanoi
